    16                                  ;Note: This code is a part of Retro DOS 4.0 kernel source code
    17                                  ;     (as included binary, 'IOSYS5.BIN') 
    18                                  ;     Equivalent of MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE and BIOSDATA and SYSINIT
    19                                  ;						        (except MSLOAD code)  
    20                                        
    21                                  ;------ Retro DOS v2 (v3) boot sector loads RETRODOS.SYS (MSDOS.SYS)
    22                                  ;	at 1000h:0000h and loader (initialization) part of RETRODOS kernel
    23                                  ;	moves IO.SYS (DOSBIOSCODE & DOSBIOSDATA, 'IOSYS5.BIN') to 70h:0000h.
    24                                  ;	Then SYSINIT code to the next segment (46Dh for original MSDOS 5.0)..
    25                                  ;	SYSINIT code relocates itself and DOSBIOSCODE and MSDOS.SYS
    26                                  ;	(MSDOS5.BIN) according to request/setting in 'config.sys' file.
    27                                  
    28                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    29                                  
    30                                  ;bpbx		struc ;	(sizeof=0x19)	
    31                                  ;
    32                                  ;bytespersec	dw ?			; base 10
    33                                  ;secperclust	db ?			; base 10
    34                                  ;rsvdsecs	dw ?			; base 10
    35                                  ;numfats	db ?			; base 10
    36                                  ;rootdirents	dw ?			; base 10
    37                                  ;totalsize16	dw ?			; base 10
    38                                  ;mediaid	db ?
    39                                  ;fatsecs	dw ?			; base 10
    40                                  ;secpertrack	dw ?			; base 10
    41                                  ;heads		dw ?			; base 10
    42                                  ;hiddensecs_lw	dw ?			; base 10
    43                                  ;hiddensecs_hw	dw ?			; base 10
    44                                  ;totalsecs_lw	dw ?			; base 10
    45                                  ;totalsecs_hw	dw ?			; base 10
    46                                  ;
    47                                  ;bpbx		ends

   142                                  ;============================================================================
   143                                  ;
   144                                  ;     for dos 4.00, msload program has been changed to allow:
   145                                  ;	  1. 32 bit calculation,
   146                                  ;	  2. reading a fat sector when needed, instead of reading the whole
   147                                  ;	     fat sectors at once. this will make the boot time faster,
   148                                  ;	     and eliminate the memory size limitation problem,
   149                                  ;	  3. solving the limitation of the file size (29 kb) of io.sys0,
   150                                  ;	  4. adding the boot error message. show the same boot error message
   151                                  ;	     and do the same behavior when the read operation of io.sys
   152                                  ;	     fails as the msboot program, since msload program is the
   153                                  ;	     extention of msboot program.

   250                                  ; INPUT:     none

   252                                  ;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
   253                                  ;   ch = media byte
   254                                  ;   bx = first data sector (low) on disk (0-based)
   255                                  ;   ds:si = original rom bios diskette parameter table.
   256                                  ;
   257                                  ; if an extended boot record, then ax will be the first data sector
   258                                  ; high word. save ax and set FirstSectorH according to ax if it is an
   259                                  ; extended boot record.

   261                                  ;   ax = first data sector (high) on disk ;

   263                                  ;
   264                                  ;   bx = first data sector on disk
   265                                  ;
   266                                  ;   MediaByte = input ch
   267                                  ;   BootDrive = input dl
   268                                  ;   FirstSectorL = input bx
   269                                  ;   FirstSectorH = input AX, if an extended boot record.;j.k.
   270                                  ;   TotalSectorsL = maximum sector number in this media ;j.k.
   271                                  ;   TotalSectorsH = high word of the above
   272                                  ;   HiddenSectorsL = hidden secotrs

   274                                  ;   ReservSectors = reserved sectors

   278                                  ;   ds = 0

   491                                  ; Relocate
   492                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   493                                  ;
   494                                  ; NOTES:
   495                                  ;
   496                                  ;   Relocates the loader code to top-of-memory.
   497                                  ;
   498                                  ; INPUT:     none
   499                                  ;
   500                                  ; OUTPUT:    code and data relocated.
   501                                  ;	     AX,CX,SI,DI destroyed
   502                                  ;
   503                                  ; calls:     none
   504                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   505                                  ;
   506                                  ; Determine the number of paragraphs (16 byte blocks) of memory.
   507                                  ; this involves invoking the memory size determination interrupt,
   508                                  ; which returns the number of 1k blocks of memory, and then
   509                                  ; converting this to the number of paragraphs.
   510                                  ; Find out whether RPL code is present at top of memory and modify the
   511                                  ; available amount of memory in AX
   512                                  ; leave the number of paragraphs of memory in ax.
   513                                  ;
   514                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   515                                  ; copy code from start to top of memory.
   516                                  ;
   517                                  ; the length to copy is EndOfLoader
   518                                  ;
   519                                  ; jump to relocated code
   520                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   521                                  
   522                                  		; 14/09/2023
   523                                  relocate:
   524                                  		; 24/12/2022
   525                                  		;cld
   526                                  
   527 000000C8 31F6                    		xor	si, si
   528                                  		; 14/09/2023
   529                                  		;mov	di, si
   530                                  		; di = 0
   531                                  
   532 000000CA CD12                    		int	12h		; MEMORY SIZE -
   533                                  					; Return: AX = number of contiguous 1K blocks of memory
   534 000000CC B106                    		mov	cl, 6
   535 000000CE D3E0                    		shl	ax, cl		; Memory size in paragraphs
   536                                  
   537                                  ;------ Check if an RPL program is present at TOM and do not tromp over it
   538                                  
   539                                  		; 10/12/2022
   540                                  		; ds = 0
   541                                  		; 24/12/2022
   542                                  		; ds = cs
   543                                  		;xor	bx, bx
   544                                  		;mov	ds, bx		; ZERO
   545                                  		; 14/09/2023
   546 000000D0 8EDE                    		mov	ds, si ; 0
   547                                  		
   548                                  		;mov	bx, [DskAddr+44h] ; 2Fh*4 (Int 2Fh)
   549                                  		;mov	ds, [DskAddr+46h] ; 2Fh*4+2
   550                                  		; 10/12/2022

   552 000000D6 8E1EBE00                		mov	ds, [2Fh*4+2]		
   553                                  
   554                                  		;cmp	word ptr [bx+3], 'PR'
   555                                  		; 09/12/2022

   557 000000DF 750F                    		jnz	short Skip_RPL

   559 000000E5 7509                    		jnz	short Skip_RPL

   561 000000E9 B8064A                  		mov	ax, 4A06h	; (multMULT shl	8) + multMULTRPLTOM
   562 000000EC CD2F                    		int	2Fh		; Get new TOM from any RPL
   563 000000EE 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
   564                                  Skip_RPL:
   565                                  		; 24/12/2022
   566 000000F0 0E                      		push	cs

   568

   571                                  		;mov	dx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
   572 000000F8 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl
   573 000000FA 42                      		inc	dx
   574 000000FB 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
   575 000000FD A3[3400]                		mov	[FatSegment], ax ; 24/12/2022

   577                                  		; 22/12/2022
   578                                  		;mov	dx, EndOfLoader
   579 00000100 BA[A004]                		mov	dx, EndOfLoader+256
   580                                  				; loader size + temporary/local stack space (*)
   581 00000103 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl
   582 00000105 42                      		inc	dx
   583 00000106 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
   584 00000108 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax	; ES:DI -> place be relocated.
   585                                  		; 22/12/2022
   586 0000010A 4A                      		dec	dx
   587 0000010B D3E2                    		shl	dx, cl	; convert paragraphs to bytes (*)	
   588                                  				; (stack pointer will be set to this offset)
   589                                  		; 24/12/2022

   632                                  ; FindClusterSize
   633                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   634                                  ;
   635                                  ; INPUT:     bpb information in loaded boot record at 0:7c00h
   636                                  ;
   637                                  ; OUTPUT:
   638                                  ;
   639                                  ;	ds = 0
   640                                  ;	ax = bytes/cluster
   641                                  ;	bx = sectors/cluster
   642                                  ;	si destroyed
   643                                  ; calls:     none

   645                                  ;
   646                                  ; get bytes/sector from bpb
   647                                  ;
   648                                  ; get sectors/cluster from bpb

   650                                  ; bytes/cluster = bytes/sector * sector/cluster

   672                                  ; CalcFatSize
   673                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   674                                  ;
   675                                  ; NOTES:
   676                                  ;
   677                                  ;   Determine if fat is 12 or 16 bit fat. 12 bit fat if floppy, read mbr
   678                                  ;   to find out what system id byte is.
   679                                  ;
   680                                  ; INPUT:
   681                                  ;
   682                                  ; OUTPUT:
   683                                  ;
   684                                  ;   CS:FatSize = FAT_12_BIT or FAT_16_BIT
   685                                  ;   all other registers destroyed

   690                                  		; 14/09/2023

   693 0000012C C606[2900]01            		mov	byte [Fatsize], 1

   699                                  		;;;

   748                                  
   749                                  ; ReadInFirstClusters
   750                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   751                                  ;
   752                                  ; NOTES: read the start of the clusters that covers at least IbmLoadSize
   753                                  ;	 fully.  for example, if sector/cluster = 2, and IbmLoadSize=3
   754                                  ;	 then we are going to re-read the second cluster to fully cover
   755                                  ;	 msload program in the cluster boundary.
   756                                  ;
   757                                  ; INPUT:
   758                                  ;   IbmLoadSize - make sure this value is the same as the one in
   759                                  ;		  msboot program when you build the new version!!!!!
   760                                  ;
   761                                  ;   SecPerCluster
   762                                  ;   ClusterSize
   763                                  ;   FirstSectorL
   764                                  ;   FirstSectorH
   765                                  ;
   766                                  ; OUTPUT: msload program is fully covered in a cluster boundary.
   767                                  ;	  ax = # of clusters we read in so far.
   768                                  ;
   769                                  ; calls:     ReadSectors
   770                                  ; logic:
   771                                  ;	ax; dx = IbmLoadSize / # of sector in a cluster.
   772                                  ;	if dx = 0 then ok. (msload is in a cluster boundary.)
   773                                  ;      else		   (has to read (ax+1)th cluster to cover msload)
   774                                  ;	read (ax+1)th cluster into the address after the clusters we
   775                                  ;	read in so far.
   776                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   777                                  
   778                                  ; 09/12/2022
   779                                  ; BiosStart equ 51Ah ; AX = IO.SYS starting cluster
   780                                  ; IbmLoadSize equ 3  ; AX = Number sectors in MSLOAD
   781                                  ; BiosOffset equ 700h ; Address where loader was read in
   782                                  	
   783                                  ReadInFirstClusters:
   784                                  		; 24/12/2022
   785                                  		;;mov	ax, [BioSStart]
   786                                  		;mov	ax, [51Ah]	; IO.SYS First Cluster
   787                                  		;dec	ax		; Root dir buffer at 500h (segment=0)
   788                                  		;			; IO.SYS first cluster ptr at 51Ah
   789                                  		;dec	ax		; AX = word [51Ah] - 2
   790                                  		;;mov	[cs:CurrentCluster], ax ;  Initialize to this cluster
   791                                  		; 24/12/2022
   792                                  		; ds = cs
   793                                  		;mov	[CurrentCluster], ax
   794                                  		; 24/12/2022
   795                                  		; [CurrentCluster] = word [51Ah] - 2
   796                                  
   797                                  		;mov	ax, IbmLoadSize
   798 00000164 B80300                  		mov	ax, 3		; Load the 3rd and other IO.SYS	sectors
   799 00000167 F6F1                    		div	cl ; *#*
   800                                  		;div	byte [SecPerCluster]
   801                                  		;;div	byte [cs:SecPerCluster]
   802                                  					; AL = total cluster read in
   803                                  					; AH = remaining sectors in last cluster
   804                                  		; 10/12/2022
   805 00000169 20E4                    		and	ah, ah
   806                                  		;cmp	ah, 0

   808                                  
   809 0000016D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
   810 0000016F 50                      		push	ax		; AX = total clusters in the loader
   811                                  					; already read in
   812                                  ; 24/12/2022
   813                                  %if 0		
   814                                  		mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorL] ;	Put starting sector of disk data
   815                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecL], cx    ; area in StartSecH:StartSecL
   816                                  		mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
   817                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecH], cx
   818                                  		mul	byte [cs:SecPerCluster]
   819                                  		add	[cs:StartSecL], ax ; Add number of sectors already loaded
   820                                  		adc	word [cs:StartSecH], 0 ; to start sector
   821                                  		;mov	ax, [BiosStart]
   822                                  		mov	ax, [51Ah] ; AX = [51Ah] = IO.SYS 1st clust
   823                                  		dec	ax
   824                                  		dec	ax

   828                                  		add	[cs:StartSecL], ax
   829                                  		adc	[cs:StartSecH], dx

   831                                  					; the rest of the last loader cluster

   841                                  					; Read in the entire last cluster
   842                                  		mov	[cs:SectorCount], ax
   843                                  		call	ReadSectors
   844                                  		pop	ax		; AX = total clust read	by boot	loader
   845                                  		inc	ax		; AX = total clust read	in now
   846                                  SetNextClusterNum:			; ...
   847                                  		inc	ax		; AX = total clusters read in based 2

   849                                  		dec	ax		; CurrentCluster = Last	cluster	read

   851                                  %endif

   859                                  		; [StartSecH] = [FirstSectorH] ; **!**

   901 0000019F 40                      		inc	ax		; AX = total clust read	in now
   902                                  SetNextClusterNum:			; ...
   903 000001A0 40                      		inc	ax		; AX = total clusters read in based 2

   908                                  ; SaveLoadedBios
   909                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   910                                  ;
   911                                  ; NOTES:
   912                                  ;
   913                                  ;   Determine how much of iosys was loaded in when the loader was loaded
   914                                  ;   by the boot record (only the portion that is guaranteed to be contiguous)
   915                                  ;
   916                                  ; INPUT:
   917                                  ;   AX:Total cluster already read in (loader & bios)
   918                                  ;   CS:CurrentCluster = number of clusters used for loader+2
   919                                  ;
   920                                  ; OUTPUT:
   921                                  ;	ES = 70h
   922                                  ;	DI = next offset to load iosys code
   923                                  ;	AX,BX,CX,DX,SI destroyed
   924                                  ;
   925                                  ;	CS:NextBioLocation = di on output
   926                                  ;	CS:last_cluster = last cluster loaded
   927                                  ;
   928                                  ; calls:     none
   929                                  ;
   930                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   931                                  ;
   932                                  ; Multiply cluster * cluster size in bytes to get total loaded for msload
   933                                  ;
   934                                  ; Subtract total_loaded - (EndOfLoader) to get loaded io.sys in last cluster
   935                                  ;
   936                                  ; Relocate this piece of iosys down to 70:0
   937                                  ;
   938                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   939                                  
   940                                  SaveLoadedBios:
   941 000001A6 1E                      		push	ds
   942                                  		; 24/12/2022
   943                                  		; ds = cs
   944                                  		; ax = number of loaded clusters
   945 000001A7 F726[0400]              		mul	word [ClusterSize]
   946                                  		;mul	word [cs:ClusterSize]
   947                                  					; Get total bytes loaded by
   948                                  					; this is always < 64k, so
   949                                  					; lower 16 bits ok
   950                                  
   951 000001AB 2D[A003]                		sub	ax, EndOfLoader ; (OFFSET EndOfLoader)-(OFFSET Start)
   952 000001AE 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
   953 000001B0 B87000                  		mov	ax, 70h		; Segment at 70h

   958 000001BC F3A4                    		rep movsb		; Relocate this code to 0070h:0000h
   959                                  		;mov	[NextBioLocation], di
   960                                  		;;mov	[cs:NextBioLocation], di
   961

   963                                  
   964 000001BE 1F                      		pop	ds		; Save where location for next read
   965                                  
   966                                  ; GetContigClusters
   967                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   968                                  ;
   969                                  ; NOTES: go find clusters as long as they are contiguous
   970                                  ;
   971                                  ;
   972                                  ; INPUT:
   973                                  ;   CS:NextBioLocation
   974                                  ;   CS:
   975                                  ;
   976                                  ; OUTPUT:
   977                                  ;
   978                                  ; calls: GetNextFatEntry
   979                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   980                                  ;
   981                                  ;Set CS:SectorCount to sectors per cluster
   982                                  ;
   983                                  ;Call GetNextFatEntry to get next cluster in file
   984                                  ;
   985                                  ;Call check_for_eof
   986                                  ;
   987                                  ;if (nc returned)
   988                                  ;
   989                                  ;   {call GetNextFatEntry
   990                                  ;
   991                                  ;    if (new cluster is contig to old cluster)
   992                                  ;	{add sectors per cluster to CS:SectorCount
   993                                  ;
   994                                  ;	 call check_for_eof
   995                                  ;
   996                                  ;	 if (nc returned)
   997                                  ;
   998                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   999                                  
  1000                                  ; 09/12/2022
  1001                                  ; END_OF_FILE equ 0FFh
  1002                                  ; DosLoadSeg equ 70h
  1003                                  
  1004                                  GetContigClusters:
  1005                                  
  1006                                  ; 24/12/2022
  1007                                  %if 0	
  1008                                  		xor	ah, ah
  1009                                  		mov	al, [cs:SecPerCluster]	; Assume we will get one cluster
  1010                                  		mov	[cs:SectorCount], ax	; Sector count = sectors in 1 cluster
  1011                                  		push	word [cs:SectorCount]
  1012                                  		call	GetNextFatEntry		; Returns next cluster to read in AX	
  1013                                  		pop	word [cs:SectorCount]
  1014                                  		mov	word [cs:CurrentCluster], ax ; Update the last one found
  1015                                  		cmp	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0FFh ; END_OF_FILE
  1016                                  		jz	short GoToBioInit
  1017                                  		xor	dx, dx
  1018                                  		;sub	ax, 2			; Zero base the cluster
  1019                                  		; 10/12/2022
  1020                                  		dec	ax
  1021                                  		dec	ax
  1022                                  		xor	ch, ch
  1023                                  		mov	cl, [cs:SecPerCluster]
  1024                                  		mul	cx			; How many sectors (before next cluster) 
  1025                                  		add	ax, [cs:FirstSectorL]	; See where the data sector starts
  1026                                  		adc	dx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
  1027                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax	; Save it (used by ReadSectors)
  1028                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx
  1029                                  		mov	di, [cs:NextBioLocation] ; Get where to put code
  1030                                  		push	word [cs:SectorCount]	; Save how many sectors
  1031                                  		;mov	ax, DosLoadSeg
  1032                                  		mov	ax, 70h
  1033                                  		mov	es, ax
  1034                                  		call	ReadSectors
  1035                                  		pop	ax			; Get back total sectors read in
  1036                                  		mul	word [cs:BytesPerSec]	; Get number of bytes we loaded
  1037                                  		add	[cs:NextBioLocation], ax ; Point to where to load next	
  1038                                  		jmp	short GetContigClusters
  1039                                  
  1040                                  %endif
  1041                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1042                                  		; ds = cs
  1043                                  
  1044 000001BF A1[1400]                		mov	ax, [SecPerCluster]	; Assume we will get one cluster
  1045 000001C2 A3[0E00]                		mov	[SectorCount], ax	; Sector count = sectors in 1 cluster
  1046                                  		;push	word [SectorCount]
  1047 000001C5 50                      		push	ax
  1048 000001C6 E8B900                  		call	GetNextFatEntry		; Returns next cluster to read in AX	
  1049 000001C9 8F06[0E00]              		pop	word [SectorCount]
  1050 000001CD A3[1000]                		mov	[CurrentCluster], ax	; Update the last one found
  1051

  1053 000001D5 741A                    		je	short GoToBioInit ; 23/12/2022
  1054                                  		; 22/12/2022

  1059 000001D8 48                      		dec	ax

  1062                                  		;mov	cx, [SecPerCluster]

  1064 000001D9 F726[1400]              		mul	word [SecPerCluster]
  1065 000001DD 0306[2400]              		add	ax, [FirstSectorL]	; See where the data sector starts
  1066 000001E1 1316[2600]              		adc	dx, [FirstSectorH]
  1067 000001E5 A3[0600]                		mov	[StartSecL], ax		; Save it (used by ReadSectors)
  1068 000001E8 8916[0800]              		mov	[StartSecH], dx

  1071

  1073                                  				; ES:DI = (the next) buffer address for next read
  1074

  1076                                  
  1077                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1078                                  
  1079                                  ; GoToBiosInit
  1080                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1081                                  ;
  1082                                  ; NOTES:
  1083                                  ;
  1084                                  ;  Set up required registers for iosys, then jump to it (70:0)
  1085                                  ;
  1086                                  ; INPUT:     none
  1087                                  ;
  1088                                  ;   CS:MediaByte = media byte
  1089                                  ;   CS:BootDrive = int 13 drive number we booted from
  1090                                  ;   CS:FirstSectorL = first data sector on disk (low) (0-based)
  1091                                  ;   CS:FirstSectorH = first data sector on disk (high)
  1092                                  ;
  1093                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1094                                  ;
  1095                                  ;   required by msinit
  1096                                  ;   DL = int 13 drive number we booted from
  1097                                  ;   CH = media byte
  1098                                  ;   BX = first data sector on disk (0-based)
  1099                                  ;   AX = first data sector on disk (high)
  1100                                  ;   DI = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  1101                                  ;
  1102                                  ; calls:     none
  1103                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1104                                  ;
  1105                                  ; set up registers for msinit then do far jmp
  1106                                  ;
  1107                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1108                                  
  1109                                  GoToBioInit:	
  1110                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1111                                  		; ds = cs	
  1112                                  		;mov	ch, [cs:MediaByte]
  1113                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:BootDrive]
  1114                                  		;mov	bx, [cs:FirstSectorL]
  1115                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:FirstSectorH]
  1116

  1118 000001F5 8A16[2800]              		mov	dl, [BootDrive] ; Physical drv number we booted from.
  1119 000001F9 8B1E[2400]              		mov	bx, [FirstSectorL] ; AX:BX = first data sector of disk
  1120 000001FD A1[2600]                		mov	ax, [FirstSectorH]
  1121                                  
  1122 00000200 EA00007000              		jmp	70h:0	; Far jump to IoSysAddr	(DOSBIOS)
  1123                                  
  1124                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1125                                  
  1126                                  ; ReadSectors
  1127                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1128                                  ; notES:
  1129                                  ;
  1130                                  ;  read in the CS:SectorCount number of sectors at ES:di
  1131                                  ;
  1132                                  ;
  1133                                  ; INPUT:
  1134                                  ;
  1135                                  ;   DI = OFFSET of start of read
  1136                                  ;   ES = segment of read
  1137                                  ;   CS:SectorCount = number of sectors to read
  1138                                  ;   CS:StartSecL = starting sector (low)
  1139                                  ;   CS:StartSecH = starting sector (high)
  1140                                  ;   following is bpb info that must be setup prior to call
  1141                                  ;   CS:NumHeads
  1142                                  ;   CS:number_of_sectors
  1143                                  ;   CS:BootDrive
  1144                                  ;   CS:SecPerTrack
  1145                                  ;
  1146                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1147                                  ;
  1148                                  ;   AX,BX,CX,DX,SI,DI destroyed
  1149                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1150                                  ; divide start sector by sectors per track
  1151                                  ; the remainder is the actual sector number, 0 based
  1152                                  ;
  1153                                  ; increment actual sector number to get 1 based
  1154                                  ;
  1155                                  ; the quotient is the number of tracks - divide by heads to get the cyl
  1156                                  ;
  1157                                  ; the remainder is actual head, the quotient is cylinder
  1158                                  ;
  1159                                  ; figure the number of sectors in that track, set al to this
  1160                                  ;
  1161                                  ; do the read
  1162                                  ;
  1163                                  ; if error, do reset, then redo the int 13h
  1164                                  ;
  1165                                  ; if successful read, subtract # sectors read from SectorCount, add to logical
  1166                                  ; sector, add #sectors read * BytesPerSec to bx;
  1167                                  ;
  1168                                  ; if SectorCount <> 0 do next read
  1169                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1170                                  
  1171                                  ReadSectors:
  1172                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1173                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1174                                  ReadSectors:

  1176

  1221                                  		; 700h+0F8FFh < 64KB address 
  1222                                  		;	(there is not an override risk up to 63743 bytes)
  1223                                  ; 24/12/2022

  1228                                  		or	di, di

  1230                                  		;cmp	byte [BootDrive], 80h
  1231                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:BootDrive], 80h
  1232                                  		;jnb	short dma_boundary_ok ; no problem for hard disks
  1233                                  dma_boundary_chk:
  1234                                  		cmp	si, 1
  1235                                  		jna	short dma_boundary_ok 
  1236                                  				; 1 sector read will not cause a boundary error			
  1237                                  		push	dx
  1238                                  		push	ax
  1239                                  		mov	ax, si

  1241                                  		mul	word [BytesPerSec]
  1242                                  		mov	bx, es

  1244                                  		shl	bx, cl	; convert paragraphs to bytes
  1245                                  		; bx = segment start position (for 64K memory sections)
  1246                                  		add	bx, ax	; byte count to read
  1247                                  		pop	ax
  1248                                  		pop	dx

  1250                                  		jnc	short dma_boundary_ok

  1253                                  		; DMA boundary error or segment override risk!

  1257                                  %endif

  1278                                  
  1279                                  			; At this moment, we assume that TempH = 0,
  1280                                  			; ax <= 1024, dx <= 255
  1281                                  
  1282 00000242 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
  1283                                  		
  1284 00000244 B106                    		mov	cl, 6

  1286 00000248 08DC                    		or	ah, bl			; Mix in with sector bits

  1293 00000254 89F0                    		mov	ax, si			; Get number of sectors to read (al)

  1300                                  			; AL is the number of sectors.

  1390                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1391                                  
  1392                                  ; GetNextFatEntry
  1393                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1394                                  ;
  1395                                  ; NOTES:
  1396                                  ;
  1397                                  ;   given the last cluster found, this will return the next cluster of
  1398                                  ;   iosys. if the last cluster is (f)ff8 - (f)fff, then the final cluster
  1399                                  ;   of iosys has been loaded, and control is passed to goto_iosys
  1400                                  ;   msload can handle maximum fat area size of 128 kb.
  1401                                  ;
  1402                                  ; INPUT:
  1403                                  ;
  1404                                  ;    CS:CurrentCluster
  1405                                  ;    CS:FatSize
  1406                                  ;
  1407                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1408                                  ;
  1409                                  ;   CS:CurrentCluster (updated)
  1410                                  ;
  1411                                  ; calls:  GetFatSector
  1412                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1413                                  ; get CurrentCluster
  1414                                  ;
  1415                                  ; if (16 bit fat)
  1416                                  ;    {if (CurrentCluster = fff8 - ffff)
  1417                                  ;	 {jmp goto_iosys}
  1418                                  ;     else
  1419                                  ;	{get OFFSET by multiply cluster by 2}
  1420                                  ;
  1421                                  ; else
  1422                                  ;    {if (CurrentCluster = ff8 - fff)
  1423                                  ;	 {jmp goto_iosys}
  1424                                  ;     else
  1425                                  ;	{get OFFSET by	- multiply cluster by 3
  1426                                  ;
  1427                                  ;	 rotate right to divide by 2
  1428                                  ;
  1429                                  ;	 if (cy set - means odd number)
  1430                                  ;	    {shr 4 times to keep high twelve bits}
  1431                                  ;
  1432                                  ;	 else
  1433                                  ;	    {and with 0fffh to keep low 12 bits}
  1434                                  ;	}
  1435                                  ;    }
  1436                                  ;
  1437                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1438                                  
  1439                                  ; 09/12/2022
  1440                                  ; FAT_12_BIT equ 1
  1441                                  ; NOT_END_OF_FILE equ 0  ; ~END_OF_FILE ; END_OF_FILE equ 0FFh
  1442                                  
  1443                                  GetNextFatEntry:
  1444 00000282 06                      		push	es
  1445                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1446                                  		; ds = cs
  1447                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:FatSegment]
  1448 00000283 A1[3400]                		mov	ax, [FatSegment]
  1449 00000286 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax		; ES-> FAT area segment
  1450                                  		; 09/12/2022
  1451                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], END_OF_FILE
  1452                                  		;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0FFh ; Assume last cluster
  1453                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:CurrentCluster] ; Get last cluster
  1454                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1455                                  		; ds = cs
  1456 00000288 C606[2B00]FF            		mov	byte [EndOfFile], 0FFh ; Assume last cluster
  1457 0000028D A1[1000]                		mov	ax, [CurrentCluster] ; Get last cluster
  1458 00000290 803E[2900]01            		cmp	byte [Fatsize], 1
  1459                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:FatSize], FAT_12_BIT
  1460                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:Fatsize], 1
  1461 00000295 7537                    		jne	short Got16Bit	; 23/12/2022
  1462 00000297 89C6                    		mov	si, ax
  1463 00000299 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  1464 0000029B 01C6                    		add	si, ax		; SI = AX * 1.5 = AX + AX/2
  1465                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1466                                  		;push	dx
  1467                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  1468 0000029D 29D2                    		sub	dx, dx ; 23/12/2022
  1469 0000029F E84700                  		call	GetFatSector
  1470                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1471                                  		;pop	dx
  1472 000002A2 7510                    		jnz	short ClusterOk
  1473 000002A4 268A07                  		mov	al, [es:bx]
  1474                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1475                                  		;mov	[cs:TempCluster], al
  1476                                  		;push	ax ; (*)
  1477 000002A7 46                      		inc	si
  1478                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1479                                  		;push	dx
  1480 000002A8 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  1481 000002AA E83C00                  		call	GetFatSector	; Read next fat sector
  1482                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1483                                  		;pop	dx
  1484                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1485                                  		;mov	al, [es:0]
  1486                                  		;mov	[cs:TempCluster+1], al
  1487                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:TempCluster]
  1488                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1489                                  		;pop	ax ; (*) 
  1490 000002AD 268A260000              		mov	ah, [es:0]
  1491 000002B2 EB03                    		jmp	short EvenOdd
  1492                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1493                                  
  1494                                  ClusterOk:				
  1495 000002B4 268B07                  		mov	ax, [es:bx]
  1496                                  EvenOdd:	
  1497                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1498                                  		; ds = cs
  1499 000002B7 F606[1000]01            		test	byte [CurrentCluster], 1
  1500                                  		; 10/12/2022		
  1501                                  		;test	byte [cs:CurrentCluster], 1 ; 09/12/2022
  1502                                  		;;test	word [cs:CurrentCluster], 1 ; Was last cluster odd?
  1503 000002BC 7505                    		jnz	short OddResult		; If not zero it was odd
  1504 000002BE 25FF0F                  		and	ax, 0FFFh		; Keep low 12 bits
  1505 000002C1 EB04                    		jmp	short TestEOF
  1506                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1507                                  
  1508                                  OddResult:				
  1509 000002C3 B104                    		mov	cl, 4			; Keep high 12 bits for odd
  1510 000002C5 D3E8                    		shr	ax, cl
  1511                                  TestEOF:				
  1512 000002C7 3DF80F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF8h		; Is it last cluster?
  1513 000002CA 731B                    		jnb	short GotClusterDone	; Yep, all done here
  1514 000002CC EB14                    		jmp	short NotLastCluster
  1515                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1516                                  
  1517                                  Got16Bit:
  1518                                  		; 23/12/2022				
  1519                                  		;push	dx
  1520                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  1521 000002CE 29D2                    		sub	dx, dx ; 23/12/2022
  1522 000002D0 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1			; Multiply cluster by 2
  1523 000002D2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  1524 000002D5 89C6                    		mov	si, ax			; Get the final buffer OFFSET
  1525 000002D7 E80F00                  		call	GetFatSector
  1526                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1527                                  		;pop	dx
  1528 000002DA 268B07                  		mov	ax, [es:bx]
  1529 000002DD 83F8F8                  		cmp	ax, 0FFF8h
  1530 000002E0 7305                    		jnb	short GotClusterDone
  1531                                  NotLastCluster:	
  1532                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1533                                  		; ds = cs			
  1534                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], NOT_END_OF_FILE ; ~END_OF_FILE
  1535                                  		;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0	; Assume not last cluster
  1536 000002E2 C606[2B00]00            		mov	byte [EndOfFile], 0	; Assume not last cluster
  1537                                  GotClusterDone:				
  1538 000002E7 07                      		pop	es
  1539                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1540                                  EndRead:
  1541 000002E8 C3                      		retn
  1542                                  
  1543                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1544                                  
  1545                                  ; GetFatSector
  1546                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1547                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ES:0
  1548                                  ;
  1549                                  ;in). SI = offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find.
  1550                                  ;     ES = fat sector segment
  1551                                  ;     CS:BytesPerSec
  1552                                  ;
  1553                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  1554                                  ;      BX = offset value of the corresponding fat entry in the fat sector.
  1555                                  ;      CX destroyed.
  1556                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e. when 12 bit fat entry
  1557                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  1558                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  1559                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat).
  1560                                  ;
  1561                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1562                                  
  1563                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1564                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1565                                  GetFatSector:
  1566 000002E9 50                      		push	ax
  1567 000002EA 56                      		push	si
  1568 000002EB 57                      		push	di
  1569 000002EC 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  1570                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1571                                  		; ds = cs
  1572                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  1573                                  		;div	cx			; AX = Sector number, DX = Offset
  1574 000002EE F736[1200]              		div	word [BytesPerSec]
  1575 000002F2 3B06[0C00]              		cmp	ax, [LastFatSector]
  1576                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:LastFatSector]	; The same fat sector?
  1577 000002F6 7421                    		je	short SplitChk		; Don't need to read it again.
  1578 000002F8 A3[0C00]                		mov	[LastFatSector], ax
  1579                                  		;mov	[cs:LastFatSector], ax
  1580 000002FB 52                      		push	dx
  1581                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1582 000002FC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  1583                                  		;add	ax, [cs:HiddenSectorsL]
  1584                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:HiddenSectorsH]
  1585                                  		;add	ax, [cs:ReservSectors]
  1586                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  1587                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1588                                  		; ds = cs
  1589 000002FE 0306[3000]              		add	ax, [FatStartSecL]
  1590 00000302 1316[3200]              		adc	dx, [FatStartSecH]
  1591 00000306 A3[0600]                		mov	[StartSecL], ax
  1592 00000309 8916[0800]              		mov	[StartSecH], dx		; Set up for ReadSectors
  1593                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax
  1594                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx	; Set up for ReadSectors
  1595                                  		
  1596 0000030D C706[0E00]0100          		mov	word [SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector			
  1597                                  		;mov	word [cs:SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector
  1598 00000313 31FF                    		xor	di, di ; 0
  1599                                  		; es:di = FATSEGMENT:0000h
  1600 00000315 E8EDFE                  		call	ReadSectors
  1601 00000318 5A                      		pop	dx
  1602                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1603                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  1604                                  SplitChk:
  1605                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1606 00000319 8B0E[1200]              		mov	cx, [BytesPerSec]				
  1607 0000031D 49                      		dec	cx			; CX = SECTOR SIZE - 1
  1608 0000031E 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx			; If last byte of sector, splitted entry.
  1609 00000320 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx			; set bx to dx
  1610 00000322 5F                      		pop	di
  1611 00000323 5E                      		pop	si
  1612 00000324 58                      		pop	ax
  1613                                  EndWrite:		; 10/12/2022
  1614 00000325 C3                      		retn
  1615                                  
  1616                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1617                                  
  1618                                  ErrorOut:
  1619                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1620                                  		; ds = cs
  1621                                  		;push	cs
  1622                                  		;pop	ds
  1623                                  		
  1624 00000326 BE[4D03]                		mov	si, NonSystemDiskMsg ; "\r\nNon-System disk or disk error\r\nRe"...
  1625 00000329 E81400                  		call	WriteTTY
  1626                                  
  1627                                  		; Wait for a keypress on the keyboard.
  1628                                  		; Use the bios keyboard interrupt.
  1629                                  
  1630 0000032C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  1631 0000032E CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
  1632                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
  1633                                  
  1634                                  		; We have to restore the address of the original rom disk
  1635                                  		; parameter table to the location at [0:DskAddr]. The address
  1636                                  		; of this original table has been saved previously in
  1637                                  		; 0:OrgDasdPtr and 0:OrgDasdPtr+2. After this table address
  1638                                  		; has been restored we can reboot by invoking the bootstrap
  1639                                  		; loader bios interrupt.
  1640                                  
  1641                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1642                                  		;xor	bx, bx
  1643                                  		;mov	ds, bx
  1644                                  		;les	bx, [OrgDasdPtr] ; Wrong DS segment !
  1645                                  					 ; (Erdogan Tan, 23/12/2022)
  1646 00000330 C41E[2C00]              		les	bx, [OrgDasdPtr] ; Correct DS segment = CS
  1647                                  		
  1648                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1649 00000334 16                      		push	ss ; 0
  1650 00000335 1F                      		pop	ds
  1651                                  		; ds = 0		
  1652                                  
  1653 00000336 BE7800                  		mov	si, DskAddr	; (Int 1Eh)
  1654 00000339 891C                    		mov	[si], bx	; restore offset		
  1655 0000033B 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; restore segment
  1656 0000033E CD19                    		int	19h		; reboot
  1657                                  
  1658                                  
  1659                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1660                                  
  1661                                  ; WriteTTY
  1662                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1663                                  ; in) DS:si -> asciiz string.
  1664                                  ;
  1665                                  ; WriteTTY the character in al to the screen.
  1666                                  ; use video service 'write teletype to active page' (ROM_TTY)
  1667                                  ; use normal character attribute
  1668                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1669                                  
  1670                                  WriteTTY:
  1671 00000340 AC                      		lodsb
  1672 00000341 08C0                    		or	al, al
  1673 00000343 74E0                    		jz	short EndWrite
  1674                                  		;mov	AH, ROM_TTY	; 09/12/2022
  1675 00000345 B40E                    		mov	ah, 0Eh
  1676 00000347 B307                    		mov	bl, 7		; "normal" attribute
  1677 00000349 CD10                    		int	10h		; - VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND	ADVANCE	CURSOR (TTY WRITE)
  1678                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  1679                                  					; BL = foreground color	(graphics modes)
  1680 0000034B EBF3                    		jmp	short WriteTTY
  1681                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1682                                  
  1683                                  ; 10/12/2022	
  1684                                  ;EndWrite:
  1685                                  ;		retn
  1686

  1887 00000119 [4E03]                  start_bds:	dw bds1			; Start	of linked list of BDS's
  1888 0000011B 7000                    		dw 70h			; KERNEL_SEGMENT
  1889                                  
  1890                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  1891                                  ; Some floppy drives do not have changeline support. The result is a
  1892                                  ; large amount of inefficiency in the code. A media-check always returns
  1893                                  ; "I don`t know". This cause DOS to reread the FAT on every access and
  1894                                  ; always discard any cached data.
  1895                                  ;    We get around this inefficiency by implementing a "Logical Door Latch".
  1896                                  ; The following three items are used to do this. The logical door latch is
  1897                                  ; based on the premise that it is not physically possible to change floppy
  1898                                  ; disks in a drive in under two seconds (most people take about 10). The
  1899                                  ; logical door latch is implemented by saving the time of the last successful
  1900                                  ; disk operation (in the value TIM_DRV). When a new request is made the
  1901                                  ; current time is compared to the saved time. If less than two seconds have
  1902                                  ; passed then the value "No Change" is returned. If more than two seconds
  1903                                  ; have passed the value "Don't Know" is returned.
  1904                                  ;    There is one complecation to this algorithm. Some programs change the
  1905                                  ; value of the timer. In this unfortunate case we have an invalid timer.
  1906                                  ; This possibility is detected by counting the number of disk operations
  1907                                  ; which occur without any time passing. If this count exceeds the value of
  1908                                  ; "AccessMax" we assume the counter is invalid and always return "Don't
  1909                                  ; Know". The variable "AccessCount" is used to keep track of the number
  1910                                  ; of disk operation which occur without the time changing.
  1911                                  
  1912 0000011D 00                      accesscount:	db 0			
  1913 0000011E FF                      tim_drv:	db 0FFh			
  1914 0000011F 00                      medbyt:		db 0
  1915                                  wrtverify:	; 15/10/2022			
  1916 00000120 02                      rflag:		db 2			; 2 for	read, 3	for write
  1917 00000121 00                      verify:		db 0			; 1 if verify after write
  1918 00000122 0000                    seccnt:		dw 0			
  1919 00000124 00                      		db 0			; -- pad where hardnum was
  1920 00000125 01                      dsktnum:	db 1			; number of diskette drives			
  1921                                  
  1922                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  1923                                  ; Some of the older versions of the IBM rom-bios always assumed a seek would
  1924                                  ; have to be made to read the diskette. Consequently a large head settle
  1925                                  ; time was always used in the I/O operations. To get around this problem
  1926                                  ; we need to continually adjust the head settle time. The following
  1927                                  ; algorithm is used:
  1928                                  ;
  1929                                  ;   Get the current head settle value.
  1930                                  ;   If it is 1, then
  1931                                  ;	set slow = 15
  1932                                  ;   else
  1933                                  ;	set slow = value
  1934                                  ;   ...
  1935                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing then
  1936                                  ;	use slow
  1937                                  ;   else
  1938                                  ;	use fast
  1939                                  ;   ...
  1940                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  1941                                  
  1942 00000126 00                      motorstartup:	db 0			; value from table
  1943 00000127 00                      settlecurrent:	db 0			; value	from table
  1944 00000128 00                      settleslow:	db 0			; slow settle value
  1945 00000129 00                      nextspeed:	db 0			; value	of speed to be used
  1946 0000012A 00                      save_head_sttl:	db 0			; used by read_sector routine
  1947 0000012B 00                      save_eot:	db 0			; saved	eot from the default DPT
  1948 0000012C 09                      eot:		db 9			
  1949 0000012D 00000000                dpt:		dd 0			; pointer to Disk Parameter Table			
  1950 00000131 00                      cursec:		db 0			; current sector
  1951 00000132 00                      curhd:		db 0			; current head
  1952 00000133 0000                    curtrk:		dw 0			; current track
  1953 00000135 0000                    spsav:		dw 0			; save the stack pointer
  1954 00000137 08                      formt_eot:	db 8			; eot used for format
  1955 00000138 00                      hdnum:		db 0			; head number
  1956 00000139 0000                    trknum:		dw 0			; track	being manipulated
  1957 0000013B 50                      gap_patch:	db 50h			; format gap patched into dpt
  1958

  1995                                  ; is made to enforce this in the bigger picture, this one small sacrifice

  2336                                  ttticks:	dw 396h, 2C7h		; time_to_ticks

  2367                                  ;************************************************************************
  2368                                  ;*									*
  2369                                  ;*	strategy - store es:bx (device driver request packet)		*
  2370                                  ;*		     away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call	*
  2371                                  ;*									*
  2372                                  ;************************************************************************
  2373                                  
  2374                                  strategy:	; proc far		
  2375 000006F5 2E891E[1200]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav], bx ; store es:bx (device driver request packet)
  2376                                  					; away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call
  2377 000006FA 2E8C06[1400]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav+2], es
  2378 000006FF CB                      		retf

  2382                                  ;************************************************************************
  2383                                  ;*									*
  2384                                  ;*	device driver entry points. these are the initial		*
  2385                                  ;*	  'interrupt' hooks out of the device driver chain.		*
  2386                                  ;*	  in the case of our resident drivers, they'll just		*
  2387                                  ;*	  stick a fake return address on the stack which		*
  2388                                  ;*	  points to dispatch tables and possibly some unit		*
  2389                                  ;*	  numbers, and then call through a common entry point		*
  2390                                  ;*	  which can take care of a20 switching				*
  2391                                  ;*									*
  2392                                  ;************************************************************************
  2393                                  
  2394                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Erdogan Tan
  2395                                  ; (disassembled MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS code here with fixed table
  2396                                  ;  addresses, they will be changed to table labels later)
  2397                                  
  2398                                  ; 09/12/2022
  2399                                  
  2400                                  con_entry:				
  2401 00000700 E84000                  		call	cdev_entry
  2402                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2403                                  		;dw 0E4h		; con_table

  2500                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2501                                  
  2502                                  ;************************************************************************
  2503                                  ;*									*
  2504                                  ;*	Ensure A20 is enabled before jumping into code in HMA.		*
  2505                                  ;*	This code assumes that if Segment of Device request packet is	*
  2506                                  ;*	DOS DATA segment then the Device request came from DOS & that	*
  2507                                  ;*	A20 is already on.						*
  2508                                  ;*									*
  2509                                  ;************************************************************************
  2510                                  
  2511                                  cdev_entry:	; proc near		
  2512 00000743 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2513 00000749 740D                    		jz	short ce_enter_codeseg
  2514                                  				; optimized for DOS in HMA
  2515 0000074B 50                      		push	ax
  2516 0000074C 2EA1[0300]              		mov	ax, [cs:DosDataSg]
  2517 00000750 2E3906[1400]            		cmp	[cs:ptrsav+2], ax
  2518 00000755 58                      		pop	ax
  2519 00000756 7505                    		jnz	short not_from_dos
  2520                                  				; jump is coded this way to fall thru
  2521                                  				; in 99.99% of the cases
  2522                                  ce_enter_codeseg:
  2523 00000758 2EFF2E[DE06]            		jmp	far [cs:cdev]			
  2524                                  		;jmp	dword ptr cs:cdev
  2525                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2526                                  
  2527                                  not_from_dos:				
  2528 0000075D E86200                  		call	EnsureA20On
  2529 00000760 EBF6                    		jmp	short ce_enter_codeseg
  2530                                  
  2531                                  ;************************************************************************
  2532                                  ;*									*
  2533                                  ;*	outchr - this is our int 29h handler. it writes the		*
  2534                                  ;*	   character in al on the display using int 10h ttywrite	*
  2535                                  ;*									*
  2536                                  ;************************************************************************
  2537                                  
  2538                                  outchr:					
  2539 00000762 50                      		push	ax		; int 29h handler
  2540 00000763 56                      		push	si
  2541 00000764 57                      		push	di
  2542 00000765 55                      		push	bp
  2543 00000766 53                      		push	bx
  2544 00000767 B40E                    		mov	ah, 0Eh
  2545 00000769 BB0700                  		mov	bx, 7
  2546 0000076C CD10                    		int	10h		; - VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND	ADVANCE	CURSOR (TTY WRITE)
  2547                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  2548                                  					; BL = foreground color	(graphics modes)
  2549 0000076E 5B                      		pop	bx
  2550 0000076F 5D                      		pop	bp
  2551 00000770 5F                      		pop	di
  2552 00000771 5E                      		pop	si
  2553 00000772 58                      		pop	ax
  2554 00000773 CF                      		iret
  2555                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2556                                  
  2557                                  ;************************************************************************
  2558                                  ;*									*
  2559                                  ;*	block13 - our int13 hooker					*
  2560                                  ;*									*
  2561                                  ;************************************************************************
  2562                                  
  2563                                  block13:				
  2564 00000774 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2565 0000077A 7408                    		jz	short skipa20
  2566 0000077C E85400                  		call	IsA20Off	; A20 Off?
  2567 0000077F 7503                    		jnz	short skipa20
  2568 00000781 E84300                  		call	EnableA20	; assure a20 enabled
  2569                                  
  2570                                  skipa20:				
  2571 00000784 2E8C1E[1C00]            		mov	[cs:i13_ds], ds	; save caller's ds for call-through
  2572 00000789 9C                      		pushf			; fake interrupt
  2573 0000078A 2EFF1E[EA06]            		call	far [cs:i13x]
  2574                                  		;call	dword ptr cs:i13x
  2575                                  					; call through Bios_Code entry table
  2576 0000078F 2E8E1E[1C00]            		mov	ds, [cs:i13_ds]
  2577 00000794 CA0200                  		retf	2
  2578                                  
  2579                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  2580                                  
  2581                                  ; the int13 hook calls back here to call-through to the ROM
  2582                                  ; this is necessary because some people have extended their
  2583                                  ; ROM BIOSs to use ds as a parameter/result register and
  2584                                  ; our int13 hook relies heavily on ds to access Bios_Data
  2585                                  
  2586                                  call_orig13:	; proc far		
  2587 00000797 8E1E[1C00]              		mov	ds, [i13_ds]	; get caller's ds register
  2588 0000079B 9C                      		pushf			; simulate an int13
  2589 0000079C 2EFF1E[B400]            		call	far [cs:Orig13]
  2590                                  		;call	cs:Orig13
  2591 000007A1 2E8C1E[1C00]            		mov	[cs:i13_ds], ds
  2592 000007A6 0E                      		push	cs
  2593 000007A7 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore ds ->	Bios_Data before return
  2594                                  
  2595 000007A8 9C                      		pushf
  2596                                  		; 10/12/2022
  2597                                  		; ds = cs
  2598 000007A9 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; 16/10/2022
  2599                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2600 000007AE 7408                    		jz	short corig13_popf_retf
  2601 000007B0 E82000                  		call	IsA20Off
  2602 000007B3 7503                    		jnz	short corig13_popf_retf
  2603 000007B5 E80F00                  		call	EnableA20
  2604                                  corig13_popf_retf:			
  2605 000007B8 9D                      		popf
  2606 000007B9 CB                      		retf
  2607                                  
  2608                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2609                                  
  2610                                  ; BIOSDATA:07BBh (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  2611                                  ; BIOSDATA:07BBh (MSDOS 5.0, IO.SYS) ; 16/10/2022
  2612                                  
  2613 000007BA 9000FFFF                HiMem:		dd 0FFFF0090h
