  4552                                  
  4553                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4554 000017BC 0E                      		push	cs
  4555 000017BD 1F                      		pop	ds
  4556                                  		
  4557 000017BE A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4558 000017C1 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4559 000017C4 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4560 000017C7 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4561                                  					; ;
  4562 000017CA FB                      		sti
  4563 000017CB CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4564                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4565                                  
  4566                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4567                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4568                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4569                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4570                                  ;
  4571                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4572                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4573                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4574                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4575                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4576                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4577                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4578                                  
  4579                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4580                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4581                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4582                                  ;
  4583                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4584                                  ; to do anything special.
  4585                                  ;
  4586                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4587                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4588                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4589                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4590                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4591                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4592                                  
  4593                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4594 000017CD A801                    		test	al, 1
  4595                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4596 000017CF 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4597                                  
  4598                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4599                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4600                                  ;
  4601                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4602                                  ;
  4603                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4604                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4605                                  
  4606 000017D1 50                      		push	ax
  4607 000017D2 53                      		push	bx
  4608 000017D3 51                      		push	cx
  4609 000017D4 52                      		push	dx
  4610 000017D5 57                      		push	di
  4611 000017D6 06                      		push	es
  4612 000017D7 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4613 000017D9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4614 000017DB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4615                                  					; DL = drive number
  4616                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4617                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4618                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4619 000017DD 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4620                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4621                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4622                                  		; ds = cs
  4623 000017DF 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4624                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4625 000017E3 07                      		pop	es
  4626 000017E4 5F                      		pop	di
  4627 000017E5 5A                      		pop	dx
  4628 000017E6 59                      		pop	cx
  4629 000017E7 5B                      		pop	bx
  4630 000017E8 58                      		pop	ax
  4631 000017E9 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4632                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4633                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4634                                  
  4635                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4636                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4637                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4638                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4639 000017EB A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4640 000017EE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4641 000017F0 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4642                                  
  4643                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4644                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4645 000017F2 48                      		dec	ax
  4646 000017F3 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs

  4648                                  
  4649                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4650                                  		; 21/12/2022

  4652 000017F8 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4653                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4654                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4655                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4656 000017FB EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4657                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4658                                  
  4659                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4660 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4661 000017FF D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4662                                  got_num_flp_drvs:

  4668                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives

  4677 0000180B 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies

  4680                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4681                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here

  4738                                  					; AKPORT

  4740                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications

  4754 0000185B E650                    		out	50h, al

  5042                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of

  5044                                  ;
  5045                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5046                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5047                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5048                                  ;
  5049                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5050                                  ;
  5051                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5052                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5053                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5054                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)

  5067                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

  5069                                  
  5070                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5071                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5072                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5073                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5074                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5075                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5076                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5077                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5373                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5374                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5375                                  ;
  5376                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  5377                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5378                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5379                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5380                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5381                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.

  5394                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5395                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5396                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5397                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5398                                  ;
  5399                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5400                                  ;
  5401                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5402                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5403                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5404                                  ;use to start with.
  5405                                  ;
  5406                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5407                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5408                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5409                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5410                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5411

  5483                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5484                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5485                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5486                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5487                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5488                                  ; off of it.

  5490                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5491                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5492                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5493                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide

  5773                                  
  5774                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5775                                  ;
  5776                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5777                                  
  5778                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5779                                  
  5780                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5781                                  ; module name: remap
  5782                                  ;
  5783                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5784                                  ;
  5785                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5786                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5787                                  ;
  5788                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5789                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5790                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5791                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5792                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5793                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5794                                  
  5795                                  ; input:       none
  5796                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5797                                  ; exit error:  none
  5798                                  ; called from: msinit
  5799                                  ;
  5800                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5801                                  ;	  found in the system
  5802                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5803                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5804                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5805                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5806                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5807                                  ;
  5808                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5809                                  
  5810                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5811                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5812                                  
  5813                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5814 00001C77 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5815                                  
  5816                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5817                                  
  5818                                  drive_loop:				
  5819 00001C7C 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5820                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5821 00001C80 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5822 00001C82 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5823                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5824 00001C84 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5825 00001C87 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5826 00001C89 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5827                                  
  5828                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5829                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5830                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5831                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5832                                  
  5833                                  fdrv_found:				
  5834 00001C8B B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5835                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5836 00001C8D 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5837                                  					; found	??
  5838 00001C90 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5839                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5840                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5841                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5842 00001C92 40                      		inc	ax
  5843 00001C93 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  5844 00001C96 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  5845                                  
  5846                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5847                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5848                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5849                                  ; any more.
  5850                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5851                                  
  5852 00001C98 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5853                                  					; get first bds
  5854 00001C9D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5855                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5856 00001C9F 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5857 00001CA4 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5858                                  remap_loop1:				
  5859 00001CA7 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5860                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5861 00001CA9 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5862 00001CAC FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5863 00001CAE FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  5864 00001CB0 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5865                                  
  5866                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5867                                  
  5868 00001CB2 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5869 00001CB6 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5870 00001CB8 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5871 00001CBA 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  5872 00001CBF 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5873                                  
  5874                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5875                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5876                                  
  5877 00001CC1 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5878 00001CC3 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5879                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5880                                  
  5881                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5882                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5883                                  
  5884                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  5885 00001CC5 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5886                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5887 00001CCA 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5888 00001CCE FEC0                    		inc	al
  5889 00001CD0 1E                      		push	ds
  5890 00001CD1 BF5004                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5891                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5892 00001CD4 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5893 00001CD6 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5894                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5895                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5896 00001CD9 1F                      		pop	ds
  5897                                  rmap_exit:				
  5898 00001CDA C3                      		retn
  5899                                  
  5900                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5901                                  
  5902                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5903                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5904                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5905                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5906                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5907                                  ;**************************************************
  5908                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5909                                  ;
  5910                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5911                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5912                                  ;
  5913                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5914                                  ;**************************************************
  5915                                  
  5916                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5917                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5918                                  
  5919                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  5920                                  		
  5921                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5922                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5923                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5924                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5925                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5926                                  
  5927 00001CDB 2EA1[D516]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5928 00001CDF 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5929                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5930 00001CE1 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5931                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5932                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5933 00001CE4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5934 00001CE7 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5935 00001CE9 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5936 00001CEC CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5937                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5938                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5939                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5940 00001CEE 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5941                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5942 00001CF0 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5943                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5944                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5945 00001CF7 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5946                                  erret:					
  5947 00001CF9 F9                      		stc
  5948                                  norm_ret:				
  5949 00001CFA C3                      		retn
  5950                                  
  5951                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5952                                  
  5953                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5954                                  
  5955                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5956                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5957                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5958                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5959                                  ;   determine version number
  5960                                  ;
  5961                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5962                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5963                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5964                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5965                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5966                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5967                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5968                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5969                                  
  5970                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  5971                                  		; 14/08/2023
  5972                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  5973 00001CFB 57                      		push	di
  5974 00001CFC 53                      		push	bx
  5975                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 14/08/2023
  5976 00001CFD 06                      		push	es
  5977 00001CFE 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5978 00001D01 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5979 00001D04 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5980                                  					; fnon_removable
  5981 00001D08 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5982                                  					; ffHardFile
  5983 00001D0C C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5984 00001D11 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5985 00001D13 52                      		push	dx
  5986 00001D14 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5987 00001D16 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5988                                  					; DL = drive number
  5989                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5990                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5991                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5992 00001D18 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5993 00001D1A 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  5994 00001D1D 5A                      		pop	dx
  5995 00001D1E 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  5996 00001D20 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  5997 00001D23 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5998 00001D26 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  5999 00001D27 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  6000 00001D2A 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6001 00001D2B 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6002 00001D2D BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6003                                  
  6004                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6005                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6006                                  
  6007                                  act_part:				
  6008 00001D30 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6009 00001D35 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6010 00001D37 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6011 00001D3B 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6012 00001D3D 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6013 00001D41 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6014 00001D43 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6015 00001D47 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6016                                  got_good_act:				
  6017 00001D49 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6018 00001D4B 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6019 00001D4D FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6020                                  no_act:					
  6021 00001D4F 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6022 00001D52 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6023                                  					; last entry done?
  6024 00001D56 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6025 00001D58 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6026                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6027                                  
  6028                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6029                                  
  6030                                  get_primary:				
  6031 00001D5B 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6032 00001D60 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6033                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6034 00001D62 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6035 00001D66 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6036 00001D68 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6037 00001D6C 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6038 00001D6E 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6039 00001D72 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6040                                  got_prim:				
  6041 00001D74 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6042 00001D76 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6043 00001D78 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6044                                  not_prim:				
  6045 00001D7A 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6046 00001D7D 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6047 00001D81 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6048                                  setret:					
  6049 00001D83 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6050 00001D84 E9A002                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6051                                  
  6052                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6053                                  
  6054                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6055                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6056                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6057                                  ;
  6058                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6059                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6060                                  ;  without change.
  6061                                  ;
  6062                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6063                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6064                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6065

  6070                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl

  6072 00001D8B 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6073 00001D8F 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]

  6134 00001E07 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h

  6138                                  okdrive_2:

  6140                                  ; dl is head.

  6172                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector

  6183 00001E28 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h

  6468                                  ; ****** cas ---

  6472                                  ; program. We haven't actually been COPYING the TOTAL_SECTORS
  6473                                  ; from the boot sector into the DPB anyway, we've just been using

  6475                                  ; we'll go ahead and copy it into the DPB, except in the case

  6698                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is gauranteed
  6699                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6700                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6701                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  6702                                  
  6703 00001FAF 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; (12 bit fat)
  6704 00001FB1 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  6705 00001FB3 4B                      		dec	bx

  6708 00001FB8 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus

  6710 00001FBC 89DE                    		mov	si, bx

  6716                                  					; save number of fat sectors
  6717 00001FCB EB35                    		jmp	short massage_bpb
  6718                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6719                                  
  6720                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.
  6721                                  
  6722                                  dobig:					
  6723 00001FCD B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  6724 00001FCF 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  6725 00001FD0 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  6726 00001FD3 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6727 00001FD5 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  6728 00001FD7 5A                      		pop	dx
  6729 00001FD8 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  6730 00001FDB 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6731 00001FDE 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  6732                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  6733 00001FE1 B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  6734 00001FE3 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  6735                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  6736                                  
  6737                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6738                                  
  6739                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6740                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6741                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6742                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6743                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6744                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6745                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6746                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  6747                                  		
  6748                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1, bx = TmpVal2
  6749 00001FE6 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; 
  6750 00001FE8 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  6751 00001FEB 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  6752 00001FEE 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  6753                                  
  6754                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  6755                                  
  6756 00001FF1 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  6757                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  6758 00001FF3 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6759                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  6760                                  
  6761                                  ; now, set the default filesys_id, volume label, serial number
  6762                                  
  6763                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6764                                  		; [di+1Fh] = [fbigfat]
  6765                                  		;
  6766                                  		;;mov	bl, ds:fbigfat
  6767                                  		;; 17/10/2022
  6768                                  		;mov	bl, [fbigfat]
  6769                                  		;mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag
  6770                                  
  6771                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6772                                  		;push	ds ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6773 00001FF6 1E                      		push	ds
  6774 00001FF7 07                      		pop	es
  6775                                  		; 14/08/2023 
  6776                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6777                                  		;push	cs

  6785                                  					; at 2C7h:5D9h = 70h:2B49h
  6786                                  					; at BIOSCODE:06ABh
  6787                                  					;	in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6788 00001FFE 0E                      		push	cs
  6789 00001FFF E863F7                  		call	call_bios_code
  6790                                  
  6791                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6792                                  		;pop	ds ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6793                                  
  6794                                  ; at this point, in bpb of bds table, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS which is
  6795                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to
  6796                                  ; see if (hidden sectors + total sectors) > a word. if it is true,
  6797                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  6798                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.
  6799                                  ; we don't do this for the bpb information from the boot record. we
  6800                                  ; are not going to change the bpb information from the boot record.
  6801                                  
  6802                                  massage_bpb:
  6803                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6804                                  		; [di+1Fh] = [fbigfat]
  6805                                  		;
  6806                                  		;; 12/12/2022

  6808                                  		;mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz]
  6809                                  		;			; set size of fat on media

  6925                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  6926                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  6927                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  6928                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.

  7120                                  
  7121                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  7122                                  ;
  7123                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  7124                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  7125                                  ;
  7126                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  7127                                  ;
  7128                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  7129                                  ;   initialize it.
  7130                                  ;
  7131                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  7132                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  7133                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  7134                                  ;
  7135                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  7136                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  7137                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  7138                                  ;
  7139                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  7140                                  ;   save coding.
  7141                                  ;
  7142                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  7143                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  7144                                  ;
  7145                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  7146                                  ;
  7147                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  7148                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  7149                                  ;
  7150                                  ; called modules:
  7151                                  ;		  getboot
  7152                                  ;		  find_mini_partition (new), xinstall_bds (new), M038
  7153                                  ;
  7154                                  ;		  setmini (new, it will use set2 routine)
  7155                                  ;
  7156                                  ; variables used: end_of_bdsm
  7157                                  ;		  rom_minidisk_num
  7158                                  ;		  mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  7159                                  ;		  BDS_STRUC, start_bds
  7160                                  ;
  7161                                  ;******************************************************************************
  7162                                  
  7163                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7164                                  domini:	
  7165 00002134 8A36[5117]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  7166                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7167 00002138 20F6                    		and	dh, dh
  7168                                  		;cmp	dh, 0
  7169 0000213A 7431                    		jz	short dominiret	; no hard file?	then exit.
  7170 0000213C B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  7171                                  domini_loop:				
  7172 0000213E 52                      		push	dx
  7173 0000213F 8816[5017]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  7174 00002143 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  7175 00002145 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7176                                  					; DL = drive number
  7177                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  7178                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  7179                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  7180 00002147 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  7181 00002149 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  7182 0000214B 88F0                    		mov	al, dh
  7183 0000214D A3[5617]                		mov	[mini_hdlim], ax ; # of heads
  7184 00002150 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  7185 00002153 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  7186 00002155 A3[5817]                		mov	[mini_seclim], ax ; # of sectors/track
  7187 00002158 06                      		push	es
  7188 00002159 8A16[5017]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7189 0000215D E87BFB                  		call	getboot		; read master boot record into
  7190                                  					; initbootsegment:bootbias
  7191 00002160 7203                    		jb	short domininext
  7192 00002162 E80900                  		call	find_mini_partition
  7193                                  domininext:				
  7194 00002165 07                      		pop	es
  7195 00002166 5A                      		pop	dx
  7196 00002167 FEC2                    		inc	dl		; next hard file
  7197 00002169 FECE                    		dec	dh
  7198 0000216B 75D1                    		jnz	short domini_loop
  7199                                  dominiret:				
  7200 0000216D C3                      		retn
  7201                                  
  7202                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7203                                  
  7204                                  ; 15/10/2022 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7205                                  ; 30/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7206                                  
  7207                                  ;find_mini_partition tries to find every extended partition on a disk.
  7208                                  ;at entry:	di -> bdsm entry
  7209                                  ;		es:bx -> 07c0:bootbias - master boot record
  7210                                  ;		rom_minidisk_num - rom drive number
  7211                                  ;		drvmax - logical drive number
  7212                                  ;		mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  7213                                  ;
  7214                                  ;called routine: setmini which uses set2 (in sethard routine)
  7215                                  ;variables & equates used from original bios - flags, fnon_removable, fbigfat
  7216                                  
  7217                                  
  7218                                  find_mini_partition:	
  7219 0000216E 81C3C201                		add	bx, 1C2h	; bx ->	file system id
  7220                                  fmpnext:				
  7221 00002172 26803F05                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 5 ; 5 = extended partition id.

  7229 00002181 C3                      		retn
  7230

  7344                                  ; dmax_check --- call this when we want to install a new drive.
  7345                                  ;		it checks for drvmax < 26 to see if there is
  7346                                  ;		a drive letter left.
  7347                                  ;

  7349                                  ;	drvmax >=26 : carry RESET!, error flag set for message later
  7350                                  ;			trash ax
  7351

  7354 00002227 720D                    		jb	short dmax_ok	; return with carry if okay
  7355 00002229 06                      		push	es
  7356                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; SYSINIT_SEG (SYSINIT segment)
  7357 0000222A B85004                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 17/10/2022

  7369                                  		;;mov	byte [es:toomanydrivesflag],1
  7370                                  					; set message flag
  7371                                  		;;pop	es
  7372                                  		;
  7373                                  		;mov	byte [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag],1
