  7378                                  
  7379                                  ; 18/10/2022
  7380                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7381                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0						
  7382                                  ;								 
  7383                                  ;	link next bds (at ds:di) into the chain. assume that the
  7384                                  ;	  chain is entirely within ds == datagrp. also update drvmax,
  7385                                  ;	  dskdrv_table, and end_of_bdss.	
  7386                                  
  7387                                  xinstall_bds:		
  7388 00002237 56                      		push	si
  7389 00002238 53                      		push	bx
  7390 00002239 8B36[1901]              		mov	si, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  7391                                  xinstall_bds_1:				
  7392 0000223D 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; is this the last one?
  7393 00002240 7404                    		jz	short xinstall_bds_2 ;	skip ahead if so
  7394                                  		;mov	si, [si+BDS.link]
  7395 00002242 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; chain	through	list
  7396 00002244 EBF7                    		jmp	short xinstall_bds_1
  7397                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7398                                  
  7399                                  xinstall_bds_2:				
  7400                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link], di
  7401 00002246 893C                    		mov	[si], di
  7402                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link+2], ds
  7403 00002248 8C5C02                  		mov	[si+2], ds
  7404                                  		;mov	word [di+BDS.link], -1
  7405 0000224B C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; make sure it is a null ptr.
  7406                                  		;mov	[di+BDS.link+2], ds
  7407 0000224F 8C5D02                  		mov	[di+2], ds ; might as well plug segment
  7408                                  		; 20/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7409                                  		;lea	bx, [di+BDS.BPB]
  7410 00002252 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  7411 00002255 8B36[5217]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  7412 00002259 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  7413 0000225B 8306[5217]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  7414 00002260 FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  7415 00002264 8306[5417]64            		add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  7416 00002269 5B                      		pop	bx
  7417 0000226A 5E                      		pop	si
  7418 0000226B C3                      		retn
  7419                                  
  7420                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7421                                  
  7422                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7423                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7424                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7425                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7426                                  
  7427                                  cmos_clock_read:	
  7428 0000226C 50                      		push	ax
  7429 0000226D 51                      		push	cx
  7430 0000226E 52                      		push	dx
  7431 0000226F 55                      		push	bp
  7432 00002270 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  7433                                  loop_clock:				
  7434 00002272 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  7435 00002274 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7436 00002276 B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  7437 00002278 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7438                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  7439                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  7440                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  7441 0000227A 83F900                  		cmp	cx, 0
  7442 0000227D 7512                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7443 0000227F 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  7444 00002282 750D                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7445 00002284 83FD01                  		cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  7446 00002287 741C                    		jz	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  7447 00002289 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  7448 0000228A B90040                  		mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  7449                                  delay:					
  7450 0000228D E2FE                    		loop	delay
  7451 0000228F EBE1                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  7452                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7453                                  
  7454                                  clock_present:				
  7455 00002291 2EC606[F304]01          		mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  7456 00002297 E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  7457                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  7458                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  7459 0000229A 56                      		push	si
  7460 0000229B E88BF2                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  7461 0000229E FA                      		cli
  7462                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  7463 0000229F 8936[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  7464 000022A3 FB                      		sti
  7465 000022A4 5E                      		pop	si
  7466                                  
  7467                                  no_readdate:				
  7468 000022A5 5D                      		pop	bp
  7469 000022A6 5A                      		pop	dx
  7470 000022A7 59                      		pop	cx
  7471 000022A8 58                      		pop	ax
  7472 000022A9 C3                      		retn
  7473                                  
  7474                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7475                                  
  7476                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  7477                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  7478                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  7479                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  7480                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  7481                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  7482                                  ;
  7483                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  7484                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  7485                                  ;
  7486                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  7487                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  7488                                  ;
  7489                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  7490                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  7491                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initilization routine
  7492                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  7493                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  7494                                  ;
  7495                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  7496                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  7497                                  
  7498                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits	
  7499                                  
  7500                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  7501                                  
  7502                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7503                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  7504                                  			
  7505 000022AA 50                      		push	ax
  7506 000022AB 2E803E[3E06]FC          		cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  7507 000022B1 7525                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  7508 000022B3 2E803E[3F06]06          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  7509                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  7510 000022B9 7408                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS	periodic rate if 06
  7511 000022BB 2E803E[3F06]04          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  7512                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  7513 000022C1 7315                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST  
  7514                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0 
  7515                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  7516                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE 
  7517                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06 
  7518                                  cmosck4:				
  7519 000022C3 B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  7520                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7521 000022C5 B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  7522                                  					; Set divider &	rate selection
  7523 000022C7 E83000                  		call	cmos_write
  7524 000022CA B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  7525                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7526 000022CC E80B00                  		call	cmos_read
  7527 000022CF 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  7528                                  					; clear	SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  7529 000022D1 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  7530 000022D3 B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  7531                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  7532 000022D5 E82200                  		call	cmos_write
  7533                                  cmosck9:				
  7534 000022D8 58                      		pop	ax
  7535 000022D9 C3                      		retn
  7536                                  
  7537                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7538                                  
  7539                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  7540                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7541                                  ;									       :
  7542                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  7543                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7544                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  7545                                  ;									       :
  7546                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  7547                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled.  during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  7548                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7549                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7550                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7551                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7552                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7553                                  
  7554                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)	
  7555 000022DA 9C                      		pushf
  7556 000022DB FA                      		cli
  7557 000022DC 53                      		push	bx
  7558 000022DD 50                      		push	ax		; AL = cmos table address to be	read
  7559 000022DE 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  7560 000022E0 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7561                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7562 000022E2 90                      		nop			; (undocumented	delay needed)
  7563 000022E3 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7564 000022E5 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax
  7565 000022E7 58                      		pop	ax
  7566 000022E8 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7567 000022EA 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7568 000022EC E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7569                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7570 000022EE 90                      		nop
  7571 000022EF E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7572 000022F1 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  7573 000022F3 5B                      		pop	bx
  7574 000022F4 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7575 000022F5 E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7576 000022F8 C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
  7577                                  
  7578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7579                                  
  7580                                  cmos_popf:				
  7581 000022F9 CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
  7582                                  					; return far and restore flags
  7583                                  
  7584                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7585                                  
  7586                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  7587                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7588                                  ;									       :
  7589                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  7590                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7591                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  7592                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  7593                                  ;									       :
  7594                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  7595                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  7596                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7597                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7598                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7599                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7600                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7601                                  
  7602                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)	
  7603 000022FA 9C                      		pushf			; write (ah) to location (al)
  7604 000022FB 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  7605 000022FC FA                      		cli
  7606 000022FD 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  7607 000022FE 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  7608 00002300 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7609                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7610 00002302 90                      		nop
  7611 00002303 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  7612 00002305 E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7613 00002307 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  7614 00002308 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7615 0000230A 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7616 0000230C E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7617                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7618 0000230E 90                      		nop
  7619 0000230F E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7620 00002311 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  7621 00002312 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7622 00002313 E8E3FF                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7623 00002316 C3                      		retn
  7624                                  
  7625                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7626                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7627                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7628                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
  7629                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7630                                  
  7631                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7632                                  ;
  7633                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
  7634                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
  7635                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
  7636                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
  7637                                  
  7638                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7639                                  
  7640                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
  7641                                  ;
  7642                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
  7643                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
  7644                                  ;  es:di = load location
  7645                                  
  7646                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7647                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7648                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7649                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
  7650                                  
  7651                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7652                                  getclus:				
  7653 00002317 51                      		push	cx
  7654 00002318 57                      		push	di
  7655 00002319 2E890E[D016]            		mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7656 0000231E 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  7657 00002320 48                      		dec	ax
  7658 00002321 48                      		dec	ax
  7659 00002322 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to logical sector
  7660                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
  7661                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
  7662 00002324 2E0306[CC16]            		add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
  7663 00002329 2E1316[CE16]            		adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  7664                                  unpack:					
  7665 0000232E 1E                      		push	ds
  7666 0000232F 50                      		push	ax
  7667 00002330 53                      		push	bx
  7668 00002331 2E8B36[D316]            		mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
  7669 00002336 8EDE                    		mov	ds, si
  7670 00002338 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; next cluster
  7671 0000233A 2EF606[D216]40          		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
  7672                                  					; 16 bit fat?
  7673 00002340 753C                    		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
  7674 00002342 D1EE                    		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si=si/2
  7675                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
  7676 00002344 01DE                    		add	si, bx		;
  7677                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
  7678 00002346 52                      		push	dx
  7679 00002347 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7680 00002349 E87C00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7681 0000234C 5A                      		pop	dx
  7682 0000234D 8B07                    		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
  7683 0000234F 7517                    		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
  7684                                  		; 25/06/2023
  7685                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
  7686 00002351 2EA2[DA16]              		mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
  7687 00002355 46                      		inc	si		; (next	byte)
  7688 00002356 52                      		push	dx
  7689 00002357 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7690 00002359 E86C00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7691 0000235C 5A                      		pop	dx
  7692                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
  7693 0000235D A00000                  		mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
  7694 00002360 2EA2[DB16]              		mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
  7695 00002364 2EA1[DA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
  7696                                  even_odd:				
  7697 00002368 5B                      		pop	bx		; restore old fat entry	value
  7698 00002369 53                      		push	bx		; save it right	away.
  7699 0000236A D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
  7700 0000236C 7308                    		jnb	short havclus	; it was even.
  7701 0000236E D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
  7702                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
  7703 00002370 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7704 00002372 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7705 00002374 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7706                                  havclus:				
  7707 00002376 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
  7708 00002378 81E3FF0F                		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
  7709 0000237C EB0E                    		jmp	short unpackx
  7710                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7711                                  
  7712                                  unpack16:				
  7713 0000237E 52                      		push	dx
  7714 0000237F 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7715 00002381 D1E6                    		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
  7716 00002383 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  7717 00002386 E83F00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7718 00002389 5A                      		pop	dx
  7719 0000238A 8B1F                    		mov	bx, [bx]	;
  7720                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
  7721                                  unpackx:				
  7722 0000238C 5E                      		pop	si		; restore old bx value into si
  7723 0000238D 58                      		pop	ax		; restore logical sector (low)
  7724 0000238E 1F                      		pop	ds
  7725 0000238F 29DE                    		sub	si, bx
  7726 00002391 83FEFF                  		cmp	si, -1		; one apart?
  7727 00002394 7507                    		jnz	short getcl2
  7728 00002396 2E010E[D016]            		add	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7729 0000239B EB91                    		jmp	short unpack
  7730                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7731                                  
  7732                                  getcl2:					
  7733 0000239D 53                      		push	bx
  7734 0000239E 52                      		push	dx		; sector to read (high)
  7735 0000239F 50                      		push	ax		; sector to read (low)
  7736 000023A0 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  7737 000023A4 2E8B0E[D016]            		mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
  7738 000023A9 5A                      		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
  7739 000023AA 2E8F06[2B05]            		pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
  7740                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
  7741 000023AF 1E                      		push	ds
  7742 000023B0 0E                      		push	cs
  7743 000023B1 1F                      		pop	ds
  7744 000023B2 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7745                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7746 000023B3 BD[C308]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7747                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7748                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7749 000023B6 E8ACF3                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
  7750 000023B9 1F                      		pop	ds
  7751 000023BA 5B                      		pop	bx
  7752 000023BB 5F                      		pop	di
  7753 000023BC 2EA1[D016]              		mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
  7754 000023C0 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
  7755 000023C2 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
  7756 000023C4 01C7                    		add	di, ax		; update load location
  7757 000023C6 59                      		pop	cx		; restore sectors/cluster
  7758 000023C7 C3                      		retn
  7759                                  
  7760                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7761                                  
  7762                                  
  7763                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
  7764                                  ;
  7765                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
  7766                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
  7767                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
  7768                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
  7769                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
  7770                                  ;
  7771                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  7772                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
  7773                                  ;      other registera saved.
  7774                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
  7775                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  7776                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  7777                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
  7778                                  
  7779                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7780                                  get_fat_sector:	
  7781 000023C8 50                      		push	ax
  7782 000023C9 51                      		push	cx
  7783 000023CA 57                      		push	di
  7784 000023CB 56                      		push	si
  7785 000023CC 06                      		push	es
  7786 000023CD 1E                      		push	ds
  7787 000023CE 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  7788 000023D0 2E8B0E[D816]            		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7789 000023D5 F7F1                    		div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
  7790 000023D7 90                      		nop
  7791                                  
  7792                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
  7793                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
  7794                                  
  7795 000023D8 06                      		push	es
  7796 000023D9 1E                      		push	ds
  7797 000023DA 57                      		push	di
  7798 000023DB 50                      		push	ax
  7799 000023DC 0E                      		push	cs
  7800 000023DD 1F                      		pop	ds
  7801                                  
  7802 000023DE 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
  7803 000023E2 BD[CB04]                		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  7804                                  		;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
  7805                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
  7806 000023E5 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7807 000023E6 E87CF3                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
  7808 000023E9 58                      		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
  7809 000023EA 26034509                		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
  7810                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
  7811 000023EE 5F                      		pop	di
  7812 000023EF 1F                      		pop	ds
  7813 000023F0 07                      		pop	es
  7814 000023F1 2E3B06[DC16]            		cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
  7815 000023F6 742A                    		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
  7816 000023F8 2EA3[DC16]              		mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax 
  7817                                  					; sector number
  7818                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
  7819 000023FC 52                      		push	dx
  7820 000023FD 2EC706[2B05]0000        		mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
  7821                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
  7822                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
  7823 00002404 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax
  7824 00002406 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
  7825 00002409 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
  7826 0000240D 1E                      		push	ds
  7827 0000240E 07                      		pop	es
  7828 0000240F 31FF                    		xor	di, di		; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
  7829 00002411 1E                      		push	ds
  7830 00002412 0E                      		push	cs
  7831 00002413 1F                      		pop	ds
  7832 00002414 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7833 00002415 BD[C308]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7834                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7835                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7836 00002418 E84AF3                  		call	call_bios_code
  7837 0000241B 1F                      		pop	ds
  7838 0000241C 5A                      		pop	dx
  7839 0000241D 2E8B0E[D816]            		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7840                                  
  7841                                  gfs_split_chk:				
  7842 00002422 49                      		dec	cx		; 511
  7843 00002423 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
  7844                                  					; last byte of this sector,
  7845                                  					; then splitted	entry.
  7846 00002425 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
  7847 00002427 1F                      		pop	ds
  7848 00002428 07                      		pop	es
  7849 00002429 5E                      		pop	si
  7850 0000242A 5F                      		pop	di
  7851 0000242B 59                      		pop	cx
  7852 0000242C 58                      		pop	ax
  7853 0000242D C3                      		retn
  7854                                  
  7855                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7856                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
  7857                                  
  7858                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7859                                  
  7860                                  		; 09/12/2022
  7861                                  		;db 0
  7862                                  
  7863                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
  7864                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
  7865                                  
  7866                                  %if numbertomod>0 & numbertomod<16
  7867 0000242E 00<rep 2h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
  7868                                  %endif
  7869                                  
  7870                                  ;align 16
  7871                                  
  7872                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7873                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF	equ $ - BData_start
  7874                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
  7875                                  
  7876                                  ;--- End of DOSBIOS data segment --------------------------------------------
  7877                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7878                                  		;db 4 dup(0)
  7879                                  ; 09/12/2022		
  7880                                  ;		times 4 db 0	; 19/10/2022
  7881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7882                                  
  7883                                  ;============================================================================
  7884                                  ; DOS BIOS (IO.SYS) CODE SEGMENT 
  7885                                  ;============================================================================
  7886                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7887                                  
  7888                                  section .BIOSCODE vstart=0  
  7889                                  
  7890                                  BCode_start:	 ; 09/12/2022
  7891                                   
  7892                                  ; 02/10/2022
  7893                                  
  7894                                  ;--- DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------------
  7895                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7896                                  ; MSBIO1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7897                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7898                                  
  7899                                  DOSBIOSEG_2C7h:	;db 30h dup(0)		; SEGMENT 2C7h (2C70h-700h=2570h)
  7900 00000000 00<rep 30h>             		times 48 db 0		; 19/10/2022	
  7901 00000030 7000                    BiosDataWord:	dw 70h
  7902                                  
  7903                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7904                                  ;BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  7905                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7906                                  BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord
  7907                                  
  7908                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7909                                  
  7910                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) 
  7911                                  
  7912                                  ;************************************************************************
  7913                                  ;*									*
  7914                                  ;*	seg_reinit is called with ax = our new code segment value,	*
  7915                                  ;*	  trashes di, cx, es						*
  7916                                  ;*									*
  7917                                  ;*	cas -- should be made disposable!				*
  7918                                  ;*									*
  7919                                  ;************************************************************************
  7920                                  
  7921                                  _seg_reinit:
  7922 00000032 2E8E06[3000]            		mov	es, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
  7923                                  					; at 2C7h:30h or 70h:25A0h
  7924                                  		;mov	di, (offset cdev+2)
  7925 00000037 BF[E006]                		mov	di, cdev+2	; 19/10/2022
  7926 0000003A B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; (end_BC_entries - cdev)/4
  7927                                  
  7928                                  _seg_reinit_1:				
  7929 0000003D AB                      		stosw			; modify Bios_Code entry points
  7930 0000003E 47                      		inc	di
  7931 0000003F 47                      		inc	di
  7932 00000040 E2FB                    		loop	_seg_reinit_1
  7933 00000042 CB                      		retf
  7934                                  
  7935                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7936                                  
  7937                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7938                                  
  7939                                  ;************************************************************************
  7940                                  ;*									*
  7941                                  ;*	chardev_entry - main device driver dispatch routine		*
  7942                                  ;*	   called with a dummy parameter block on the stack		*
  7943                                  ;*	   dw dispatch_table, dw prn/aux numbers (optional)		*
  7944                                  ;*									*
  7945                                  ;*	will eventually take care of doing the transitions in		*
  7946                                  ;*	   out of Bios_Code						*
  7947                                  ;*									*
  7948                                  ;************************************************************************
  7949                                  
  7950                                  chardev_entry:				; 0070h:25B3h =	02C7h:0043h
  7951 00000043 56                      		push	si
  7952 00000044 50                      		push	ax
  7953 00000045 51                      		push	cx
  7954 00000046 52                      		push	dx
  7955 00000047 57                      		push	di
  7956 00000048 55                      		push	bp
  7957 00000049 1E                      		push	ds
  7958 0000004A 06                      		push	es
  7959 0000004B 53                      		push	bx
  7960 0000004C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
  7961 0000004E 8B7612                  		mov	si, [bp+18]	; get return address (dispatch table)
  7962                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
  7963                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  7964 00000051 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  7965 00000056 8B4402                  		mov	ax, [si+2]	; get the device number	if present
  7966 00000059 A2[2100]                		mov	[auxnum], al
  7967 0000005C 8826[E704]              		mov	[printdev], ah
  7968 00000060 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; point	to the device dispatch table
  7969 00000062 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; get pointer to i/o packet
  7970 00000066 268A4701                		mov	al, [es:bx+1]	; [es:bx+unit]	; al = unit code
  7971 0000006A 268A670D                		mov	ah, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+media]	; ah = media descrip
  7972 0000006E 268B4F12                		mov	cx, [es:bx+18]	; [es:bx+count]	; cx = count
  7973 00000072 268B5714                		mov	dx, [es:bx+20]	; [es:bx+start]	; dx = start sector
  7974                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7975 00000076 81FE[9604]              		cmp	si, DSKTBL
  7976                                  		;cmp	si, 4A2h	; dsktbl
  7977                                  					; at 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  7978 0000007A 7517                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  7979                                  
  7980                                  ; Special case for 32-bit start sector number:
  7981                                  ;   if (si==dsktbl) /* if this is a disk device call */
  7982                                  ;      set high 16 bits of secnum to 0
  7983                                  ;      if (secnum == 0xffff) fetch 32 bit sector number
  7984                                  ;
  7985                                  ; pass high word of sector number in start_sec_h, low word in dx
  7986                                  ;
  7987                                  ; note: start_l and start_h are the offsets within the io_request packet
  7988                                  ;	  which contain the low and hi words of the 32 bit start sector if
  7989                                  ;	  it has been used.
  7990                                  ;
  7991                                  ; note: remember not to destroy the registers which have been set up before
  7992                                  
  7993                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	0 ; initialize to 0
  7994 0000007C C706[2B05]0000          		mov	word [start_sec_h], 0
  7995 00000082 83FAFF                  		cmp	dx, 0FFFFh
  7996 00000085 750C                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  7997 00000087 268B571C                		mov	dx, [es:bx+28]	; [es:bx+start_h]
  7998                                  					; 32 bits dsk req
  7999                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	dx ; start_sec_h = packet.start_h
  8000 0000008B 8916[2B05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx
  8001 0000008F 268B571A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+26]	; [es:bx+start_l]
  8002                                  					; dx = packet.start_l
  8003                                  no_sector32_mapping:			
  8004 00000093 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  8005 00000094 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+cmd]
  8006 00000098 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, cs:[si]
  8007 0000009B 732C                    		jnb	short command_error
  8008 0000009D 98                      		cbw			; note that al <= 15 means ok
  8009 0000009E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  8010 000000A0 01C6                    		add	si, ax
  8011 000000A2 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  8012 000000A3 26C47F0E                		les	di, [es:bx+14]	; [es:bx+trans]
  8013 000000A7 FC                      		cld
  8014                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8015 000000A8 2EFF5401                		call	near [cs:si+1]
  8016                                  		;call	word ptr cs:si+1
  8017 000000AC 7202                    		jb	short already_got_ah_status
  8018 000000AE B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8019                                  already_got_ah_status:
  8020                                  		;;mov	ds, [cs:0030h]	; 15/10/2022			
  8021                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  8022                                  					; cas note: shouldn't be needed!
  8023 000000B0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  8024                                  		;lds	bx, ds:ptrsav
  8025 000000B5 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
  8026 000000B9 894703                  		mov	[bx+3],	ax	; [bx+status]
  8027                                  					; mark operation complete
  8028 000000BC 5B                      		pop	bx
  8029 000000BD 07                      		pop	es
  8030 000000BE 1F                      		pop	ds
  8031 000000BF 5D                      		pop	bp
  8032 000000C0 5F                      		pop	di
  8033 000000C1 5A                      		pop	dx
  8034 000000C2 59                      		pop	cx
  8035 000000C3 58                      		pop	ax
  8036 000000C4 5E                      		pop	si
  8037 000000C5 83C402                  		add	sp, 2		; get rid of fake return address
  8038                                  	
  8039                                  		; fall through into bc_retf
  8040                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------	
  8041                                  bc_retf:
  8042 000000C8 CB                      		retf
  8043                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8044                                  
  8045                                  command_error:				
  8046 000000C9 E80900                  		call	bc_cmderr
  8047 000000CC EBE2                    		jmp	short already_got_ah_status
  8048                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8049                                  ; 01/05/2019
  8050                                  
  8051                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8052                                  ; The following piece of hack is for supporting CP/M compatibility
  8053                                  ; Basically at offset 5 we have a far call into 0:c0. But this does not call
  8054                                  ; 0:c0 directly instead it call f01d:fef0, because it needs to support 'lhld 6'
  8055                                  ; The following hack has to reside at ffff:d0 (= f01d:fef0) if BIOS is loaded
  8056                                  ; high.
  8057                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8058                                  
  8059                                  		;db 7 dup(0)
  8060                                  
  8061                                  		; 15/10/2022
  8062                                  
  8063 000000CE 0000                    		dw 0		; pad to bring offset to 0D0h
  8064                                  
  8065 000000D0 00<rep 5h>              off_d0: 	times 5 db 0	; 5 bytes from 0:c0 will be copied onto here
  8066                                  				;  which is the CP/M call 5 entry point
  8067                                  		
  8068                                  
  8069                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8070                                  
  8071                                  ;	exit - all routines return through this path
  8072                                  
  8073                                  bc_cmderr:				
  8074 000000D5 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  8075                                  					; unknown command error
  8076                                  
  8077                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8078                                  
  8079                                  ;	now zero the count field by subtracting its current value,
  8080                                  ;	  which is still in cx, from itself.
  8081                                  
  8082                                  ;	subtract the number of i/o's NOT YET COMPLETED from total
  8083                                  ;	  in order to return the number actually complete
  8084                                  
  8085                                  bc_err_cnt:	
  8086                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
  8087                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8088 000000D7 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8089 000000DB 26294F12                		sub	[es:bx+18], cx	; [es:bx+count]
  8090                                  					; # of successful i/o's
  8091 000000DF B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; mark error return
  8092 000000E1 F9                      		stc			; indicate abnormal end
  8093 000000E2 C3                      		retn
  8094                                  
  8095                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8096                                  
  8097                                  ;Bios_Code ends
  8098                                  
  8099                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8100                                  ; MSCHAR.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  8101                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8102                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  8103                                  ; 10/01/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8104                                  
  8105                                  ; 30/04/2019
  8106                                  
  8107                                  ;title	mschar - character and clock devices
  8108                                  
  8109                                  ;MODE_CTRLBRK	equ	0FFh
  8110                                  
  8111                                  ; BIOSCODE:00E4h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  8112                                  
  8113                                  ;************************************************************************
  8114                                  ;*									*
  8115                                  ;*	device driver dispatch tables					*
  8116                                  ;*									*
  8117                                  ;*	each table starts with a byte which lists the number of		*
  8118                                  ;*	legal functions, followed by that number of words. Each		*
  8119                                  ;*	word represents an offset of a routine in Bios_Code which	*
  8120                                  ;*	handles the function. The functions are terminated with		*
  8121                                  ;*	a near return. If carry is reset, a 'done' code is returned	*
  8122                                  ;*	to the caller. If carry is set, the ah/al registers are		*
  8123                                  ;*	returned as abnormal completion status. Notice that ds		*
  8124                                  ;*	is assumed to point to the Bios_Data segment throughout.	*
  8125                                  ;*									*
  8126                                  ;************************************************************************
  8127                                  
  8128                                  		; 13/12/2022
  8129                                  		;db 0
  8130                                  
  8131                                  		; 13/12/202
  8132 000000E3 0B                      con_table:	db ((con_table_end - con_table)-1)/2 ; 11
  8133                                  					; 2C7h:0E4h = 70h:2654h
  8134 000000E4 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; bc_exvec at 2C7h:1FBh	= 70h:276Bh
  8135                                  					; 00 init
  8136 000000E6 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 01
  8137 000000E8 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 02
  8138 000000EA [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr ; 0D5h	; bc_exvec at 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  8139                                  					; 03
  8140 000000EC [5B01]                  		dw con_read  ; 15Ch	; con_read at 2C7h:15Ch	= 70h:26CCh
  8141                                  					; 04
  8142 000000EE [9E01]                  		dw con_rdnd  ; 19Fh	; con_rdnd at 2C7h:19Fh	= 70h:270Fh
  8143                                  					; 05
  8144 000000F0 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 06
  8145 000000F2 [0702]                  		dw con_flush ; 209h	; con_flush at 2C7h:209h = 70h:2779h
  8146                                  					; 07
  8147 000000F4 [FB01]                  		dw con_writ  ; 1FDh	; con_writ at 2C7h:1FDh	= 70h:276Dh
  8148                                  					; 08
  8149 000000F6 [FB01]                  		dw con_writ  ; 1FDh	; 09
  8150 000000F8 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 0A
  8151                                  con_table_end:
  8152 000000FA 1A                      prn_table:	db ((prn_table_end - prn_table)-1)/2 ; 26			
  8153                                  					; 2C7h:0FBh = 70h:266Bh
  8154 000000FB [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; bc_exvec
  8155 000000FD [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  8156 000000FF [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  8157 00000101 [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; bc_cmderr
  8158 00000103 [1802]                  		dw prn_input  ;	21Ah	; prn_input
  8159                                  					; 04 indicate zero chars read
  8160 00000105 [C601]                  		dw z_bus_exit ; 1C8h	; z_bus_exit
  8161                                  					; 05 read non-destructive
  8162 00000107 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8163 00000109 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 07
  8164 0000010B [1D02]                  		dw prn_writ   ;	21Fh	; prn_writ
  8165 0000010D [1D02]                  		dw prn_writ   ; 21Fh	; 09
  8166 0000010F [4E02]                  		dw prn_stat   ; 251h	; prn_stat
  8167 00000111 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0B
  8168 00000113 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0C
  8169 00000115 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0D
  8170 00000117 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0E
  8171 00000119 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0F
  8172 0000011B [8802]                  		dw prn_tilbusy ; 28Bh	; prn_tilbusy
  8173 0000011D [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 11
  8174 0000011F [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 12
  8175 00000121 [B602]                  		dw prn_genioctl ; 2BAh	; prn_genioctl
  8176 00000123 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 14
  8177 00000125 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 15
  8178 00000127 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 16
  8179 00000129 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 17
  8180 0000012B [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 18
  8181 0000012D [EB02]                  		dw prn_ioctl_query ; 2F0h ; prn_ioctl_query
  8182                                  prn_table_end:
  8183 0000012F 0B                      aux_table:	db ((aux_table_end - aux_table)-1)/2 ; 11			
  8184                                  					; 2C7h:130h = 70h:26A0h
  8185 00000130 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 00 - init
  8186 00000132 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  8187 00000134 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  8188 00000136 [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; 03
  8189 00000138 [0603]                  		dw aux_read   ; 30Dh	; aux_read ; 04	- read
  8190 0000013A [2D03]                  		dw aux_rdnd   ; 335h	; aux_rdnd - 05	- read non-destructive
  8191 0000013C [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8192 0000013E [6303]                  		dw aux_flsh   ;	36Ch	; aux_flsh
  8193 00000140 [6A03]                  		dw aux_writ   ;	374h	; aux_writ
  8194 00000142 [6A03]                  		dw aux_writ   ;	374h	; 09
  8195 00000144 [4D03]                  		dw aux_wrst   ;	355h	; aux_wrst
  8196                                  aux_table_end:
  8197 00000146 0A                      tim_table	db ((tim_table_end - tim_table)-1)/2 ; 10
  8198                                  					; 2C7h:147h = 70h:26B7h
  8199 00000147 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 00
  8200 00000149 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  8201 0000014B [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  8202 0000014D [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; 03
  8203 0000014F [2904]                  		dw tim_read   ;	435h	; tim_read
  8204 00000151 [C601]                  		dw z_bus_exit ; 1C8h	; z_bus_exit
  8205 00000153 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8206 00000155 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 07
  8207 00000157 [D003]                  		dw tim_writ   ; 3DBh	; tim_writ
  8208 00000159 [D003]                  		dw tim_writ   ; 3DBh	; 09
  8209                                  tim_table_end:
  8210                                  
  8211                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8212                                  
  8213                                  ;************************************************************************
  8214                                  ;*									*
  8215                                  ;*	con_read - read cx bytes from keyboard into buffer at es:di	*
  8216                                  ;*									*
  8217                                  ;************************************************************************
  8218                                  
  8219                                  con_read:				; 2C7h:15Ch = 70h:26CCh
  8220                                  		;jcxz	short con_exit	; read cx bytes	from keyboard into buffer
  8221 0000015B E306                    		jcxz	con_exit	; 19/10/2022
  8222                                  con_loop:				
  8223 0000015D E80500                  		call	chrin		; get char in al
  8224 00000160 AA                      		stosb			; store	char at	es:di
  8225 00000161 E2FA                    		loop	con_loop
  8226                                  con_exit:				
  8227 00000163 F8                      		clc
  8228 00000164 C3                      		retn
  8229                                  
  8230                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8231                                  
  8232                                  ;************************************************************************
  8233                                  ;*									*
  8234                                  ;*	chrin - input single char from keyboard into al			*
  8235                                  ;*									*
  8236                                  ;*	  we are going to issue extended keyboard function, if		*
  8237                                  ;*	  supported. the returning value of the extended keystroke	*
  8238                                  ;*	  of the extended keyboard function uses 0E0h in al		*
  8239                                  ;*	  instead of 00h as in the conventional keyboard function.	*
  8240                                  ;*	  this creates a conflict when the user entered real		*
  8241                                  ;*	  greek alpha charater (= 0E0h) to  distinguish the extended	*
  8242                                  ;*	  keystroke and the greek alpha. this case will be handled	*
  8243                                  ;*	  in the following manner:					*
  8244                                  ;*									*
  8245                                  ;*	      ah = 16h							*
  8246                                  ;*	      int 16h							*
  8247                                  ;*	      if al == 0, then extended code (in ah)			*
  8248                                  ;*	      else if al == 0E0h, then					*
  8249                                  ;*	      if ah <> 0, then extended code (in ah)			*
  8250                                  ;*		else greek_alpha character.				*
  8251                                  ;*									*
  8252                                  ;*	also, for compatibility reason, if an extended code is		*
  8253                                  ;*	  detected, then we are going to change the value in al		*
  8254                                  ;*	  from 0E0h to 00h.						*
  8255                                  ;*									*
  8256                                  ;************************************************************************
  8257                                  
  8258                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8259                                  chrin:		
  8260 00000165 8A26[E504]              		mov	ah, [keyrd_func] ; set by msinit. 0 or 10h
  8261 00000169 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8262 0000016B 8606[0C00]              		xchg	al, [altah]	; get character	& zero altah
  8263 0000016F 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8264 00000171 752A                    		jnz	short keyret
  8265 00000173 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8266 00000175 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  8267 00000177 74EC                    		jz	short chrin
  8268 00000179 3D0072                  		cmp	ax, 7200h	; check	for ctrl-prtsc
  8269 0000017C 7504                    		jnz	short alt_ext_chk
  8270 0000017E B010                    		mov	al, 10h
  8271 00000180 EB1B                    		jmp	short keyret
  8272                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8273                                  
  8274                                  ;  if operation was extended function (i.e. keyrd_func != 0) then
  8275                                  ;    if character read was 0E0h then
  8276                                  ;      if extended byte was zero (i.e. ah == 0) then
  8277                                  ;	 goto keyret
  8278                                  ;      else
  8279                                  ;	 set al to zero
  8280                                  ;	 goto alt_save
  8281                                  ;      endif
  8282                                  ;    endif
  8283                                  ;  endif
  8284                                  
  8285                                  alt_ext_chk:
  8286 00000182 803E[E504]00            		cmp	byte [keyrd_func], 0
  8287 00000187 740C                    		jz	short not_ext
  8288 00000189 3CE0                    		cmp	al, 0E0h
  8289 0000018B 7508                    		jnz	short not_ext
  8290 0000018D 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
  8291 0000018F 740C                    		jz	short keyret
  8292 00000191 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8293 00000193 EB04                    		jmp	short alt_save
  8294                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8295                                  
  8296                                  not_ext:				
  8297 00000195 08C0                    		or	al, al		; special case?
  8298 00000197 7504                    		jnz	short keyret
  8299                                  alt_save:				
  8300 00000199 8826[0C00]              		mov	[altah], ah	; store	special	key
  8301                                  keyret:					
  8302 0000019D C3                      		retn
  8303                                  
  8304                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8305                                  
  8306                                  ;************************************************************************
  8307                                  ;*									*
  8308                                  ;*	con_rdnd - keyboard non destructive read, no wait		*
  8309                                  ;*									*
  8310                                  ;*	pc-convertible-type machine: if bit 10 is set by the dos	*
  8311                                  ;*	in the status word of the request packet, and there is no	*
  8312                                  ;*	character in the input buffer, the driver issues a system	*
  8313                                  ;*	wait request to the rom. on return from the rom, it returns	*
  8314                                  ;*	a 'char-not-found' to the dos.					*
  8315                                  ;*									*
  8316                                  ;************************************************************************
  8317                                  
  8318                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8319                                  con_rdnd:				
  8320 0000019E A0[0C00]                		mov	al, [altah]
  8321 000001A1 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8322 000001A3 754C                    		jnz	short rdexit
  8323 000001A5 8A26[E604]              		mov	ah, [keysts_func]
  8324 000001A9 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8325 000001AB 751D                    		jnz	short gotchr
  8326 000001AD 803E[7900]00            		cmp	byte [fhavek09], 0
  8327 000001B2 7412                    		jz	short z_bus_exit
  8328 000001B4 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8329                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8330 000001B8 26F6470404              		test	byte [es:bx+4], 04h
  8331                                  		;test	word [es:bx+3], 400h ; [es:bx+status]
  8332 000001BD 7407                    		jz	short z_bus_exit
  8333 000001BF B80041                  		mov	ax, 4100h
  8334 000001C2 30DB                    		xor	bl, bl
  8335 000001C4 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - WAIT	ON EXTERNAL EVENT (CONVERTIBLE)
  8336                                  					; AL = condition type, BH = condition compare or mask value
  8337                                  					; BL = timeout value times 55 milliseconds, 00h	means no timeout
  8338                                  					; DX = I/O port	address	if AL bit 4 set
  8339                                  z_bus_exit:				
  8340 000001C6 F9                      		stc			; 2C7h:1C8h = 70h:2738h
  8341 000001C7 B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; indicate busy	status
  8342 000001C9 C3                      		retn
  8343                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8344                                  
  8345                                  gotchr:					
  8346 000001CA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  8347 000001CC 7508                    		jnz	short notbrk	; check	for null after break
  8348 000001CE 8A26[E504]              		mov	ah, [keyrd_func] ; issue keyboard read function
  8349 000001D2 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8350 000001D4 EBC8                    		jmp	short con_rdnd	; get a	real status
  8351                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8352                                  
  8353                                  notbrk:					
  8354 000001D6 3D0072                  		cmp	ax, 7200h	; check	for ctrl-prtsc
  8355 000001D9 7504                    		jnz	short rd_ext_chk
  8356 000001DB B010                    		mov	al, 10h		; ('P' & 1Fh) ; return control p
  8357 000001DD EB12                    		jmp	short rdexit
  8358                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8359                                  
  8360                                  rd_ext_chk:				
  8361 000001DF 803E[E504]00            		cmp	byte [keyrd_func], 0 ; extended keyboard function?
  8362 000001E4 740B                    		jz	short rdexit
  8363 000001E6 3CE0                    		cmp	al, 0E0h	; extended key value or	greek alpha?
  8364 000001E8 7507                    		jnz	short rdexit
  8365 000001EA 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0		; scan code exist?
  8366 000001ED 7402                    		jz	short rdexit	; yes. greek alpha char.
  8367 000001EF B000                    		mov	al, 0		; no. extended key stroke.
  8368                                  					; change it for	compatibility
  8369                                  rdexit:					
  8370 000001F1 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8371 000001F5 2688470D                		mov	[es:bx+13], al	; [es:bx+media]
  8372                                  					; return keyboard character here
  8373                                  bc_exvec:				
  8374 000001F9 F8                      		clc			; bc_exvec at 2C7h:1FBh	= 70h:276Bh
  8375                                  					; indicate normal termination
  8376 000001FA C3                      		retn
  8377                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8378                                  
  8379                                  ;************************************************************************
  8380                                  ;*									*
  8381                                  ;*	con_write - console write routine				*
  8382                                  ;*									*
  8383                                  ;*	entry:	es:di -> buffer						*
  8384                                  ;*		cx    =  count						*
  8385                                  ;*									*
  8386                                  ;************************************************************************
  8387                                  
  8388                                  con_writ:
  8389                                  		;jcxz	short bc_exvec
  8390 000001FB E3FC                    		jcxz	bc_exvec	; 19/10/2022
  8391                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8392                                  		;jcxz	cc_ret
  8393                                  con_lp:					
  8394 000001FD 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]
  8395 00000200 47                      		inc	di
  8396 00000201 CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
  8397                                  					; AL = character to display
  8398 00000203 E2F8                    		loop	con_lp
  8399                                  cc_ret:					
  8400 00000205 F8                      		clc
  8401 00000206 C3                      		retn
  8402                                  
  8403                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8404                                  
  8405                                  ;************************************************************************
  8406                                  ;*									*
  8407                                  ;*	con_flush - flush out keyboard queue				*
  8408                                  ;*									*
  8409                                  ;************************************************************************
  8410                                  
  8411                                  con_flush:
  8412 00000207 C606[0C00]00            		mov	byte [altah], 0	; clear	out holding buffer
  8413                                  flloop:					; while	(charavail()) charread();	
  8414 0000020C B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8415 0000020E CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - CHECK BUFFER, DO NOT CLEAR
  8416                                  					; Return: ZF clear if character	in buffer
  8417                                  					; AH = scan code, AL = character
  8418                                  					; ZF set if no character in buffer
  8419 00000210 74F3                    		jz	short cc_ret
  8420 00000212 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8421 00000214 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
  8422                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
  8423 00000216 EBF4                    		jmp	short flloop
  8424                                  
  8425                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8426                                  
  8427                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8428                                  
  8429                                  ;************************************************************************
  8430                                  ;*									*
  8431                                  ;*	some equates for rom bios printer i/o				*
  8432                                  ;*									*
  8433                                  ;************************************************************************
  8434                                  
  8435                                  ; ibm rom status bits (i don't trust them, neither should you)
  8436                                  ; warning!!! the ibm rom does not return just one bit. it returns a
  8437                                  ; whole slew of bits, only one of which is correct.
  8438                                  
  8439                                  ;notbusystatus	equ 10000000b		; not busy
  8440                                  ;nopaperstatus	equ 00100000b		; no more paper
  8441                                  ;prnselected	equ 00010000b		; printer selected
  8442                                  ;ioerrstatus	equ 00001000b		; some kinda error
  8443                                  ;timeoutstatus	equ 00000001b		; time out.
  8444                                  ;
  8445                                  ;noprinter	equ 00110000b		; no printer attached
  8446                                  
  8447                                  ; 18/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8448                                  ;error_I24_out_of_paper	equ 9 ; MSDOS 6.0, ERR.INC, 1991
  8449                                  
  8450                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8451                                  
  8452                                  ;************************************************************************
  8453                                  ;*									*
  8454                                  ;*	prn_input - return with no error but zero chars read		*
  8455                                  ;*									*
  8456                                  ;*	enter with cx = number of characters requested			*
  8457                                  ;*									*
  8458                                  ;************************************************************************
  8459                                  
  8460                                  prn_input:				; 2C7h:21Ah = 70h:278Ah
  8461 00000218 E8BCFE                  		call	bc_err_cnt	; reset	count to zero
  8462                                  					; (sub reqpkt.count,cx)
  8463                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8464                                  prn_done:
  8465 0000021B F8                      		clc			; but return with carry	reset for no error
  8466 0000021C C3                      		retn
  8467                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8468                                  
  8469                                  ;************************************************************************
  8470                                  ;*									*
  8471                                  ;*	prn_writ - write cx bytes from es:di to printer device		*
  8472                                  ;*									*
  8473                                  ;*	auxnum has printer number					*
  8474                                  ;*									*
  8475                                  ;************************************************************************
  8476                                  
  8477                                  prn_writ:				; 2C7h:21Fh = 70h:278Fh
  8478                                  		;jcxz	short prn_done	; no chars to output
  8479 0000021D E3FC                    		jcxz	prn_done	; 19/10/2022
  8480                                  prn_loop:				
  8481 0000021F BB0200                  		mov	bx, 2		; retry	count
  8482                                  prn_out:				
  8483 00000222 E83600                  		call	prnstat		; get status
  8484 00000225 751D                    		jnz	short TestPrnError
  8485 00000227 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to print
  8486 0000022A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8487 0000022C E82E00                  		call	prnop		; print	to printer
  8488 0000022F 7419                    		jz	short prn_con	; no error - continue
  8489 00000231 80FCFF                  		cmp	ah, 0FFh	; MODE_CTRLBRK
  8490 00000234 7509                    		jnz	short _prnwf
  8491 00000236 B00C                    		mov	al, 0Ch		; error_I24_gen_failure
  8492 00000238 C606[0C00]00            		mov	byte [altah], 0
  8493 0000023D EB08                    		jmp	short pmessg
  8494                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8495                                  
  8496                                  _prnwf:					
  8497 0000023F F6C401                  		test	ah, 1		; timeoutstatus
  8498 00000242 7406                    		jz	short prn_con
  8499                                  TestPrnError:

  8501 00000245 75DB                    		jnz	short prn_out
  8502                                  pmessg:					
  8503 00000247 E98DFE                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt

  8513                                  		; cf=0
  8514 0000024D C3                      		retn
