  8517                                  ;************************************************************************
  8518                                  ;*									*
  8519                                  ;*	prn_stat - device driver entry to return printer status		*
  8520                                  ;*									*
  8521                                  ;************************************************************************
  8522                                  
  8523                                  prn_stat:				; 2C7h:251h = 70h:27C1h
  8524 0000024E E80A00                  		call	prnstat		; device in dx
  8525 00000251 75F4                    		jnz	short pmessg
  8526 00000253 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; notbusystatus

  8528                                  		; 12/12/2022

  8530 00000258 E96BFF                  		jmp	z_bus_exit
  8531                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8532                                  
  8533                                  ;************************************************************************
  8534                                  ;*									*
  8535                                  ;*	prnstat - utility function to call ROM BIOS to check		*
  8536                                  ;*		 printer status. Return meaningful error code		*
  8537                                  ;*									*
  8538                                  ;************************************************************************
  8539                                  
  8540                                  prnstat:				
  8541 0000025B B402                    		mov	ah, 2		; set command for get status
  8542                                  					; PRINTER - GET	STATUS
  8543                                  					; DX = printer port (0-3)
  8544                                  					; Return: AH = status
  8545                                  
  8546                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8547                                  
  8548                                  ;************************************************************************
  8549                                  ;*									*
  8550                                  ;*	prnop - call ROM BIOS printer function in ah			*
  8551                                  ;*		return zero true if no error				*
  8552                                  ;*		return zero false if error, al = error code		*
  8553                                  ;*									*
  8554                                  ;************************************************************************
  8555                                  
  8556                                  prnop:	
  8557 0000025D 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; get printer number
  8558 00000261 CD17                    		int	17h
  8559                                  
  8560                                  	; This check was added to see if this is a case of no
  8561                                  	; printer being installed. This tests checks to be sure
  8562                                  	; the error is noprinter (30h)
  8563                                  
  8564 00000263 50                      		push	ax
  8565 00000264 80E430                  		and	ah, 30h
  8566 00000267 80FC30                  		cmp	ah, 30h		; noprinter
  8567 0000026A 58                      		pop	ax
  8568 0000026B 7506                    		jnz	short NextTest
  8569 0000026D 80E4DF                  		and	ah, 0DFh	; ~nopaperstatus
  8570 00000270 80CC08                  		or	ah, 8		; ioerrstatus
  8571                                  
  8572                                  ; examine the status bits to see if an error occurred. unfortunately, several
  8573                                  ; of the bits are set so we have to pick and choose. we must be extremely
  8574                                  ; careful about breaking basic.
  8575                                  
  8576                                  NextTest:				
  8577 00000273 F6C428                  		test	ah, 28h		; (ioerrstatus+nopaperstatus)
  8578                                  					; i/o error?
  8579 00000276 740A                    		jz	short checknotready ; no, try not ready
  8580                                  
  8581                                  ; at this point, we know we have an error. the converse is not true
  8582                                  
  8583 00000278 B009                    		mov	al, 9		; error_I24_out_of_paper
  8584                                  					; first, assume	out of paper
  8585 0000027A F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; out of paper set?
  8586 0000027D 7502                    		jnz	short ret1	; yes, error is	set
  8587 0000027F FEC0                    		inc	al		; return al=10 (i/o error)
  8588                                  ret1:					
  8589 00000281 C3                      		retn
  8590                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8591                                  
  8592                                  checknotready:				
  8593 00000282 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; assume not-ready
  8594 00000284 F6C401                  		test	ah, 1
  8595 00000287 C3                      		retn
  8596                                  
  8597                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8598                                  
  8599                                  ;************************************************************************
  8600                                  ;*									*
  8601                                  ;*	prn_tilbusy - output until busy. Used by print spooler.		*
  8602                                  ;*		     this entry point should never block waiting for	*
  8603                                  ;*		     device to come ready.				*
  8604                                  ;*									*
  8605                                  ;*	inputs:	cx = count, es:di -> buffer				*
  8606                                  ;*	outputs: set the number of bytes transferred in the		*
  8607                                  ;*		 device driver request packet				*
  8608                                  ;*									*
  8609                                  ;************************************************************************
  8610                                  
  8611                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8612                                  prn_tilbusy:				; 2C7h:28Bh = 70h:27FBh
  8613 00000288 89FE                    		mov	si, di		; everything is	set for	lodsb
  8614                                  prn_tilbloop:				
  8615 0000028A 51                      		push	cx
  8616 0000028B 53                      		push	bx
  8617 0000028C 30FF                    		xor	bh, bh
  8618 0000028E 8A1E[E704]              		mov	bl, [printdev]
  8619 00000292 D1E3                    		shl	bx, 1
  8620                                  		;mov	cx, ds:wait_count[bx] ;	wait count times to come ready
  8621 00000294 8B8F[E804]              		mov	cx, [wait_count+bx]
  8622 00000298 5B                      		pop	bx
  8623                                  prn_getstat:				
  8624 00000299 E8BFFF                  		call	prnstat		; get status
  8625 0000029C 7514                    		jnz	short prn_bperr	; error
  8626 0000029E F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; ready	yet?
  8627 000002A1 E1F6                    		loope	prn_getstat	; no, go for more
  8628 000002A3 59                      		pop	cx		; get original count
  8629 000002A4 740D                    		jz	short prn_berr	; still	not ready => done
  8630 000002A6 26                      		es
  8631 000002A7 AC                      		lodsb
  8632                                  		;lods	byte ptr es:[si] ; es
  8633                                  					; lodsb
  8634 000002A8 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8635 000002AA E8B0FF                  		call	prnop
  8636 000002AD 7504                    		jnz	short prn_berr	; error
  8637 000002AF E2D9                    		loop	prn_tilbloop
  8638                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8639                                  		; cf=0 (prnop)
  8640                                  		;clc			; normal no-error return
  8641 000002B1 C3                      		retn			;   from device driver
  8642                                  
  8643                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8644                                  
  8645                                  prn_bperr:				
  8646 000002B2 59                      		pop	cx		; restore transfer count from stack
  8647                                  prn_berr:				
  8648 000002B3 E921FE                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  8649                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8650                                  
  8651                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8652                                  
  8653                                  ;************************************************************************
  8654                                  ;*									*
  8655                                  ;*	prn_genioctl - get/set printer retry count			*
  8656                                  ;*									*
  8657                                  ;************************************************************************
  8658                                  
  8659                                  ; IOCTL.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  8660                                  ; 11/01/2019
  8661                                  
  8662                                  ;********************************;*
  8663                                  ; CHARACTER DEVICES (PRINTERS)	 ;*
  8664                                  ;********************************;*
  8665                                  
  8666                                  ;;RAWIO SUB-FUNCTIONS
  8667                                  ;;get_retry_count equ 65h
  8668                                  ;;set_retry_count equ 45h
  8669                                  
  8670                                  ;;struc A_RETRYCOUNT
  8671                                  ;;.rc_count: resw 1
  8672                                  ;;endstruc
  8673                                  
  8674                                  ;ioc_pc equ 5
  8675                                  
  8676                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8677                                  
  8678                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8679                                  prn_genioctl:				; 2C7h:2BAh = 70h:282Ah
  8680 000002B6 C43E[1200]              		les	di, [ptrsav]
  8681 000002BA 26807D0D05              		cmp	byte [es:di+13], 5 ; [es:di+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
  8682                                  					; ioc_pc
  8683 000002BF 7403                    		jz	short prnfunc_ok
  8684                                  
  8685                                  prnfuncerr:				
  8686 000002C1 E911FE                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
  8687                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8688                                  
  8689                                  prnfunc_ok:				
  8690 000002C4 268A450E                		mov	al, [es:di+14]	; [es:di+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION]
  8691 000002C8 26C47D13                		les	di, [es:di+19]	; [es:di+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
  8692 000002CC 30FF                    		xor	bh, bh
  8693                                  		;mov	bl, ds:printdev	; get index into retry counts
  8694 000002CE 8A1E[E704]              		mov	bl, [printdev]
  8695 000002D2 D1E3                    		shl	bx, 1
  8696                                  		;mov	cx, ds:wait_count[bx] ;	pull out retry count for device
  8697 000002D4 8B8F[E804]              		mov	cx, [wait_count+bx]
  8698 000002D8 3C65                    		cmp	al, 65h		; get_retry_count
  8699 000002DA 7407                    		jz	short prngetcount
  8700 000002DC 3C45                    		cmp	al, 45h		; set_retry_count
  8701 000002DE 75E1                    		jnz	short prnfuncerr
  8702 000002E0 268B0D                  		mov	cx, [es:di]
  8703                                  prngetcount:				
  8704                                  		;mov	ds:wait_count[bx], cx
  8705 000002E3 898F[E804]              		mov	[wait_count+bx], cx
  8706 000002E7 26890D                  		mov	[es:di], cx	; [es:di+A_RETRYCOUNT.RC_COUNT]
  8707                                  					; return current retry count
  8708                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8709                                  		; cf=0
  8710                                  		;clc
  8711 000002EA C3                      		retn
  8712                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8713                                  
  8714                                  ;************************************************************************
  8715                                  ;*									*

  8742                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8743                                  
  8744                                  ;************************************************************************
  8745                                  ;*									*
  8746                                  ;*	aux port driver code -- "aux" == "com1"				*
  8747                                  ;*									*
  8748                                  ;*	the device driver entry/dispatch code sets up auxnum to		*
  8749                                  ;*	give the com port number to use (0=com1, 1=com2, 2=com3...)	*
  8750                                  ;*									*
  8751                                  ;************************************************************************
  8752                                  
  8753                                  ;	values in ah, requesting function of int 14h in rom bios
  8754                                  
  8755                                  ;auxfunc_send	 equ	1	;transmit
  8756                                  ;auxfunc_receive equ	2	;read
  8757                                  ;auxfunc_status	 equ	3	;request status
  8758                                  
  8759                                  ;	error flags, reported by int 14h, reported in ah:
  8760                                  
  8761                                  ;flag_data_ready equ	01h	;data ready
  8762                                  ;flag_overrun	 equ	02h	;overrun error
  8763                                  ;flag_parity	 equ	04h	;parity error
  8764                                  ;flag_frame	 equ	08h	;framing error
  8765                                  ;flag_break	 equ	10h	;break detect
  8766                                  ;flag_tranhol_emp equ	20h	;transmit holding register empty
  8767                                  ;flag_timeout	 equ	80h	;timeout
  8768                                  
  8769                                  ;	these flags reported in al:
  8770                                  
  8771                                  ;flag_cts	 equ	10h	;clear to send
  8772                                  ;flag_dsr	 equ	20h	;data set ready
  8773                                  ;flag_rec_sig	 equ	80h	;receive line signal detect
  8774                                  
  8775                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8776                                  
  8777                                  ;************************************************************************
  8778                                  ;*									*
  8779                                  ;*	aux_read - read cx bytes from [auxnum] aux port to buffer	*
  8780                                  ;*		   at es:di						*
  8781                                  ;*									*
  8782                                  ;************************************************************************
  8783                                  
  8784                                  aux_read:				; 2C7h:30Dh = 70h:287Dh
  8785                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2
  8786 00000306 E311                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8787 00000308 E87700                  		call	getbx		; put address of auxbuf	in bx
  8788 0000030B 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8789 0000030D 8607                    		xchg	al, [bx]
  8790 0000030F 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8791 00000311 7503                    		jnz	short aux2
  8792                                  aux1:					
  8793 00000313 E80500                  		call	auxin		; get character	from port
  8794                                  					; won't return if error
  8795                                  aux2:					
  8796 00000316 AA                      		stosb
  8797 00000317 E2FA                    		loop	aux1		; if more characters, go around	again
  8798                                  exvec2:					
  8799 00000319 F8                      		clc			; all done, successful exit
  8800                                  auxin_retn:	; 18/12/2022
  8801 0000031A C3                      		retn
  8802                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8803                                  
  8804                                  ;************************************************************************
  8805                                  ;*									*
  8806                                  ;*	auxin - call rom bios to read character from aux port		*
  8807                                  ;*		if error occurs, map the error and return one		*
  8808                                  ;*		level up to device driver exit code, setting		*
  8809                                  ;*		the number of bytes transferred appropriately		*
  8810                                  ;*									*
  8811                                  ;************************************************************************
  8812                                  
  8813                                  auxin:					
  8814 0000031B B402                    		mov	ah, 2		; auxfunc_receive
  8815 0000031D E83C00                  		call	auxop
  8816 00000320 F6C40E                  		test	ah, 0Eh		; flag_frame|flag_parity|flag_overrun
  8817                                  		;jnz	short arbad	; skip if any error bits set
  8818                                  		;retn
  8819                                  		; 25/06/2023 (BugFix)
  8820 00000323 74F5                    		jz	short auxin_retn
  8821                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8822                                  
  8823                                  arbad:					
  8824 00000325 58                      		pop	ax		; remove return	address	(near call)
  8825 00000326 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8826 00000328 0CB0                    		or	al, 0B0h	; flag_rec_sig|	flag_dsr|flag_cts
  8827 0000032A E9AAFD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  8828                                  
  8829                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8830                                  
  8831                                  ;************************************************************************
  8832                                  ;*									*
  8833                                  ;*	aux_rdnd - non-destructive aux port read			*
  8834                                  ;*									*
  8835                                  ;************************************************************************
  8836                                  
  8837                                  aux_rdnd:				; 2C7h:335h = 70h:28A5h
  8838 0000032D E85200                  		call	getbx
  8839 00000330 8A07                    		mov	al, [bx]	; have bx point	to auxbuf
  8840 00000332 08C0                    		or	al, al		; if al	is non-zero (char in buffer)
  8841 00000334 7511                    		jnz	short auxdrx	; then return character
  8842 00000336 E82100                  		call	auxstat		; if not, get status of	aux device
  8843 00000339 F6C401                  		test	ah, 1		; flag_data_ready - test data ready
  8844 0000033C 740C                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8845 0000033E A820                    		test	al, 20h		; flag_dsr - test data set ready
  8846 00000340 7408                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8847 00000342 E8D6FF                  		call	auxin		; else aux is ready, get character
  8848 00000345 8807                    		mov	[bx], al
  8849                                  auxdrx:					
  8850 00000347 E9A7FE                  		jmp	rdexit		; return busy status
  8851                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8852                                  
  8853                                  auxbus:					
  8854 0000034A E979FE                  		jmp	z_bus_exit

  8856                                  
  8857                                  ;************************************************************************
  8858                                  ;*									*
  8859                                  ;*	aux_wrst - return aux port write status				*
  8860                                  ;*									*
  8861                                  ;************************************************************************
  8862                                  
  8863                                  aux_wrst:				; 2C7h:355h = 70h:28C5h

  8865 00000350 A820                    		test	al, 20h		; test data set	ready
  8866 00000352 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8867 00000354 F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
  8868 00000357 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8869                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8870                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
  8871                                  		;clc
  8872 00000359 C3                      		retn
  8873                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8874                                  
  8875                                  ;************************************************************************
  8876                                  ;*									*
  8877                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
  8878                                  ;*									*
  8879                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  8880                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8881                                  ;*									*
  8882                                  ;************************************************************************
  8883                                  
  8884                                  auxstat:				
  8885 0000035A B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  8886                                  
  8887                                  		; fall into auxop
  8888                                  
  8889                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8890                                  
  8891                                  ;************************************************************************
  8892                                  ;*									*
  8893                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  8894                                  ;*									*
  8895                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  8896                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  8897                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8898                                  ;*									*
  8899                                  ;************************************************************************
  8900                                  
  8901                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  8902 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  8903                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  8904                                  					; get port number
  8905 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  8906                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  8907                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  8908 00000362 C3                      		retn
  8909                                  
  8910                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8911                                  
  8912                                  ;************************************************************************
  8913                                  ;*									*
  8914                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  8915                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  8916                                  ;*									*
  8917                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  8918                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  8919                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  8920                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  8921                                  ;*									*
  8922                                  ;************************************************************************
  8923                                  
  8924                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  8925 00000363 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  8926 00000366 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  8927                                  					; zero out buffer
  8928                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8929                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8930                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  8931 00000369 C3                      		retn
  8932                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8933                                  
  8934                                  ;************************************************************************
  8935                                  ;*									*
  8936                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  8937                                  ;*									*
  8938                                  ;************************************************************************
  8939                                  
  8940                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  8941                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  8942 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8943                                  aux_loop:				
  8944 0000036C 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  8945                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  8946 0000036F 47                      		inc	di
  8947 00000370 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  8948 00000372 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  8949 00000375 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  8950 00000378 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  8951 0000037A B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  8952 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  8953                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8954                                  
  8955                                  awok:					
  8956 0000037F E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  8957                                  					; still	more character to print
  8958                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8959                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8960                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  8961 00000381 C3                      		retn
  8962                                  
  8963                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8964                                  
  8965                                  ;************************************************************************
  8966                                  ;*									*
  8967                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  8968                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  8969                                  ;*									*
  8970                                  ;************************************************************************
  8971                                  
  8972                                  getbx:	
  8973 00000382 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  8974                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  8975                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  8976 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  8977                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8978                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  8979 0000038A C3                      		retn
  8980                                  
  8981                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8982                                  
  8983                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8984                                  
  8985                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8986                                  ;								:
  8987                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  8988                                  ;								:
  8989                                  ;								:
  8990                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  8991                                  ;								:
  8992                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  8993                                  ;								:
  8994                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  8995                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  8996                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  8997                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  8998                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  8999                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9000                                  ;								:
  9001                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9002                                  ;								:
  9003                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9004                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9005                                  ;								:
  9006                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9007                                  
  9008                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9009                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9010                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9011                                  
  9012                                  ;19/07/2019
  9013                                  ;09/03/2019
  9014                                  
  9015                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9016                                  
  9017                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9018                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9019                                  
  9020 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9021 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9022 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9023 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9024 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9025 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9026 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9027 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9028 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9029 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9030 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9031 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9032 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9033 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9034 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9035                                  
  9036                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9037                                  
  9038 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9039 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9040 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9041 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9042 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9043 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9044 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9045 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9046 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9047 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9048 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9049 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9050 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9051 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9052 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9053 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9054 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9055 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9056 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9057 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9058                                  
  9059                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9060                                  
  9061                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9062                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9063                                  
  9064                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9065                                  ;
  9066                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9067                                  ;
  9068                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9069                                  ;
  9070                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9071                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9072                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9073                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9074                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9075                                  ;
  9076                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9077                                  ;
  9078                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9079                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9080                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9081                                  ;
  9082                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9083                                  
  9084                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9085 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9086 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9087                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9088 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9089                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9090 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9091 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9092                                  					; get binary hours
  9093                                  					; convert to bcd
  9094 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9095                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9096 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9097 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9098 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9099                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9100 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9101 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9102 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9103                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9104 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9105 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9106 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9107 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9108 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9109                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9110                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9111                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9112 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9113                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9114 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9115 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9116                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9117 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9118                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9119                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9120                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9121 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9122 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9123 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9124                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9125                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9126                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9127 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9128 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9129                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9130 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9131 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9132 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9133                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9134                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9135 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9136 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9137 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9138                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9139                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9140                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9141 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9142                                  no_cmos_2:
  9143                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9144                                  		; cf=0				
  9145                                  		;clc
  9146 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9147                                  
  9148                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9149                                  
  9150                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9151                                  
  9152                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9153                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9154                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9155                                  ;
  9156                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9157                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9158                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9159                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9160                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9161                                  ;
  9162                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9163                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9164                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9165                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9166                                  
  9167                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9168 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9169 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9170                                  
  9171                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9172                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9173                                  ;
  9174                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9175                                  ;	       ----------------
  9176                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9177                                  ;
  9178                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9179                                  ;
  9180                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9181                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9182                                  ;		1,193,180
  9183                                  ;
  9184                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9185                                  ;
  9186                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9187                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9188                                  ;		59,659
  9189                                  ;
  9190                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9191                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9192                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9193                                  ;
  9194                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9195                                  ; multiply by 5
  9196                                  
  9197 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9198 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9199                                  					; multiply by 5
  9200 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9201 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9202 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9203 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9204 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9205 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9206 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9207                                  
  9208                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9209                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9210                                  
  9211 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9212 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9213                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9214 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9215 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9216 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9217                                  
  9218                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9219                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9220                                  
  9221 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9222 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9223                                  
  9224                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9225                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9226                                  
  9227 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9228 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9229 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9230 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9231                                  noadj:					
  9232 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9233 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9234                                  
  9235                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9236                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9237                                  
  9238 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9239 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9240 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9241 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9242 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9243 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9244 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9245 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9246                                  
  9247                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9248                                  
  9249 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9250 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9251 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9252 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9253 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9254 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9255 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9256 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9257 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9258                                  
  9259                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9260                                  
  9261                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9262                                  
  9263                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9264                                  ;
  9265                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9266                                  ;
  9267                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9268                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9269                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9270                                  ;
  9271                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9272                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9273                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9274                                  ;			else
  9275                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9276                                  ;		}
  9277                                  ;
  9278                                  ; USES : AX
  9279                                  ;
  9280                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9281                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9282                                  ;
  9283                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9284                                  
  9285                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9286                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9287 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9288 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9289                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9290                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9291                                  					; midnight
  9292                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9293 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9294 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9295 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9296                                  					; and not flag
  9297 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9298 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9299                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9300                                  
  9301                                  inc_case:				
  9302 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9303 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9304 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9305                                  no_rollover:				
  9306 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9307                                  
  9308                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9309                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  9310                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9311                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9312                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9313                                  
  9314                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 3.3 - 02/02/1988
  9315                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9316                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  9317                                  
  9318                                  ;error_unknown_media equ	7	; for use in BUILD BPB call
  9319                                  
  9320                                  ;struc BPB_TYPE
  9321                                  ;.SECSIZE:	resw 1
  9322                                  ;.SECALL:	resb 1
  9323                                  ;.RESNUM:	resw 1
  9324                                  ;.FATNUM:	resb 1
  9325                                  ;.DIRNUM:	resw 1
  9326                                  ;.SECNUM:	resw 1
  9327                                  ;.FATID:	resb 1
  9328                                  ;.FATSIZE:	resw 1
  9329                                  ;.SLIM:		resw 1
  9330                                  ;.HLIM:		resw 1
  9331                                  ;.HIDDEN:	resw 1
  9332                                  ;.size:
  9333                                  ;endstruc
  9334                                  
  9335                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9336                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9337                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9338                                  
  9339                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9340                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9341                                  
  9342                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9343                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9344                                  
  9345                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9346                                  
  9347                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9348                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9349                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9350                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9351                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9352                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9353                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9354                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9355                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9356                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9357                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9358                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9359                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9360                                  
  9361                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9362                                  
  9363                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9364                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9365                                  ;
  9366                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9367                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9368                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9369                                  ;   else
  9370                                  ;	set slow = value
  9371                                  ;   ...
  9372                                  ;*********************************************
  9373                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9374                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9375                                  ;*	 use slow
  9376                                  ;*   else
  9377                                  ;*	 use fast

  9381                                  ;	use slow
  9382                                  ;   else
  9383                                  ;	use fast
  9384                                  ;   ...
  9385                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9386                                  ;

  9389                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9390                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a

  9473                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9474                                  
  9475                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9476                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9477                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9478                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9479                                  ;
  9480                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9481                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9482                                  
  9483                                  SetDrive:	
  9484                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9485 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9486                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9487 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9488 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9489 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9490 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9491 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9492 000004DD F9                      		stc
  9493                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9494 000004DE C3                      		retn
  9495                                  
  9496                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9497                                  
  9498                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9499                                  
  9500                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9501                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9502                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9503                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9504                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9505                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9506                                  
  9507                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9508 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9509 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9510 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9511                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9512 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9513                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9514 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9515                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9516                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9517 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9518                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9519 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9520                                  					; fnon_removable
  9521 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9522 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9523 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9524                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9525                                  
  9526                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9527                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9528 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9529 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9530                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9531 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9532                                  
  9533                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9534                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9535                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9536                                  
  9537 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9538 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9539 00000512 E87912                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9540 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9541 00000517 E8C913                  		call	haschange
  9542 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9543                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9544                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9545                                  			
  9546 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9547 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9548 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9549                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9550 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9551 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
  9552 0000052B EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
  9553                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9554                                  
  9555                                  Media_Unk:

  9557                                  
  9558                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
  9559                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9560                                  Media_Done:	
  9561                                  		; 19/10/2022			
  9562 0000052E 06                      		push	es
  9563 0000052F C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  9564 00000533 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
  9565 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9566 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
  9567 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
  9568 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9569 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
  9570 00000543 E82F13                  		call	media_set_vid

  9573                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check

  9578                                  
  9579                                  err_exitj:				
  9580 0000054D E87D06                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
  9581                                  ret81:					
  9582 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
  9583 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9584                                  
  9585                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9586                                  
  9587                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9588                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9589                                  ; drive.
  9590                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9591                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9592                                  ; returns in si:
  9593                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9594                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9595                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9596                                  ;
  9597                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9598                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9599                                  
  9600                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9601                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9602 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9603 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9604 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9605                                  					; get stored time
  9606 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9607 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9608 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9609 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9610 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9611 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9612 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9613 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9614                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9615 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9616 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9617 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9618                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9619                                  
  9620                                  timepassed:				
  9621 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9622                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9623 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9624                                  
  9625                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9626                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9627 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9628                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9629 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9630                                  
  9631                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9632                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9633                                  Err_Exitj2:
  9634 00000583 EBC8                    		jmp	short err_exitj

  9641                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.

  9643                                  
  9644                                  		; 19/10/2022

  9659 0000059D 72B1                    		jb	short ret81
  9660                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
  9661 0000059F 803E[0A05]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
  9662                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
  9663 000005A4 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9664 000005A9 740A                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; do not set it again from	root dir

  9680                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9681                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
  9682                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
  9683                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.

  9705                                  
  9706                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9707                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
  9708                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
  9709                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
  9710                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
  9711                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
  9712                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
  9713                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
  9714                                  ;
  9715                                  ;	trashes si, cx
  9716                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9717                                  
  9718                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
  9719                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8

  9721                                  clear_ids:
  9722                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
  9723 000005CC 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
  9724                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
  9725                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)

  9728 000005D3 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9729 000005D7 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9730                                  
  9731                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
  9732                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
  9733                                  		; merging them... jgl
  9734                                  
  9735                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9736                                  		; 10/12/2022

  9738                                  
  9739                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
  9740 000005DD BE[1D05]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
  9741 000005E0 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
  9742 000005E3 F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9743                                  		
  9744                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
  9745                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
  9746                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
  9747                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
  9748                                  
  9749                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
  9750                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
  9751                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
  9752                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
  9753                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
  9754                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
  9755                                  			;
  9756                                  			; Correct Code:
  9757                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
  9758                                  			; 11/09/2023
  9759                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
  9760                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
  9761                                  			;
  9762                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
  9763                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
  9764                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
  9765                                  			;
  9766                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
  9767                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
  9768                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
  9769                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
  9770                                  
  9771 000005E5 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
  9772                                  		
  9773                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"

  9775 000005EA 7503                    		jnz	short ci_bigfat
  9776                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_12_id ; "FAT12	"
  9777 000005EC BE[0B05]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
  9778                                  ci_bigfat:				
  9779                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID

  9788                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9789                                  
  9790                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9791                                  
  9792                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9793                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9794                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9795                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9796                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9797                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9798                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9799                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9800                                  ;
  9801                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9802                                  ;
  9803                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9804                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9805                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9806                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9807                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9808                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9809                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9810                                  ;
  9811                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9812                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9813                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9814                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9815                                  
  9816                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
