 12599                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12600                                  
 12601                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12602                                  ;	get media id
 12603                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12604                                  ;
 12605                                  ; FUNCTION: get the volume label,the system id and the serial number from
 12606                                  ;	    the media that has the extended boot record.
 12607                                  ;	    for the conventional media,this routine will return "unknown
 12608                                  ;	    media type" error to dos.
 12609                                  ;
 12610                                  ; INPUT :   ES:di -> bds table for this drive.
 12611                                  ;
 12612                                  ; OUTPUT:   the request packet filled with the information,if not carry.
 12613                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 12614                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 12615                                  ;	    register DS,DX,AX,CX,DI,SI destroyed.
 12616                                  ;
 12617                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 12618                                  ;	BootIo:NEAR
 12619                                  ;
 12620                                  ; LOGIC:
 12621                                  ;	to recognize the extended boot record,this logic will actually
 12622                                  ;	access the boot sector even if it is a hard disk.
 12623                                  ;	note:the valid extended bpb is recognized by looking at the mediabyte
 12624                                  ;	field of bpb and the extended boot signature.
 12625                                  ;
 12626                                  ; {
 12627                                  ;	get logical drive number from bds table;
 12628                                  ;	rFlag = read operation;
 12629                                  ;	BootIo;		 /*get the media boot record into the buffer
 12630                                  ;	if (no error) then
 12631                                  ;	     if (extended boot record) then
 12632                                  ;		{ set volume label,volume serial number and system id
 12633                                  ;		  of the request packet to those of the boot record;
 12634                                  ;		};
 12635                                  ;	     else		  /*not an extended bpb */
 12636                                  ;		{ set register al to "unknown media.." error code;
 12637                                  ;		  set carry bit;
 12638                                  ;		};
 12639                                  ;	else
 12640                                  ;	     ret;	/*already error code is set in the register al
 12641                                  ;
 12642                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12643                                  
 12644                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL equ 4
 12645                                  ;;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 12646                                  ;;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 12647                                  
 12648                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12649                                  GetMediaId:
 12650 0000114A E89F00                  		call	ChangeLineChk
 12651 0000114D 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet] ; Logical drive number
 12652 00001151 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2	; Read operation
 12653 00001156 E87B00                  		call	BootIo		; Read boot sector into	DiskSector
 12654 00001159 7224                    		jb	short IOCtl_If1
 12655                                  					; Valid? (0F0h-0FFh?)
 12656 0000115B 803E[6301]F0            		cmp	byte [disksector+15h], 0F0h
 12657                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 12658 00001160 721A                    		jb	short IOCtl_If2	; brif not valid (0F0h - 0FFh)
 12659                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12660 00001162 BE[7401]                		mov	si, disksector+26h
 12661 00001165 803C29                  		cmp	byte [si], 29h
 12662                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h ; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
 12663                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 12664 00001168 7512                    		jnz	short IOCtl_If2	; not extended boot record
 12665 0000116A C43E[1200]              		les	di, [ptrsav]	; es:di	points to request header
 12666 0000116E 26C47F13                		les	di, [es:bx+19]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12667                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12668 00001172 46                      		inc	si
 12669                                  		; si = disksector+27h 
 12670                                  		;mov	si, disksector+27h ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL
 12671 00001173 83C702                  		add	di, 2		; A_MEDIA_ID_INFO.MI_SERIAL
 12672 00001176 B91700                  		mov	cx, 23		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 12673                                  					; L+size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 12674                                  					; +size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 12675 00001179 F3A4                    		rep movsb		; Move from Bios_Data into request packet
 12676                                  	
 12677                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12678                                  		; cf = 0
 12679                                  		;clc
 12680                                  
 12681 0000117B C3                      		retn
 12682                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12683                                  
 12684                                  IOCtl_If2:				
 12685 0000117C B007                    		mov	al, 7		; error_unknown_media
 12686 0000117E F9                      		stc
 12687                                  IOCtl_If1:				
 12688 0000117F C3                      		retn
 12689                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12690                                  
 12691                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12692                                  
 12693                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12694                                  ;  set media id
 12695                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12696                                  
 12697                                  ; function: set the volume label, the system id and the serial number of
 12698                                  ;	    the media that has the extended boot record.
 12699                                  ;	    for the conventional media, this routine will return "unknown
 12700                                  ;	    media.." error to dos.
 12701                                  ;	    this routine will also set the corresponding informations in
 12702                                  ;	    the bds table.
 12703                                  ;
 12704                                  ; input :   ES:di -> bds table for this drive.
 12705                                  ;
 12706                                  ; output:   the extended boot record in the media will be set according to
 12707                                  ;	    the request packet.
 12708                                  ;	    if carry set, then al contains the device driver error number
 12709                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 12710                                  ;
 12711                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 12712                                  ;	BootIo:NEAR
 12713                                  ;
 12714                                  ; logic:
 12715                                  ;
 12716                                  ; {
 12717                                  ;	get drive_number from bds;
 12718                                  ;	rFlag = "read operation";
 12719                                  ;	BootIo;
 12720                                  ;	if (no error) then
 12721                                  ;	     if (extended boot record) then
 12722                                  ;		{ set volume label,volume serial number and system id
 12723                                  ;		  of the boot record to those of the request packet;
 12724                                  ;		  rFlag = "write operation";
 12725                                  ;		  get drive number from bds;
 12726                                  ;		  BootIo;	  /*write it back*/
 12727                                  ;		};
 12728                                  ;	     else		  /*not an extended bpb */
 12729                                  ;		{ set register al to "unknown media.." error code;
 12730                                  ;		  set carry bit;
 12731                                  ;		  ret;	 /*return back to caller */
 12732                                  ;		};
 12733                                  ;	else
 12734                                  ;	     ret;		 /*already error code is set */
 12735                                  ;
 12736                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12737                                  
 12738                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12739                                  SetMediaId:
 12740 00001180 E86900                  		call	ChangeLineChk
 12741 00001183 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 12742                                  					; Logical drive	number
 12743 00001187 88C2                    		mov	dl, al
 12744 00001189 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2	; romread
 12745 0000118E 52                      		push	dx
 12746 0000118F E84200                  		call	BootIo		; Read boot sec	to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 12747 00001192 5A                      		pop	dx
 12748 00001193 723E                    		jb	short IOCtl_If6
 12749                                  					; Valid? (0F0h-0FFh?)
 12750 00001195 803E[6301]F0            		cmp	byte [disksector+15h], 0F0h
 12751                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 12752 0000119A 7234                    		jb	short IOCtl_If7	; Brif not
 12753 0000119C 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h ; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
 12754                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 12755 000011A1 752D                    		jnz	short IOCtl_If7	; not extended boot record
 12756 000011A3 06                      		push	es		; Save BDS pointer
 12757 000011A4 57                      		push	di
 12758 000011A5 1E                      		push	ds		; Point	ES To boot record
 12759 000011A6 07                      		pop	es
 12760 000011A7 BF[7501]                		mov	di, disksector+27h ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL
 12761 000011AA C536[1200]              		lds	si, [ptrsav]	; ds:si	points to request header.
 12762 000011AE C57413                  		lds	si, [si+19]	; [si+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12763 000011B1 83C602                  		add	si, 2		; A_MEDIA_ID_INFO.MI_SERIAL
 12764 000011B4 B91700                  		mov	cx, 23		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 12765                                  					; +size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 12766                                  					; +size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 12767 000011B7 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 12768 000011B9 06                      		push	es		; point	ds back	to Bios_Data
 12769 000011BA 1F                      		pop	ds
 12770 000011BB 5F                      		pop	di		; restore bds pointer
 12771 000011BC 07                      		pop	es
 12772 000011BD E876F5                  		call	mov_media_ids	; update the bds media id info.
 12773 000011C0 88D0                    		mov	al, dl
 12774 000011C2 C606[2001]03            		mov	byte [rflag], 3	; romwrite
 12775 000011C7 E80A00                  		call	BootIo		; write	it back.
 12776 000011CA C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh
 12777                                  					; make sure chk_media check the driver
 12778                                  					; return with error code from BootIo
 12779 000011CF C3                      		retn
 12780                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12781                                  
 12782                                  IOCtl_If7:				
 12783 000011D0 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; error_unknown_media
 12784 000011D2 F9                      		stc
 12785                                  IOCtl_If6:				
 12786 000011D3 C3                      		retn
 12787                                  
 12788                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12789                                  
 12790                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12791                                  
 12792                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12793                                  ;	BootIo
 12794                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12795                                  ;
 12796                                  ; function: read/write the boot record into boot sector.
 12797                                  ;
 12798                                  ; input :
 12799                                  ;	    al=logical drive number
 12800                                  ;	    rFlag = operation (read/write)
 12801                                  ;
 12802                                  ; output:   for read operation,the boot record of the drive specified in bds
 12803                                  ;	    be read into the DiskSector buffer.
 12804                                  ;	    for write operation,the DiskSector buffer image will be written
 12805                                  ;	    to the drive specified in bds.
 12806                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 12807                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 12808                                  ;	    AX,CX,DX register destroyed.
 12809                                  ;	    if carry set,then al will contain the error code from DiskIO.
 12810                                  ;
 12811                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 12812                                  ;	DiskIO:NEAR
 12813                                  ;
 12814                                  ; logic:
 12815                                  ;
 12816                                  ; {
 12817                                  ;	first_sector = 0;	 /*logical sector 0 is the boot sector */
 12818                                  ;	sectorcount = 1;	 /*read 1 sector only */
 12819                                  ;	buffer = DiskSector;	 /*read it into the DiskSector buffer */
 12820                                  ;	call DiskIO (rFlag,drive_number,first_sector,sectorcount,buffer);
 12821                                  ; }
 12822                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12823                                  
 12824                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12825                                  BootIo:	
 12826 000011D4 06                      		push	es
 12827 000011D5 57                      		push	di
 12828 000011D6 53                      		push	bx
 12829 000011D7 1E                      		push	ds
 12830 000011D8 07                      		pop	es		; Point ES: to Bios_Data
 12831                                  
 12832                                  		; Call DiskIO to read/write the boot sec. The parameters which
 12833                                  		; need to be initialized for this subroutine out here are
 12834                                  		; - Transfer address to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 12835                                  		; - Low sector needs to be initalized to 0. this is a reg. param
 12836                                  		; - Hi sector in [Start_Sec_H] needs to be initialised to 0.
 12837                                  		; - Number of sectors <-- 1
 12838                                  
 12839 000011D9 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; es:di -> transfer address
 12840 000011DC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; First	sector (h) -> 0
 12841 000011DE 8916[2B05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx ; Start sector (h) -> 0
 12842 000011E2 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
 12843 000011E5 E8E0F6                  		call	diskio
 12844 000011E8 5B                      		pop	bx
 12845 000011E9 5F                      		pop	di
 12846 000011EA 07                      		pop	es
 12847 000011EB C3                      		retn
 12848                                  
 12849                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12850                                  
 12851                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12852                                  
 12853                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12854                                  ;	ChangeLineChk
 12855                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12856                                  ;
 12857                                  ; when the user calls get/set media id call before dos establishes the media
 12858                                  ; by calling "media_chk",the change line activity of the drive is going to be
 12859                                  ; lost.	this routine will check the change line activity and will save the
 12860                                  ; history in the flags.
 12861                                  ;
 12862                                  ; FUNCTION: check the change line error activity
 12863                                  ;
 12864                                  ; INPUT :  ES:di -> bds table.
 12865                                  ;
 12866                                  ; OUTPUT:   flag in bds table will be updated if change line occurs.
 12867                                  ;
 12868                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 12869                                  ;	Set_Changed_DL
 12870                                  ;
 12871                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12872                                  
 12873                                  ChangeLineChk:	
 12874 000011EC 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12875 000011F0 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; Fixed	disk?
 12876 000011F2 7821                    		js	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Yes, skip it.
 12877                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12878 000011F4 26F6452304              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 4
 12879                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 4 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12880                                  					; return_fake_bpb
 12881 000011F9 751A                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12882 000011FB 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1	; This rom support change line?
 12883 00001200 7513                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12884 00001202 E8DE06                  		call	haschange	; This drive support change line?
 12885 00001205 740E                    		jz	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Do nothing
 12886                                  
 12887                                  		; Execute the rom disk interrupt to check changeline activity.
 12888                                  
 12889 00001207 B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 12890 00001209 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 12891                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 12892                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 12893 0000120B 7308                    		jnb	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12894 0000120D 53                      		push	bx
 12895 0000120E BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 12896                                  					; Update flag in BDS for this
 12897                                  					; physical drive
 12898 00001211 E8A806                  		call	set_changed_dl
 12899 00001214 5B                      		pop	bx
 12900                                  ChangeLnChkRet:				
 12901 00001215 C3                      		retn
 12902                                  
 12903                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12904                                  
 12905                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12906                                  
 12907                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12908                                  ;	GetAccessFlag
 12909                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12910                                  ;
 12911                                  ; FUNCTION: get the status of UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 12912                                  ;
 12913                                  ; INPUT :
 12914                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 12915                                  ;
 12916                                  ; OUTPUT:   a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 if disk i/o not allowed.
 12917                                  ;						 = 1 if disk i/o allowed.
 12918                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12919                                  
 12920                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12921                                  GetAccessFlag:				
 12922 00001216 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 12923 0000121A C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12924                                  		;mov	al, 0		; Assume result	is unformatted
 12925                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12926 0000121D 28C0                    		sub	al, al
 12927                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12928 0000121F 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 12929                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12930                                  					; unformatted_media
 12931 00001224 7502                    		jnz	short GafDone	; Done if unformatted
 12932 00001226 FEC0                    		inc	al		; Return true for formatted
 12933                                  
 12934                                  GafDone:				
 12935 00001228 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 12936 0000122B C3                      		retn
 12937                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12938                                  
 12939                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12940                                  
 12941                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12942                                  ;	SetAccessFlag
 12943                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12944                                  ;
 12945                                  ; function: set/reset the UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 12946                                  ;
 12947                                  ; input :
 12948                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 12949                                  ;
 12950                                  ; output:   unformtted_media bit modified according to the user request
 12951                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12952                                  
 12953                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12954                                  SetAccessFlag:				
 12955 0000122C C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	points to request header
 12956 00001230 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12957                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12958 00001233 26806524FD              		and	byte [es:di+36], 0FDh
 12959                                  		;and	word [es:di+35], 0FDFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12960                                  					; ~unformatted_media
 12961 00001238 807F0100                		cmp	byte [bx+1], 0	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 12962 0000123C 7505                    		jnz	short saf_Done
 12963                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12964 0000123E 26804D2402              		or	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 12965                                  		;or	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12966                                  					; unformatted_media
 12967                                  saf_Done:				
 12968 00001243 C3                      		retn
 12969                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12970                                  
 12971                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12972                                  
 12973                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12974                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 12975                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12976                                  ;
 12977                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 12978                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 12979                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 12980                                  ;
 12981                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12982                                  
 12983                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12984                                  ioctl_support_query:
 12985 00001244 06                      		push	es
 12986 00001245 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 12987 00001249 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 12988                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 12989 0000124D 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 12990                                  					; See if major code is 8
 12991 0000124F 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 12992 00001251 0E                      		push	cs
 12993 00001252 07                      		pop	es
 12994 00001253 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 12995                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12996 00001256 BF[370C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 12997                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 12998                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 12999 00001259 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 13000 0000125B F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 13001 0000125D 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 13002 0000125F B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 13003                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13004                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 13005                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 13006                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 13007                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 13008                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13009                                  ioctlsupexit:				
 13010 00001262 07                      		pop	es
 13011                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13012                                  		; cf = 0
 13013                                  		;clc
 13014 00001263 C3                      		retn
 13015                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13016                                  nosupport:				
 13017 00001264 07                      		pop	es
 13018 00001265 E96DEE                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 13019                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13020                                  
 13021                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13022                                  
 13023                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13024                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13025                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13026                                  ;
 13027                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13028                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13029                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13030                                  ;	    drive)
 13031                                  ;
 13032                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13033                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13034                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13035                                  ;
 13036                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13037                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13038                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13039                                  ;
 13040                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13041                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13042                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13043                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13044                                  ;
 13045                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13046                                  ;
 13047                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13048                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13049                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13050                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13051                                  ; 
 13052                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13053                                  
 13054                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13055                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13056 00001268 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13057 0000126C C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13058                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13059                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13060 0000126F 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13061 00001271 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13062                                  		;
 13063 00001273 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13064                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13065                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13066                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13067 00001277 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13068                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13069 00001279 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13070 0000127B 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13071 0000127D FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13072                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13073 0000127F FEC8                    		dec	al
 13074 00001281 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13075 00001283 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13076 00001285 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13077 00001287 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13078 00001289 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13079 0000128B 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13080 0000128D 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13081                                  GotMediaType:				
 13082 0000128F 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13083                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13084                                  		; cf = 0
 13085                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13086 00001292 C3                      		retn
 13087                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13088                                  
 13089                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13090 00001293 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13091 00001296 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13092 00001298 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13093 0000129A 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13094 0000129D 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13095                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13096 0000129F B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13097                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13098 000012A1 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13099 000012A3 F9                      		stc
 13100 000012A4 C3                      		retn
 13101                                  
 13102                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13103                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13104                                  		;db    0
 13105                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13106                                  
 13107                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13108                                  
 13109                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13110                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13111                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13112                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13113                                  
 13114                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13115                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13116                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13117                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13118                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13119                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13120                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13121                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13122                                  ;
 13123                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13124                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13125                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13126                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13127                                  ;
 13128                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13129                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13130                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13131                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13132                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13133                                  ;
 13134                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13135                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13136                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13137                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13138                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13139                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13140                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13141                                  
 13142                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13143                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13144                                  
 13145                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13146                                  
 13147                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13148 000012A5 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13149 000012A8 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13150 000012AA 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13151 000012AD 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13152                                  
 13153                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13154                                  
 13155 000012AF 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13156 000012B2 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13157 000012B4 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13158 000012B7 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13159 000012B9 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13160                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13161                                  
 13162                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13163 000012BC CF                      		iret
 13164                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13165                                  
 13166                                  int2f_replace_int13:			
 13167 000012BD 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13168 000012BE 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13169                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13170                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13171                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13172 000012C0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13173                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13174                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13175                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13176                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13177                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13178                                  		
 13179                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13180                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13181 000012C5 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13182                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13183 000012C9 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13184                                  
 13185                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13186                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13187                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13188                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13189                                  		
 13190                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13191                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13192 000012CD 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13193 000012D1 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13194                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13195                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13196 000012D4 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13197 000012D8 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13198                                  
 13199 000012DC 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13200                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13201                                  		;pop	bx
 13202 000012DD 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13203                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13204 000012DE 58                      		pop	ax
 13205                                  i2f_iret:
 13206 000012DF CF                      		iret
 13207                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13208                                  
 13209                                  mine:					
 13210 000012E0 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13211 000012E2 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13212 000012E4 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13213 000012E6 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13214 000012E8 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13215                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13216                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13217 000012EA CF                      		iret
 13218                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13219                                  
 13220                                  disp_func:				
 13221 000012EB 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13222 000012ED 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13223 000012EF 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13224 000012F1 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13225                                  
 13226                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13227                                  
 13228 000012F3 1E                      		push	ds
 13229 000012F4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13230                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13231                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13232                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13233                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13234                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es
 13235 000012F9 891E[1200]              		mov	[ptrsav], bx
 13236 000012FD 8C06[1400]              		mov	[ptrsav+2], es
 13237 00001301 1F                      		pop	ds
 13238                                  		;jmp	far ptr	i2f_dskentry
 13239                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13240                                  		;jmp	far DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry		
 13241 00001302 EA[9608]7000            		jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:i2f_dskentry ; 70h:i2f_dskentry
 13242                                  					; NOTE: jump to a FAR function, not an
 13243                                  					;  IRET type function. Callers of
 13244                                  					;  this int2f subfunction will have
 13245                                  					;  to be careful to do a popf
 13246                                  
 13247                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13248                                  
 13249                                  do_subfun_01:				
 13250 00001307 06                      		push	es
 13251 00001308 1E                      		push	ds
 13252 00001309 1E                      		push	ds
 13253 0000130A 07                      		pop	es
 13254                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13255 0000130B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13256                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13257                                  					; point	ds: -> Bios_Data
 13258 00001310 E8BC03                  		call	install_bds
 13259 00001313 1F                      		pop	ds
 13260 00001314 07                      		pop	es
 13261                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13262                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13263 00001315 CF                      		iret
 13264                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13265                                  
 13266                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 13267                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13268 00001316 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13269                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13270 0000131B C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13271                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13272                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13273                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret

 13275 0000131F CF                      		iret

 13281                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13282                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13283                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.

 13302 00001338 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret

 13305                                  Win386Init:	
 13306                                  		; 12/12/2022

 13310                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13311 0000133F 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1

 13313                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es

 13319 00001350 07                      		pop	es
 13320                                  win_iret:
 13321 00001351 1F                      		pop	ds
 13322                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022

 13324                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13325 00001352 CF                      		iret

 13328                                  handle_multmult:

 13330 00001355 7514                    		jnz	short try_2

 13335                                  		;dec	bx

 13337 0000135E 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA

 13339 00001362 F7D3                    		not	bx

 13351 0000136B 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13352 0000136D 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13353 0000136F 1E                      		push	ds
 13354                                  		; 10/12/2022

 13356                                  		;dec	di

 13364 00001381 7605                    		jbe	short try_4

 13402                                  
 13403                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13404                                  
 13405                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13406                                  ;
 13407                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13408                                  ;
 13409                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13410                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13411                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13412                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13413                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13414                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13415                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13416                                  ;
 13417                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13418                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13419                                  ;
 13420                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13421                                  
 13422                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13423                                  HMAPtr:
 13424 000013A0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13425                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13426 000013A5 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13427                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13428 000013A9 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13429 000013AC 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13430 000013AE 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13431                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13432 000013B3 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13433 000013B5 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13434                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13435 000013B9 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13436                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13437                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13438 000013BD C3                      		retn
 13439                                  
 13440                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13441                                  
 13442                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13443                                  
 13444                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13445                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13446                                  
 13447                                  move_sector:
 13448                                  
 13449                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13450                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13451                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13452                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13453                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13454                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13455                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13456                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13457                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13458                                  ;
 13459                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13460                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13461                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13462                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13463                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13464                                  
 13465 000013BE FC                      		cld
 13466 000013BF 51                      		push	cx
 13467 000013C0 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13468 000013C3 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13469 000013C7 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13470 000013C9 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13471 000013CD 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13472 000013CF F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13473 000013D1 59                      		pop	cx
 13474 000013D2 C3                      		retn
 13475                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13476                                  
 13477                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13478 000013D3 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13479 000013D5 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13480 000013D7 59                      		pop	cx
 13481 000013D8 C3                      		retn
 13482                                  
 13483                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13484                                  
 13485                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13486                                  
 13487                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13488                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13489                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13490                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13491                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13492                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13493                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13494                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13495                                  ;
 13496                                  ; input conditions:
 13497                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13498                                  ;
 13499                                  ; output:
 13500                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13501                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13502                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13503                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13504                                  
 13505                                  check_wrap:	
 13506 000013D9 50                      		push	ax
 13507 000013DA 53                      		push	bx
 13508 000013DB 06                      		push	es
 13509 000013DC 57                      		push	di
 13510 000013DD E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13511 000013E0 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13512                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13513 000013E2 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13514                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13515 000013E7 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13516 000013E9 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13517 000013ED 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13518 000013EF 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13519 000013F2 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13520 000013F4 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13521 000013F6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13522                                  
 13523                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13524                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13525                                  
 13526 000013F8 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13527 000013FA 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13528                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13529 000013FC 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13530 000013FD 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13531                                  					; if on	boundary
 13532                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13533                                  not_on_bound:				
 13534 000013FF 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13535 00001402 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13536 00001404 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13537 00001406 40                      		inc	ax
 13538 00001407 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13539 00001409 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13540                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13541 0000140C 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13542 00001410 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13543                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13544                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13545 00001412 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13546 00001414 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13547 00001415 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13548                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13549 00001417 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13550                                  
 13551                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13552                                  
 13553 00001419 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13554 0000141B 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13555 0000141D 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13556                                  
 13557                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13558                                  
 13559 0000141F 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13560 00001421 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13561 00001423 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13562                                  no_head_bound:				
 13563 00001424 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13564 00001426 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13565 00001427 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13566 00001429 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13567 0000142B 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13568 0000142D 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13569 00001430 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13570 00001432 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13571 00001434 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13572 00001436 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13573 00001438 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13574 0000143A D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13575 0000143C 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13576 0000143E 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13577                                  no_wrap:				
 13578 00001440 F8                      		clc
 13579 00001441 5F                      		pop	di
 13580 00001442 07                      		pop	es
 13581 00001443 5B                      		pop	bx
 13582 00001444 58                      		pop	ax
 13583 00001445 C3                      		retn
 13584                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13585                                  
 13586                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13587 00001446 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13588 00001448 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13589 0000144A EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13590                                  
 13591                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13592                                  
 13593                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13594                                  
 13595                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13596                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13597                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13598                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13599                                  ;
 13600                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13601                                  
 13602                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13603                                  find_bds:	
 13604 0000144C C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13605                                  fbds_1:					
 13606 00001450 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13607 00001454 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13608 00001456 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13609                                  					; go to next bds
 13610 00001459 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13611 0000145C 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13612 0000145E F9                      		stc
 13613                                  fdbs_2:					
 13614 0000145F C3                      		retn
 13615                                  
 13616                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13617                                  
 13618                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13619                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13620                                  doint:
 13621                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13622 00001460 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13623                                  					; get physical drive number
 13624                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13625                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13626                                  		
 13627 00001463 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13628 00001465 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13629 00001467 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13630                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13631 00001469 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13632                                  					; get request code
 13633                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13634 0000146C FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13635                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13636 0000146F 9D                      		popf
 13637                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13638                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13639 00001470 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13640                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13641                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13642 00001475 9C                      		pushf
 13643                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13644 00001476 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13645                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13646                                  dointdone:				
 13647 00001479 C3                      		retn
 13648                                  
 13649                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13650                                  
 13651                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13652                                  
 13653                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13654                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13655                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13656                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13657                                  ;
 13658                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13659                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13660                                  ;
 13661                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13662                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13663                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13664                                  
 13665                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13666                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13667                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13668                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13669                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13670                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13671                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13672                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13673                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13674                                  ;end struc
 13675                                  
 13676                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13677                                  
 13678                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13679                                  ;	ah = function
 13680                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13681                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13682                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13683                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13684                                  ;   output conditions:
 13685                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13686                                  
 13687                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13688                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13689                                  ;
 13690                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13691                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13692                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13693                                  
 13694                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13695                                  
 13696                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13697                                  
 13698 0000147A 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13699                                  
 13700                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13701                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13702                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13703                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13704                                  
 13705                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13706                                  
 13707                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13708                                  
 13709                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13710                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13711                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13712                                  
 13713                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13714 0000147E 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13715 00001483 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13716 00001485 53                      		push	bx
 13717 00001486 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13718 00001489 E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13719 0000148C 5B                      		pop	bx
 13720 0000148D EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13721                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13722                                  
 13723                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13724                                  
 13725                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13726                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13727                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13728                                  
 13729                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13730                                  ec35_special_stuff:

 13752                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,

 13755 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx

 13758                                  
 13759                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13760                                  
 13761                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13762                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13763                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13764                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13765                                  
 13766                                  ps2_special_stuff:

 13768                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13769 000014BC 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem

 13771                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13772 000014C3 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done

 13784

 13804

 13817

 13827                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13828 000014F5 1F                      		pop	ds
 13829 000014F6 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13830                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13831                                  
 13832                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13833                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13834                                  ; a changeline error.
 13835                                  
 13836                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13837 000014F9 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13838                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13839 000014FB 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13840 000014FE 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13841 00001500 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13842 00001502 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13843 00001504 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0

 13845                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13846                                  					; never	would

 13849 0000150F E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13850 00001512 5B                      		pop	bx
 13851                                  int13b:

 13853 00001514 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13854                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13855                                  
 13856                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13857                                  
 13858                                  goterr13:

 13861                                  goterr13_xxxx:
