 13866                                  
 13867 00001527 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13868                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13869                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13870                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13871 0000152C 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13872                                  
 13873 0000152E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13874                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13875                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13876 00001530 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13877                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13878                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13879 00001535 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13880 00001538 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13881 0000153A 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13882 0000153C 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13883 0000153E 53                      		push	bx
 13884 0000153F 51                      		push	cx
 13885 00001540 52                      		push	dx
 13886 00001541 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13887                                  loop_ecc:				
 13888 00001544 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13889                                  
 13890                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13891                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13892                                  ;
 13893                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13894                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13895                                  ; track.
 13896                                  ;
 13897                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13898                                  ; this request.
 13899                                  ;
 13900                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13901                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13902                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13903                                  ;
 13904 00001547 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13905                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13906                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13907 0000154A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13908                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13909 0000154F 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13910 00001551 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13911 00001554 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13912 00001556 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13913 00001559 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13914                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13915                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13916                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13917 0000155B 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13918                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13919                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13920                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13921                                  ok11_op:				
 13922 0000155D FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13923 00001561 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13924 00001563 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13925                                  					; add 200h to address
 13926 00001565 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13927 00001567 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13928 00001569 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13929                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13930                                  
 13931                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13932                                  
 13933                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13934 0000156B F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13935                                  ok11_exit:				
 13936 0000156C 5A                      		pop	dx
 13937 0000156D 59                      		pop	cx
 13938 0000156E 5B                      		pop	bx
 13939 0000156F EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13940                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13941                                  
 13942                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13943                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13944                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13945                                  
 13946                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13947 00001571 06                      		push	es
 13948 00001572 53                      		push	bx
 13949 00001573 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13950 00001576 1E                      		push	ds
 13951 00001577 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13952 00001578 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13953                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13954                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13955 0000157B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13956                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13957 00001580 5B                      		pop	bx
 13958 00001581 07                      		pop	es
 13959 00001582 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13960 00001584 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13961 00001587 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13962                                  
 13963                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13964                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13965                                  
 13966                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13967 00001589 56                      		push	si
 13968 0000158A 57                      		push	di
 13969 0000158B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13970 0000158D BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13971 00001590 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 13972 00001593 5F                      		pop	di
 13973 00001594 5E                      		pop	si
 13974 00001595 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13975                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13976                                  
 13977                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13978                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13979                                  
 13980                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13981 00001597 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13982 0000159A FB                      		sti
 13983 0000159B 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13984 0000159E 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13985                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13986                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13987 000015A0 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13988 000015A3 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13989 000015A5 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13990 000015A8 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13991 000015AA 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13992                                  
 13993                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13994                                  
 13995                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13996                                  
 13997 000015AC 52                      		push	dx
 13998 000015AD 51                      		push	cx
 13999 000015AE 53                      		push	bx
 14000 000015AF 50                      		push	ax
 14001 000015B0 55                      		push	bp
 14002 000015B1 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14003 000015B3 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14004 000015B5 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14005 000015B7 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14006 000015B9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14007 000015BB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14008 000015BD 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14009 000015BF 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14010                                  
 14011                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14012                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14013                                  
 14014 000015C3 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14015 000015C5 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14016                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14017                                  
 14018                                  no_skip_first:				
 14019 000015C8 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14020 000015CA B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14021 000015CC 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14022                                  
 14023                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14024                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14025                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14026                                  ;
 14027                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14028                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14029                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14030                                  ; in error.
 14031                                  
 14032 000015CE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14033 000015D0 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14034                                  
 14035                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14036                                  
 14037 000015D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14038                                  					; set up head number
 14039 000015D5 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14040 000015D8 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14041                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14042                                  
 14043                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14044 000015DB B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14045 000015DD F9                      		stc
 14046 000015DE E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14047                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14048                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14049                                  
 14050                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14051                                  
 14052                                  intverify:				
 14053 000015E1 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14054 000015E2 53                      		push	bx
 14055 000015E3 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14056 000015E4 07                      		pop	es
 14057                                  dosimple:				
 14058 000015E5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14059                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14060                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14061                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14062 000015E8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14063                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14064 000015ED 5B                      		pop	bx
 14065 000015EE 07                      		pop	es
 14066 000015EF E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14067                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14068                                  
 14069                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14070                                  
 14071                                  intformat:				
 14072 000015F2 06                      		push	es
 14073 000015F3 53                      		push	bx
 14074 000015F4 56                      		push	si
 14075 000015F5 57                      		push	di
 14076 000015F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14077                                  
 14078                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14079                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14080                                  
 14081 000015F7 06                      		push	es
 14082 000015F8 1E                      		push	ds
 14083 000015F9 07                      		pop	es
 14084 000015FA 1F                      		pop	ds
 14085 000015FB 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14086 000015FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14087 00001600 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14088 00001603 1F                      		pop	ds
 14089 00001604 5F                      		pop	di
 14090 00001605 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14091 00001606 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14092                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14093                                  
 14094                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14095                                  ; the first block.
 14096                                  ;
 14097                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14098                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14099                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14100                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14101                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14102                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14103                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14104                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14105                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14106                                  
 14107                                  doblock:
 14108                                  
 14109                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14110                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14111                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14112                                  				
 14113 00001608 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14114                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14115 0000160B 51                      		push	cx
 14116 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14117 0000160D 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14118                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14119 0000160E E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14120 00001611 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14121                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14122 00001615 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14123                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14124 0000161A 5F                      		pop	di
 14125 0000161B 07                      		pop	es
 14126 0000161C 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14127 0000161E 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14128 00001620 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14129 00001622 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14130                                  doblockflop:				
 14131 00001624 59                      		pop	cx
 14132                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14133 00001625 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14134 00001627 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14135 00001629 50                      		push	ax
 14136 0000162A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14137 0000162C EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14138                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14139                                  
 14140                                  doblocklast:				
 14141 0000162E 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14142 00001630 50                      		push	ax
 14143                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14144 00001631 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14145 00001634 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14146 00001636 58                      		pop	ax
 14147 00001637 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14148                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14149 0000163A 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14150 0000163C 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14151 0000163E 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14152 00001640 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14153 00001642 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14154                                  					; then we are done already.
 14155 00001644 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14156                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14157 00001646 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14158 00001649 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14159                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14160                                  
 14161                                  bufferx:				
 14162 0000164B 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14163                                  					; set up head number
 14164                                  buffer:					
 14165 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
 14166 0000164F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14167 00001652 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14168 00001655 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14169                                  					
 14170                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14171                                  
 14172 00001657 06                      		push	es
 14173 00001658 1E                      		push	ds
 14174 00001659 56                      		push	si
 14175 0000165A 57                      		push	di
 14176 0000165B 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14177 0000165C 06                      		push	es
 14178 0000165D 1F                      		pop	ds
 14179 0000165E 07                      		pop	es
 14180 0000165F BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14181 00001662 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14182 00001663 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14183 00001665 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14184 00001668 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14185                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14186 00001669 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14187 0000166A 5E                      		pop	si
 14188 0000166B 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14189                                  
 14190                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14191                                  
 14192 0000166C B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14193                                  					; get drive number
 14194 0000166E 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14195 00001671 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14196                                  					;
 14197                                  					; ah is	function
 14198                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14199                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14200                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14201                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14202                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14203 00001674 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14204 00001677 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14205 00001678 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14206 0000167A EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14207                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14208                                  
 14209                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14210                                  
 14211                                  doread:					
 14212 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 14213 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14214 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14215 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14216 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14217 00001683 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14218 00001685 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14219                                  					; get drive number
 14220 00001688 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14221                                  					; ah = function
 14222                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14223                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14224                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14225 0000168B E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14226 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14227 0000168F 07                      		pop	es
 14228 00001690 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14229 00001692 56                      		push	si
 14230 00001693 57                      		push	di
 14231 00001694 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14232 00001696 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14233 00001699 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14234 0000169C 5F                      		pop	di
 14235 0000169D 5E                      		pop	si
 14236                                  
 14237                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14238                                  
 14239                                  dotail:					
 14240 0000169E 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14241 0000169F 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14242 000016A2 41                      		inc	cx
 14243 000016A3 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14244 000016A6 F8                      		clc
 14245 000016A7 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14246 000016A9 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14247                                  
 14248                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14249                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14250                                  
 14251 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14252 000016AE E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14253 000016B1 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14254                                  
 14255                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14256                                  
 14257                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14258                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14259                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14260                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14261                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14262                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14263                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14264                                  
 14265                                  bad13:					
 14266 000016B4 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14267 000016B6 5D                      		pop	bp
 14268 000016B7 5B                      		pop	bx
 14269 000016B8 5B                      		pop	bx
 14270 000016B9 59                      		pop	cx
 14271 000016BA 5A                      		pop	dx
 14272 000016BB 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14273 000016BD E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14274                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14275                                  
 14276                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14277 000016C0 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14278                                  
 14279                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14280                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14281                                  		;db 	0
 14282                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14283                                  
 14284                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14285

 14294                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14295 000016C3 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]

 14300                                  
 14301                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14302                                  
 14303                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14304                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14305                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14306                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14307                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14308                                  
 14309                                  install_bds:		
 14310 000016CF 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14311 000016D0 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14312                                  
 14313                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14314                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14315                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14316 000016D3 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14317                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14318 000016D5 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14319 000016D9 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14320                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14321 000016DC 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14322 000016DE B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14323 000016E0 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14324                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14325 000016E4 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14326 000016E7 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14327                                  					; we don't own it
 14328 000016EC 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14329                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14330 000016EF 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14331 000016F2 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14332                                  next_bds:				
 14333                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14334 000016F6 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14335 000016F9 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14336                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14337                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14338 000016FB 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14339 000016FD 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14340                                  					; install bds
 14341 00001700 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14342 00001702 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14343                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14344                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14345 00001705 1F                      		pop	ds
 14346                                  
 14347                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14348                                  ;
 14349                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14350                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14351                                  ;
 14352                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14353                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14354                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14355                                  ;
 14356                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14357                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14358                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14359                                  
 14360 00001706 C3                      		retn
