 15333                                  section .SYSINIT vstart=0
 15334                                  
 15335                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15336                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15337                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15338                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 31/12/2022))
 15339                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15340                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15341                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15342                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15343                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15344                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit5.s -l sysinit5.lst -o SYSINIT5.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15345                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15346                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15347                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15348                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15349                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15350                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15351                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15352                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15353                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15354                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15355                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15356                                  
 15357                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15358                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15359                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15360                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15361                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15362                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15363                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15364                                  
 15365                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15366                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15367                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15368                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15369                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15370                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15371                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15372                                  ;
 15373                                  ;
 15374                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15375                                  ;
 15376                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15377                                  ;
 15378                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15379                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15380                                  ;
 15381                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15382                                  ;
 15383                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15384                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15385                                  ;
 15386                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15387                                  ;
 15388                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15389                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15390                                  ;value.
 15391                                  ;
 15392                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15393                                  ;
 15394                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15395                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15396                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15397                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15398                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15399                                  ;
 15400                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15401                                  ;
 15402                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15403                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15404                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15405                                  ;
 15406                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15407                                  ;
 15408                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15409                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15410                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15411                                  ;
 15412                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15413                                  ;
 15414                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15415                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15416                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15417                                  ;
 15418                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15419                                  ;
 15420                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15421                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15422                                  ;
 15423                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15424                                  ;
 15425                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15426                                  ;
 15427                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15428                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15429                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15430                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15431                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15432                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15433                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15434                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15435                                  ;memory.
 15436                                  ;NOTES:
 15437                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15438                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15439                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15440                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15441                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15442                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15443                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15444                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15445                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15446                                  
 15447                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15448                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15449                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15450                                  
 15451                                  ;include version.inc
 15452                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15453                                  
 15454                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15455                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15456                                  
 15457                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15458                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15459                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15460                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15461                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15462                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15463                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15464                                  
 15465                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15466                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15467                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15468                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15469                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15470                                  
 15471                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15472                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15473                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15474                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15475                                  
 15476                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15477                                  
 15478                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15479                                  				; currently 0.
 15480                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15481                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15482                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15483                                  
 15484                                  ;      if1
 15485                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15486                                  ;      endif
 15487                                  
 15488                                         ;******************************
 15489                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15490                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15491                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15492                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15493                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15494                                         ;******************************
 15495                                  
 15496                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15497                                  ; device definitions
 15498                                  
 15499                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15500                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15501                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15502                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15503                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15504                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15505                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15506                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15507                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15508                                  
 15509                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15510                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15511 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15512 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15513 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15514 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15515 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15516                                  .size:
 15517                                  endstruc
 15518                                  
 15519                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15520                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15521 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15522 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15523 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15524 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15525 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15526                                  .size:
 15527                                  endstruc
 15528                                  
 15529                                  ;Status word masks
 15530                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15531                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15532                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15533                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15534                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15535                                  
 15536                                  ;Function codes
 15537                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15538                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15539                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15540                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15541                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15542                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15543                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15544                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15545                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15546                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15547                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15548                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15549                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15550                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15551                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15552                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15553                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15554                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15555                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15556                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15557                                  
 15558                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15559                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15560 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15561 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15562 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15563 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15564 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15565 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15566                                                          ; word
 15567 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15568 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15569 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15570 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15571                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15572                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15573                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15574                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15575                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15576                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15577                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15578                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15579 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15580 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15581 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15582 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15583 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15584 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15585                                  .size:
 15586                                  endstruc
 15587                                  
 15588                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15589                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15590                                  
 15591                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15592                                  
 15593                                  struc buffinfo
 15594 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15595 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15596 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15597                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15598                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15599 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15600                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15601                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15602                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15603                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15604                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15605                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15606                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15607                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15608 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15609                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15610 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15611 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15612 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15613 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15614 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15615                                  .size:
 15616                                  endstruc
 15617                                  
 15618                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15619                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15620                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15621                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15622                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15623                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15624                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15625                                  
 15626                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15627                                  
 15628                                  
 15629                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15630                                  
 15631                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15632                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15633                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15634                                  ;***
 15635                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15636                                  ;***
 15637                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15638                                  
 15639                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15640                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15641                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15642                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15643                                  
 15644                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 15645                                  
 15646                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15647                                  
 15648                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15649                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15650                                  
 15651                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15652                                  
 15653                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15654                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15655                                  ;
 15656                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15657                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15658                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15659                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15660                                  ;
 15661                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15662                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15663                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15664                                  
 15665                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15666                                  
 15667                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15668                                  
 15669                                  struc	DPB
 15670 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15671 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15672 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15673 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15674 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15675 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15676 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15677 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15678 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15679 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15680                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15681 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15682 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15683 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15684 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15685 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15686                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15687 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15688 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15689 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15690                                  .size:
 15691                                  endstruc
 15692                                  
 15693                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15694                                  
 15695                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 15696

 15752                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15753                                  
 15754                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15755                                  ;
 15756                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15757                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15758                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15759                                  ;
 15760                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15761                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15762                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15763                                  ;
 15764                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15765                                  
 15766                                  struc A_BPB
 15767 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15768 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15769 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15770 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15771 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15772 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15773 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15774 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15775 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15776 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15777 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15778 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15779 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15780 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15781 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15782                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15783                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15784                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15785                                  .size:
 15786                                  endstruc
 15787                                  
 15788                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15789 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15790 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15791 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15792 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15793 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15794 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15795 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15796 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15797                                  endstruc

 16045                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16046                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16047                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16048                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16049                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16050                                  									  
 16051                                  ;*******************************					  
 16052                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16053                                  ;*******************************					  
 16054                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16055                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16056                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16057                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16058                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16059                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16060                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16061                                  ;For all others:							  
 16062                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16063                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16064                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16065                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16066                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16067                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16068                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16069                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16070                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16071                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16072                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16073                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16074                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16075                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16076                                  ;									  
 16077                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16078                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16079                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16080                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16081                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16082                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16083                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16084                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16085                                  ;									  
 16086                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16087                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16088                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16089                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16090                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16091                                  ;									  
 16092                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16093                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16094                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16095                                  ;									  
 16096                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16097                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16098                                  ;									  
 16099                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16100                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16101                                  ;									  
 16102                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16103                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16104                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16105                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16106                                  ;						called. 		  
 16107                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16108                                  ;									  
 16109                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16110                                  ;									  
 16111                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16112                                  ;									  
 16113                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16114                                  ;									  
 16115                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16116                                  ;									  
 16117                                  
 16118                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16119                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16120 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16121 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16122                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16123 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16124 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16125 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16126 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16127                                  endstruc					  
 16128                                  									  
 16129                                  ;FeatureByte1	bit map equates 					  
 16130                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 16131                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 16132                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 16133                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 16134                                  					;;End of Modification

 16236                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16237                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16238                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16239                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16240                                  
 16241                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16242                                  ;
 16243                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16244                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16245                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16246                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16247                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16248                                  ;
 16249                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16250                                  ;
 16251                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16252                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16253                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16254                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16255                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16256                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16257                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16258                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16259                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16260                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16261                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16262                                  
 16263                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16264                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16265                                  
 16266                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16267                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16268 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16269 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16270 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16271 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16272 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16273 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16274                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16275 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16276 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16277 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16278                                  .size:
 16279                                  endstruc
 16280                                  
 16281                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16282                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16283                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16284                                  						; argument
 16285                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16286

 16288

 16290                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16291                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16292                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 16293                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 16294                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 16297                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16298                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16299                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16300                                  
 16301                                  ; system file table
 16302                                  
 16303                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16304                                  ;
 16305                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16306                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16307                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16308                                  
 16309                                  struc	SF
 16310 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16311 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16312 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16313                                  .size:
 16314                                  endstruc
 16315                                  
 16316                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16317                                  ;
 16318                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16319                                  
 16320                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16321 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16322                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16323 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16324 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16325 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16326                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16327                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16328                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16329                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16330                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16331                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16332                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16333                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16334                                  					;
 16335                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16336                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16337                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16338                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16339                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16340                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16341                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16342                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16343                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16344                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16345                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16346                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16347 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16348                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16349                                  					; points to net device header if
 16350                                  					; remote
 16351 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16352                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16353 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16354 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16355 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16356 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16357                                  ;
 16358                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16359                                  ; ID
 16360                                  ;
 16361 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16362 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16363 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16364                                  ;
 16365                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16366                                  ;
 16367 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16368                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16369                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16370                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16371                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16372 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16373 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16374 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16375 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16376 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 16377 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 16378                                  .size:
 16379                                  endstruc

 16650                                  SYSINIT$:
 16651                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16652                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions
 16653                                  	; include STKMES.INC	;Fatal stack error message

 16657                                  
 16658                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16659                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16660                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16661                                  
 16662                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16663                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16664                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16665                                  
 16666                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16667                                  ;
 16668                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16669                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16670                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16671                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16672                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16673                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16674                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16675                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16676                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16677                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16678                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16679                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16680                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16681                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16682                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16683                                  ;
 16684                                  
 16685                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16686                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16687                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16688                                  ;
 16689                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16690                                  ;
 16691                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16692                                  ;
 16693                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16694                                  ;
 16695                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16696                                  ;
 16697                                  
 16698                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16699                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16700                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16701                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16702                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16703                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16704                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16705                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16706                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16707                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16708                                  
 16709                                  		;EVEN
 16710                                  ;align 2
 16711                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16712                                  
 16713 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16714 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16715 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16716 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16717 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16718 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16719                                  
 16720 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16721 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16722 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16723                                  
 16724                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16725                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16726                                  
 16727                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16728                                  
 16729 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16730                                  
 16731                                  int02:
 16732                                  
 16733                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16734                                  ;
 16735                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16736                                  ;
 16737                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16738                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16739                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16740                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16741                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16742                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16743                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16744                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16745                                  ;
 16746                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16747                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16748                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16749                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16750                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16751                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16752                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16753                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16754                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16755                                  ;
 16756                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16757                                  
 16758 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16759 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16760 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16761 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16762                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16763 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16764 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16765 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16766                                  
 16767 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16768                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16769                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16770                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16771                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16772 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16773 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16774                                  special02:
 16775 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16776 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16777                                  normal02:
 16778 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 16779 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16780 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 17007                                  
 17008                                  ;********************************************************************
 17009                                  ;common routines
 17010                                  ;********************************************************************
 17011                                  
 17012                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17013                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17014                                  ; service routine
 17015                                  
 17016                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17017                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17018                                  
 17019                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17020                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17021                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17022                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17023                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17024                                  
 17025                                  do_int_stacks:
 17026 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17027 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17028 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17029 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17030 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate

 18364 00000718 E88017                  	call	doconf			; do pre-scan for dos=high/low
 18365                                  
 18366                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18367                                  	; 27/03/2019
 18368                                  	; ds = cs (at return from doconf)
 18369                                  
 18370                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18371                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18372                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18373                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18374                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18375                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18376                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18377                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18378                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18379                                  ;
 18380                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18381                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18382                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18383                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18384                                  ; been patched.
 18385                                  
 18386                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18387                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0749h)
 18388                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:runhigh],0	; Did user choose to run low ?
 18389                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18390 0000071B 803E[6A02]00            	cmp	byte [runhigh],0
 18391 00000720 740C                    	je	short dont_install_stub	; yes, don't install dos low mem stub
 18392                                  
 18393                                  ;------ user chose to load high
 18394                                  
 18395                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18396                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; MSDOS 6.21 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18397                                  	; 11/12/2022

 18670 000007DB BA[6633]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18671                                  
 18672                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18673                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18674                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18675                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18676                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18677                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18678                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18679                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18680                                  
 18681                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18682                                  
 18683 000007DE 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18684 000007DF BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 18687 000007E6 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC

 18689 000007EA 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops

 18694 000007F2 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx

 18696                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18697                                  
 18698                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18699                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18700                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18701                                  
 18702                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18703                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18706                                  
 18707                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18708                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18709                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18710                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18711                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18712                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18713                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18714                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18715                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18716                                  ;
 18717                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18718                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18719                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18720                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18721                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18722                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18723                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP

 18972                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18973                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18974                                  ;
 18975                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18976                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18977                                  ;
 18978                                  ; Inputs : None
 18979                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18980                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18981                                  ;	   free memory.
 18982                                  ;
 18983                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18984                                  ;
 18985                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18986                                  
 18987                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18988                                  AllocFreeMem:
 18989 00000853 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 18990 00000856 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 18991 00000858 CD21                    	int	21h			; first time fails
 18992 0000085A B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 18993 0000085C CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 18994                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18995                                  	; ds = cs
 18996                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 18997                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 18998 0000085E A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax
 18999 00000861 A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 19000 00000864 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory
 19001                                  				
 19002                                  	; include msbio.cl6
 19003                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19011                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo
 19012                                  ;
 19013                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 19014                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 19015                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 19016                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.
 19017                                  ;
 19018                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19019                                  
 19020                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19021                                  LoadDOSHiOrLo:

 19023                                  	; ds = cs
 19024 000008B8 E81F00                  	call	TryToMovDOSHi		; Try moving it into HMA (M024)
 19025                                  	;jc	short LdngLo		; If that don't work...
 19026                                  	;retn
 19027                                  	; 18/12/2022
 19028 000008BB 731C                    	jnc	short LoadDosHi_ok
 19029                                  LdngLo:
 19030                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19031                                  	;push	cs
 19032                                  	;pop	ds
 19033                                  	; 11/12/2022

 19035 000008BD B409                    	mov	ah,9
 19036 000008BF BA[6508]                	mov	dx,DOSLOMSG		; inform user that we are
 19037 000008C2 CD21                    	int	21h			; loading low
 19038

 19040                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.
 19041

 19043                                  						;  use int 21 alloc for mem

 19068                                  ;
 19069                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19070                                  ;
 19071                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19072                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19073                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19074                                  ;
 19075                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19076                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19077                                  ; 
 19078                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19079                                  
 19080                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19081                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 19082                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 19083                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19084                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19085                                  	; ds = cs
 19086 000008DA E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 19087 000008DD 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19088                                  
 19089                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19090                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19091                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19092                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19093                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19094                                  	; ds = cs
 19095 000008DF 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 19096                                  ;else
 19097                                  ;	..
 19098                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19099                                  
 19100                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19101                                  	; ds = cs
 19102 000008E3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 19103                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 19104 000008E5 FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 19105                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 19106 000008E9 C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 19107 000008EE F8                      	clc
 19108                                  ttldhx:
 19109 000008EF C3                      	retn

 19112                                  ;
 19113                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19114                                  ;
 19115                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19116                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19117                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19118                                  ;
 19119                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 19120                                  ;
 19121                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19122                                  
 19123                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19124                                  MovDOSHi:
 19125                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19126                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19127                                  	; ds = cs
 19128 000008F0 E8D600                  	call	AllocHMA
 19129 000008F3 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 19130 000008F5 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 19131 000008F8 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19132                                  
 19133                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19134                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 19135                                  
 19136                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 19137                                  	; 24/03/2019
 19138                                  	
 19139                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19141                                  
 19142                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 19143                                  	
 19144                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19145                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19146                                  	;xor	di,di
 19147                                  	
 19148                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19149                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 19150                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19151                                  	; ds = cs
 19152 000008FD 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 19153 00000901 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 19154                                  
 19155                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 19156                                  ;else
 19157                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 19158                                  ;
 19159                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 19160                                  ;
 19161                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS

 19163 00000904 E85E02                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 19164 00000907 F8                      	clc
 19165                                  mdhx:
 19166 00000908 C3                      	retn

 19301                                  ; procedure : MovBIOS
 19302                                  ;
 19303                                  ;		Moves BIOS code into requested segment
 19304                                  ;
 19305                                  ;	In : ES - segment to which BIOS is to be moved
 19306                                  ;		  ( it moves always into offset BCode_Start)
 19307                                  ;
 19308                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after BIOS
 19309                                  ;
 19310                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19311                                  
 19312                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 19317                                  	; 11/12/2022

 19321 00000930 2E8E1E[8702]            	mov	ds,[cs:temp_bcode_seg]		; current BIOS code seg
 19322                                  	;mov	si,BCODE_START ; mov si,30h

 19327 0000093D 29F1                    	sub	cx,si				; size of BIOS
 19328 0000093F D1E9                    	shr	cx,1				; Both the labels are para
 19329                                  						;  aligned
 19330 00000941 F3A5                    	rep	movsw
 19331                                  	
 19332                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19333 00000943 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19334                                  	;
