 22636                                  
 22637                                  setdevmark:
 22638                                  
 22639                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22640                                  	;push	es
 22641                                  	;push	cx
 22642                                  
 22643 000013F9 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22644 000013FE 2E890E[1614]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22645 00001403 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22646                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22647                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22648 00001405 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22649 00001409 41                      	inc	cx
 22650                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22651 0000140A 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22652                                  
 22653                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22654                                  	;pop	cx
 22655                                  	;pop	es
 22656                                  	
 22657 0000140F 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22658 00001414 C3                      	retn

 22858                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22859                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22860                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22861                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22862                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22863                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22864                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22865                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22866                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22867                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22868                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22869                                  
 22870                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22871                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22872 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22873 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22874 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22875                                  endstruc

 22880                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22881                                  
 22882                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22883                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22884                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED

 22886                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22887                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22888                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22889                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES

 22891                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1

 22894                                  
 22895                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22896                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22897 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22898 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22899 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22900                                  endstruc
 22901                                  
 22902                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22903                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22904                                  ;
 22905                                  ;
 22906                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22907                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22908                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22909                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22910                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22911                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22912                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22913                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22914                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22915                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22916                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22917                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22918                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22919                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22920                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22921                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22922                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22923                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22924                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22925                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22926                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22927                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22928                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22929                                  ;	   :
 22930                                  ;
 22931                                  ;Note:
 22932                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22933                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22934                                  ;
 22935                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22936                                  ;
 22937                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22938                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22939                                  ;
 22940                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22941                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22942                                  ;
 22943                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22944                                  ;
 22945                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22946                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22947                                  ;
 22948                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22949                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22950                                  ;
 22951                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22952                                  ;
 22953                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22954                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22955                                  ;
 22956                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22957                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22958                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22959                                  ;
 22960                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22961                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22962                                  ;
 22963                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22964                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22965                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22966                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22967                                  
 22968                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22969                                  
 22970                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22971                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22972                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22973                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22974                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22975                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22976                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22977                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22978                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22979                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22980                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22981                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22982                                  
 22983                                  ;**** Function flags
 22984                                  
 22985                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22986                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22987                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22988                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22989                                  
 22990                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22991                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22992 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22993 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22994 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22995 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22996 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22997 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22998                                  endstruc
 22999                                  
 23000                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23001                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23002                                  ;
 23003                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23004                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23005                                  ;	     +-
 23006                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23007                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23008                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23009                                  ;	     |	:
 23010                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23011                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23012                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23013                                  ;	     |	:
 23014                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23015                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23016                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23017                                  ;	     +-	:
 23018                                  ;
 23019                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23020                                  ;
 23021                                  ;Note:
 23022                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23023                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23024                                  ;
 23025                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23026                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23027                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23028                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23029                                  
 23030                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23031                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23032                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23033                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23034                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23035                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23036                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23037                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23038                                  
 23039                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23040 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23041 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23042 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23043 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23044 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23045                                  endstruc
 23046                                  
 23047                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23048                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23049                                  ;
 23050                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23051                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23052                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23053                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23054                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23055                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23056                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23057                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23058                                  ;
 23059                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23060                                  ;
 23061                                  ;            +-
 23062                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23063                                  ;	    | or
 23064                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23065                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23066                                  ;	    | or
 23067                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23068                                  ;	    | or
 23069                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23070                                  ;	    | or
 23071                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23072                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23073                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23074                                  ;	    | or
 23075                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23076                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23077                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23078                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23079                                  ;	    +-
 23080                                  ;
 23081                                  ;
 23082                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23083                                  ;      list.
 23084                                  ;
 23085                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23086                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23087                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23088                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23089                                  
 23090                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23091                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23092 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23093 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23094 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23095 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23096                                  endstruc

 23109                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 23110                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 23111

 23120                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23121                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23122                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23123                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23124                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23125                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23126                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error

 23210                                  
 23211                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23212                                  ; SysParse;
 23213                                  ;
 23214                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23215                                  ;
 23216                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23217                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23218                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23219                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23220                                  ;
 23221                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23222                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23223                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23224                                  ;
 23225                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23226                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23227                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23228                                  ;
 23229                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23230                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23231                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23232                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23233                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23234                                  ;
 23235                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23236                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23237                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23238                                  ;
 23239                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23240                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23241                                  ;
 23242                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23243                                  ;
 23244                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23245                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23246                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23247                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23248                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23249                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23250                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23251                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23252                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23253                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23254                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23255                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23256                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23257                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23258                                  ;	     (tm08)

 23260                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)

 23262                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)

 23276

 23278                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23279                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23280                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23281

 23283                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23284                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23285                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23286                                  ;
 23287                                  
 23288                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23289                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23290                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23291                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23292                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23293                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23294                                  
 23295                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23296                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23297                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23298                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23299                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23300                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23301                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23302                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23303                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23304                                  
 23305                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23306                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23307                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other

 23908                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23909                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23910                                  ;
 23911                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23912                                  ;
 23913                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23914                                  ;	    AL = type
 23915                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23916                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23917                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23918                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23919                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23920                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23921                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23922                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23923                                  ;
 23924                                  ; Output:   None
 23925                                  ;
 23926                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23927                                  ;
 23928                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23929                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23930                                  
 23931                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 23932 000016D5 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 23933 000016D6 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]

 24324                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24325                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24326                                  ;
 24327                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24328                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24329                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24330                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24331                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24332                                  ;
 24333                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24334                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24335                                  ;
 24336                                  ; Output:    None
 24337                                  ;
 24338                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24339                                  ;
 24340                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24341                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24342                                  
 24343                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24344                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24345                                  
 24346                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24347 00001884 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24348 00001885 2E800E[2B14]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24349 0000188B 2E8026[2B14]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24350 00001891 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24351 00001894 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24352 00001896 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24353                                  
 24354 00001898 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24355 0000189A 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24356                                  
 24357 0000189C 2E800E[2B14]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24358                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24359 000018A2 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24360                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24361 000018A3 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24362 000018A6 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24363 000018A7 C3                      	retn

 24576                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24577                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24578                                  ;
 24579                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24580                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24581                                  ;
 24582                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24583                                  ;
 24584                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24585                                  ;
 24586                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24587                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24588                                  
 24589                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24590                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24591 0000198F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24592 00001990 2EF606[2B14]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24593 00001996 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24594                                  
 24595 00001998 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24596 00001999 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24597                                  
 24598                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24599 0000199A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24600 0000199B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24601                                  
 24602 0000199D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24603 0000199E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24604                                  
 24605                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24606                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 24607 0000199F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24608                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 24609 000019A0 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25099                                  ; _$P_Skip_Delim;
 25100                                  ;
 25101                                  ; Function: Skip delimiters specified in the PARMS list, white space
 25102                                  ;	    and comma.
 25103                                  ;
 25104                                  ; Input:    DS:SI -> Command String
 25105                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25106                                  ;
 25107                                  ; Output:   CY = 1 if the end of line encounterd
 25108                                  ;	    CY = 0 then SI move to 1st non-delimiter character
 25109                                  ;	    AL = Last examineed character

 25112                                  ;

 25114                                  ;***********************************************************************

 25117                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25118 00001B78 AC                      	lodsb				;AN000;

 25121

 25133 00001B93 C3                      	retn

 25136                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off
 25137                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25138                                  	; cf=0
 25139                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25140                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit

 25161                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 25162                                  ;
 25163                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 25164                                  ;
 25165                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25166                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25167                                  ;

 25169                                  ;**********************************************************************

 25172 00001B9A 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;

 25176

 25179

 25181 00001BA4 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?

 25184

 25186                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 25187 00001BAD 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25188                                  
 25189 00001BAF 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;

 25191                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25192 00001BB5 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 25193                                  	; 14/08/2023

 25195 00001BBA 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?

 25199                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *

 25202 00001BC3 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;

 25218                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25219                                  ;
 25220                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25221                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25222                                  ;	    blanks.
 25223                                  ;
 25224                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25225                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25226                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25227                                  ;
 25228                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25229                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25230                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25231                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25232                                  
 25233                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25234 00001BCF 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25235 00001BD0 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25236 00001BD1 2EC606[2514]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25237                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25238                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25239 00001BD7 2E8026[2B14]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25240 00001BDD 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25241 00001BDF 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25242                                  
 25243 00001BE1 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25244 00001BE3 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25245                                  
 25246 00001BE5 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25247 00001BE7 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25248                                  
 25249                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 25250                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 25251                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 14/08/2023
 25252                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 25253                                  %if 0
 25254                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25255                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25256                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25257                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25258                                  
 25259                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 25260                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25261                                  
 25262                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 25263                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 25264                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 25265                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25266                                  %endif
 25267                                  
 25268                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 25269 00001BE9 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 25270                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 25271 00001BEE 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25272                                  
 25273                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 25274 00001BF0 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 25275                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 25276 00001BF2 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 25277                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25278                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 25279                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 25280                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25281 00001BF6 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 25282                                  
 25283 00001BF8 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 25284                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25285 00001BFB 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25286 00001BFC 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 25287 00001BFF 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25288

 25314                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25315                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25316                                  ;
 25317                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25318                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25319                                  ;
 25320                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25321                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25322                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25323                                  ;
 25324                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25325                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25326                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25327                                  
 25328                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25329                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25330                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25331                                  ;
 25332                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25333                                  
 25334                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25335                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25336                                  
 25337                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25338                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25339                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25340                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25341 00001C1D BD[3414]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25342                                  
 25343                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25344 00001C20 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25345 00001C22 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25346                                  
 25347                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25348 00001C24 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25349 00001C26 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25350                                  
 25351 00001C28 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25352                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25353                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25354 00001C29 C3                      	retn
 25355                                  
 25356                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25357                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25358                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25359                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25360                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25361                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25362                                  
 25363                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25364                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25365 00001C2A 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25366 00001C2C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25367                                  
 25368 00001C2E 2E800E[2B14]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25369                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25370                                  
 25371                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25372                                  	; cf=0
 25373                                  	;retn
 25374                                  
 25375                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25376                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25377                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25378 00001C34 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25379                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25380                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25381 00001C35 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25383                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25384                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25385                                  ;
 25386                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25387                                  ;
 25388                                  ;  Input:
 25389                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25390                                  ;
 25391                                  ;  Output:
 25392                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25393                                  ;
 25394                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25395                                  ;
 25396                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25397                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25398                                  
 25399                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25400 00001C36 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25401 00001C37 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25402 00001C38 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25403                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25404                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25405                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25406 00001C39 2E8B36[2814]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25407 00001C3E 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25408 00001C40 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25409 00001C42 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25410 00001C43 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25411 00001C44 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25412 00001C45 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25413 00001C46 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25414 00001C47 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25415 00001C48 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25416                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 25417                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25418 00001C49 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25419 00001C4B B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25420 00001C4E CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25421                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25422 00001C50 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25423 00001C52 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25424 00001C54 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25425 00001C55 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25426 00001C56 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25427 00001C57 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25428 00001C58 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25429 00001C59 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25430 00001C5A 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25431 00001C5B 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25432                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25433 00001C5D 2E8936[2614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25434 00001C62 2E891E[2814]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25435                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25436                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25437                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25438                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25439 00001C67 2EC536[2614]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25440                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25441 00001C6C 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25442 00001C6F 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25443 00001C71 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25444 00001C73 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25445 00001C75 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25446 00001C78 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25447 00001C7A F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25448 00001C7B EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25449                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25450 00001C7D 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25451 00001C7E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25452                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25453 00001C7F EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25454                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25455                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25456                                  	; cf=0
 25457                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25458                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25459 00001C81 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25460 00001C82 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25461 00001C83 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25462 00001C84 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25466                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25467                                  
 25468                                  ;control block definitions for parser.
 25469                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25470                                  ; buffer = [n | n,m] {/e}
 25471                                  
 25472                                  ; 30/03/2019
 25473                                  
 25474                                  struc p_parms
 25475 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 25476 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 25477 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 25478 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 25479                                  .size:
 25480                                  endstruc
 25481                                  
 25482                                  struc p_pos
 25483 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 25484 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 25485 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 25486                                  
 25487                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 25488                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 25489                                  
 25490 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 25491 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 25492                                  .size:
 25493                                  endstruc
 25494                                  
 25495                                  struc	p_range
 25496 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 25497 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 25498 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 25499 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 25500 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 25501                                  .size:
 25502                                  endstruc
 25503                                  
 25504                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25505                                  
 25506                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25507                                  	; (SYSINIT:1F48h)
 25508                                  
 25509                                  ; buffer = [n | n,m] {/e}
 25510                                  
 25511                                  ;buf_parms p_parms <buf_parmsx>
 25512                                  buf_parms: 
 25513 00001C85 [8A1C]                  	dw	buf_parmsx
 25514 00001C87 01                      	db	1	; an extra delimiter list
 25515 00001C88 01                      	db	1	; length is 1
 25516 00001C89 3B                      	db	';'	; delimiter
 25517                                  
 25518                                  buf_parmsx:
 25519 00001C8A 0102[941C][A81C]        	dw	201h,buf_pos1,buf_pos2	; min 1, max 2 positionals
 25520 00001C90 01                      	db	1			; one switch
 25521 00001C91 [BC1C]                  	dw	sw_x_ctrl
 25522 00001C93 00                      	db	0			; no keywords
 25523                                  
 25524                                  ;buf_pos1 p_pos <8000h,0,result_val,buf_range_1>  ; numeric
 25525                                  buf_pos1:
 25526 00001C94 0080                    	dw	8000h	; numeric value??
 25527 00001C96 0000                    	dw	0	; function
 25528 00001C98 [CE1C]                  	dw	result_val ; result value buffer	
 25529 00001C9A [9D1C]                  	dw	buf_range_1 ; value list
 25530 00001C9C 00                      	db	0  	; no switches/keywords
 25531                                  
 25532                                  ;buf_range_1 p_range <,,,1,99>		; M050
 25533                                  buf_range_1:
 25534 00001C9D 01                      	db	1	; range definition
 25535 00001C9E 01                      	db	1	; 1 definition of range
 25536 00001C9F 01                      	db	1	; item tag for this range
 25537 00001CA0 01000000                	dd	1	; numeric min
 25538 00001CA4 63000000                	dd	99	; numeric max
 25539                                  
 25540                                  ;buf_pos2 p_pos <8001h,0,result_val,buf_range_2> ; optional num.
 25541                                  buf_pos2:
 25542 00001CA8 0180                    	dw	8001h
 25543 00001CAA 0000                    	dw	0
 25544 00001CAC [CE1C]                  	dw	result_val	
 25545 00001CAE [B11C]                  	dw	buf_range_2
 25546 00001CB0 00                      	db	0
 25547                                  
 25548                                  ;buf_range_2 p_range <,,,0,8>
 25549                                  buf_range_2:
 25550 00001CB1 01                      	db	1
 25551 00001CB2 01                      	db	1
 25552 00001CB3 01                      	db	1
 25553 00001CB4 00000000                	dd	0
 25554 00001CB8 08000000                	dd	8
 25555                                  
 25556                                  ;sw_x_ctrl p_pos <0,0,result_val,noval,1> ; followed by one switch
 25557                                  sw_x_ctrl:
 25558 00001CBC 0000                    	dw	0
 25559 00001CBE 0000                    	dw	0
 25560 00001CC0 [CE1C]                  	dw	result_val	
 25561 00001CC2 [CD1C]                  	dw	noval
 25562 00001CC4 01                      	db	1	; 1 switch
 25563                                  	
 25564                                  switch_x:
 25565 00001CC5 2F5800                  	db	'/X',0		; M016
 25566                                  
 25567                                  p_buffers:
 25568 00001CC8 0000                    	dw	0	; local variables
 25569                                  p_h_buffers:
 25570 00001CCA 0000                    	dw	0
 25571                                  	; 26/10/2022  (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25572                                  p_buffer_slash_x:
 25573 00001CCC 00                      	db	0 ; 31/03/2019
 25574                                  
 25575                                  ;-- common definitions -------------------------------------------------
 25576                                  
 25577 00001CCD 00                      noval:	db	0
 25578                                  
 25579                                  result_val: 	;label	byte
 25580 00001CCE 00                      	db	0		; type returned
 25581                                  result_val_itag:
 25582 00001CCF 00                      	db	0		; item tag returned
 25583                                  result_val_swoff:
 25584 00001CD0 0000                    	dw	0		; es:offset of the switch defined
 25585                                  rv_byte:	;label	byte
 25586 00001CD2 00000000                rv_dword: dd	0		; value if number,or seg:offset to string.
 25587                                  
 25588                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 25589                                  
 25590                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25591                                  	; (SYSINIT:1F99h)
 25592                                  
 25593                                  ; break = [ on | off ]
 25594                                  
 25595                                  ;brk_parms p_parms  <brk_parmsx>
 25596                                  brk_parms:
 25597 00001CD6 [DB1C]                  	dw	brk_parmsx
 25598 00001CD8 01                      	db	1	; an extra delimiter list
 25599 00001CD9 01                      	db	1	; length is 1
 25600 00001CDA 3B                      	db	';'	; delimiter
 25601                                  
 25602                                  brk_parmsx:
 25603 00001CDB 0101[E11C]              	dw	101h,brk_pos	; min,max = 1 positional
 25604 00001CDF 00                      	db	0		; no switches
 25605 00001CE0 00                      	db	0		; no keywords
 25606                                  
 25607                                  ;brk_pos p_pos <2000h,0,result_val,on_off_string> ; simple string
 25608                                  brk_pos:
 25609 00001CE1 0020                    	dw	2000h
 25610 00001CE3 0000                    	dw	0
 25611 00001CE5 [CE1C]                  	dw	result_val	
 25612 00001CE7 [EA1C]                  	dw	on_off_string
 25613 00001CE9 00                      	db	0
 25614                                  
 25615                                  on_off_string:	;label	byte
 25616 00001CEA 03                      	db	3		; signals that there is a string choice
 25617 00001CEB 00                      	db	0		; no range definition
 25618 00001CEC 00                      	db	0		; no numeric values choice
 25619 00001CED 02                      	db	2		; 2 strings for choice
 25620 00001CEE 01                      	db	1		; the 1st string tag
 25621 00001CEF [F41C]                  	dw	on_string
 25622 00001CF1 02                      	db	2		; the 2nd string tag
 25623 00001CF2 [F71C]                  	dw	off_string
 25624                                  
 25625                                  on_string:
 25626 00001CF4 4F4E00                  	db	"ON",0
 25627                                  off_string:
 25628 00001CF7 4F464600                	db	"OFF",0
 25629                                  
 25630                                  p_ctrl_break:
 25631 00001CFB 00                      	db	0	; local variable
 25632

 25941 00001E10 [CD1C]

 25943 00001E13 2F5400                  swit_t:	db	'/T',0			   ;				M059
 25944                                  ;swit_w_ctrl p_pos <0,0,result_val,noval,1> ; switch string follows	M063
 25945                                  swit_w_ctrl:

 25953

 26018                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26019                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26020                                  
 26021                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26022                                  ;
 26023                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26024                                  ;
 26025                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26026                                  ;
 26027                                  ;   Modification log:
 26028                                  ;
 26029                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26030                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26031                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26032                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26033                                  ;
 26034                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26035                                  ;
 26036                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26037                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26038                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26039                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26040                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26041                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26042                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26043                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26044                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26045                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26046                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26047                                  ;
 26048                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26049                                  
 26050                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26051                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26052                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26053                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26054                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26055                                  
 26056                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26057                                  
 26058                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26059                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26060                                  
 26061                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26062                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26063                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26064                                  
 26065                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26066                                  ;
 26067                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26068                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26069                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26070                                  ;	           line.
 26071                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26072                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26073                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26074                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26075                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26076                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26077                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26078                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26079                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26080                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26081                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26082                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26083                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26084                                  ;	           for details).
 26085                                  
 26086                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26087                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26088                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26089                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26090                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26091                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26092                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26093                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26094                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26095                                  
 26096                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26097                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26098                                  
 26099                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26100                                  
 26101                                  %endif
 26102

 26214 00001ED3 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26215 00001ED6 E8D3F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26216 00001ED9 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26217                                  
 26218                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26219                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26220                                  ;;
 26221                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26222                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26223                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26224                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26225                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26226                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26227                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26228                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26229                                  ;;
 26230                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26231                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for

 26245

 26250 00001EF0 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]

 26255 00001EFA 9C                      	pushf
 26256                                  
 26257                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 26258                                  
 26259 00001EFB 50                      	push	ax
 26260 00001EFC 57                      	push	di
 26261 00001EFD 51                      	push	cx
 26262 00001EFE B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 26263 00001F00 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 26264 00001F02 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 26265 00001F04 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 26266 00001F06 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 26267                                  
 26268                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 26269

 26271

 26273                                  
 26274                                  puteol:
 26275 00001F09 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 26276 00001F0B AA                      	stosb
 26277 00001F0C B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 26278 00001F0E AA                      	stosb
 26279 00001F0F 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 26280                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26281                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 26282                                  
 26283                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 26284                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26285 00001F11 0E                      	push	cs
 26286 00001F12 1F                      	pop	ds
 26287                                  
 26288 00001F13 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 26289                                  
 26290 00001F17 59                      	pop	cx
 26291 00001F18 5F                      	pop	di
 26292 00001F19 58                      	pop	ax
 26293                                  
 26294                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26295                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26296                                  	;push	cs
 26297                                  	;pop	ds

 26303 00001F1F 58                      	pop	ax
 26304 00001F20 9D                      	popf
 26305 00001F21 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 26306 00001F23 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 26307 00001F25 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 26308                                  conferr:

 26315                                  ;
 26316                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 26317                                  ;
 26318                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 26319                                  ;
