 26323                                  multi_pass:
 26324 00001F2E 0E                      	push	cs
 26325 00001F2F 1F                      	pop	ds
 26326                                  
 26327 00001F30 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 26328                                  ;jae_endconv:
 26329 00001F35 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 26330                                  
 26331                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 26332                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26333 00001F37 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26334 00001F3B 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 26335                                  
 26336 00001F3C 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 26337 00001F40 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 26338 00001F44 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 26339 00001F46 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 26340 00001F4A 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 26341                                  
 26342 00001F4E E89710                  	call	getchr
 26343 00001F51 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 26344                                  
 26345                                  getcom:
 26346 00001F53 E87B0E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 26347 00001F56 E88F10                  	call	getchr
 26348                                  conflp: 
 26349 00001F59 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 26350                                  
 26351 00001F5B FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26352                                  
 26353 00001F5F C606[1514]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26354 00001F64 C606[1814]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26355 00001F69 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26356 00001F6B 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26357                                  
 26358                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26359                                  %if 0
 26360                                  
 26361                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26362                                  
 26363                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26364                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26365                                  
 26366                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26367                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26368                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26369                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26370                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26371                                  
 26372                                          push    ax                      ;
 26373                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26374                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26375                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26376                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26377                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26378                                          pop     ax
 26379                                  ;
 26380                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26381                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26382                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26383                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26384                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26385                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26386                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26387                                  ;   spot.
 26388                                  ;
 26389                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26390                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26391                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26392                                  ;   retrieved.
 26393                                  ;
 26394                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26395                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26396                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26397                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26398                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26399                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26400                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26401                                  final:                                  ;
 26402                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26403                                  not_final:                              ;
 26404                                  ;endif
 26405                                  
 26406                                  %endif
 26407 00001F6D 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26408 00001F6F E87610                  	call	getchr
 26409 00001F72 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26410                                  
 26411 00001F74 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26412                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26413                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26414 00001F79 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26415 00001F7B E9FB06                  	jmp	badop
 26416                                  	
 26417                                  coff:	
 26418                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26419                                  	; ds = cs
 26420                                  	;push	cs
 26421                                  	;pop	ds
 26422 00001F7E E85E10                  	call	newline
 26423 00001F81 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 26424                                  
 26425                                  blank_line:
 26426 00001F83 E86210                  	call	getchr
 26427 00001F86 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 26428                                  
 26429                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26430                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26431                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26432                                  ;coff_p:
 26433                                  	;push	cs
 26434                                  	;pop	ds
 26435                                  
 26436                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26437                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26438                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26439                                  ;install= command.
 26440                                  
 26441                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26442                                  ;install command
 26443                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26444                                  
 26445                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26446                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26447                                  tryi:
 26448 00001F88 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26449 00001F8D 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26450 00001F8F E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26451                                  not_init_pass:
 26452 00001F92 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 26453                                          ; 11/12/2022
 26454                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 26455 00001F97 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26456                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26457                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26458                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26459                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26460                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26461                                  					; and before install= commands
 26462                                  					; are processed
 26463                                  
 26464 00001F99 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 26465 00001F9E 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26466 00001FA0 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26467                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26468                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 26469 00001FA3 74D9                    	je	short coff
 26470                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26471                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26472                                  
 26473                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26474                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26475                                          
 26476 00001FA5 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26477                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26478                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26479 00001FA8 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 26480                                  	
 26481                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26482 00001FAA 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26483                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26484 00001FAF EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26485                                  
 26486                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26487                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 26488                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26489                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 26490                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26491                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26492                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 26493                                  
 26494                                  multi_try_i:
 26495 00001FB1 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 26496                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 26497                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26498 00001FB4 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 26499                                  
 26500                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26501                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26502                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26503                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26504                                  ;;endif
 26505                                  
 26506 00001FB6 E873F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26507 00001FB9 EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26508                                  
 26509                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26510                                  %if 0
 26511                                  
 26512                                  multi_try_n:
 26513                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26514                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26515                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26516                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26517                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26518                                  ;endif
 26519                                  
 26520                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26521                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26522                                  
 26523                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 26524                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 26525                                  	mov	bx,ax
 26526                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26527                                  
 26528                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26529                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26530                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26531                                  
 26532                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26533                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26534                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26535                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26536                                  
 26537                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26538                                  	mov	bx,1
 26539                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26540                                  
 26541                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26542                                  
 26543                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26544                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26545                                          int     21h
 26546                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26547                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26548                                          int     21h
 26549                                  
 26550                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26551                                  
 26552                                  %endif
 26553                                  
 26554                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26555 00001FBB 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 26556 00001FBE 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26557 00001FC0 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 26558 00001FC3 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26559 00001FC5 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 26560 00001FC8 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 26561                                  
 26562                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26563 00001FCA FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 26564 00001FCE FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 26565                                  
 26566                                  multi_pass_coff:
 26567                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26568 00001FD2 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.

 26570                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26571                                  ; buffer command
 26572                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26573                                  
 26574                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26575                                  ;									      *
 26576                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26577                                  ;									      *
 26578                                  ; input :								      *
 26579                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26580                                  ; output:								      *
 26581                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26582                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26583                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26584                                  ;									      *
 26585                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26586                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26587                                  ; logic:								      *
 26588                                  ; {									      *
 26589                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26590                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26591                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26592                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26593                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26594                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26595                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26596                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26597                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26598                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26599                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26600                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26601                                  ;	};								      *
 26602                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26603                                  ; };									      *
 26604                                  ;									      *
 26605                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26606                                  
 26607                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26608                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26609                                  tryb:
 26610 00001FD4 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26611 00001FD7 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26612                                  
 26613                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26614                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26615                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26616                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26617                                  ;;endif
 26618                                  
 26619                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26620                                  	; 18/12/2022

 26623 00001FDB 880E[CC1C]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 26624                                  
 26625 00001FDF BF[851C]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 26626                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 26627                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26628                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26629                                  do7:
 26630 00001FE2 E87506                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26631 00001FE5 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 26632                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26633                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 26634                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 26635                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26636                                  ;sr7:
 26637                                  	;jmp	coff
 26638                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26639 00001FE7 E9EE05                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26640                                  if7:
 26641 00001FEA 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 26642 00001FED 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 26643                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 26644 00001FEF 813E[D01C][C51C]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 26645                                  	;jne	short if11
 26646                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26647 00001FF5 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 26648                                  
 26649                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 26650                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 26651                                  if11:
 26652                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 26653 00001FF7 A1[D21C]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 26654 00001FFA 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1
 26655 00001FFD 7505                    	jne	short if13
 26656

 26677 0000201E A3[9702]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.

 26694                                  ; break command
 26695                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26696                                  
 26697                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26698                                  ;									    *
 26699                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26700                                  ;									    *
 26701                                  ; input :								    *
 26702                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26703                                  ; output:								    *
 26704                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26705                                  ;									    *
 26706                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26707                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26708                                  ; logic:								    *
 26709                                  ; {									    *
 26710                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 26711                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26712                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26713                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26714                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26715                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26716                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26717                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26718                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26719                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26720                                  ;	};								    *

 26723                                  ; };									    *
 26724                                  ;									    *
 26725                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26726                                  
 26727                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26728                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 26729                                  tryc:
 26730 00002030 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 26731 00002033 7534                    	jne	short trym
 26732                                  
 26733                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 26736                                  ;       jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26737                                  ;;endif

 26739 00002038 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx

 26741                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26742                                  do22:
 26743 0000203A E81D06                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26744 0000203D 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 26745                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 26746                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 26747                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26748                                  ;sr22:
 26749                                  	;jmp	coff
 26750                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26751 0000203F E99605                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26752                                  if22:
 26753 00002042 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 26754 00002045 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 26755                                  
 26756                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 26757 00002047 803E[CF1C]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 26758 0000204C 7507                    	jne	short if26
 26759

 28120                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28121                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28122                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28123                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28124                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28125                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28126                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28127                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28128                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28129                                  
 28130                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28131                                  ;									  *
 28132                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28133                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28134                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28135                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28136                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28137                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28138                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28139                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28140                                  ; input :								  *
 28141                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28142                                  ; output:								  *
 28143                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28144                                  ;									  *
 28145                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28146                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28147                                  ; logic:								  *
 28148                                  ; {									  *
 28149                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28150                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28151                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28152                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28153                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28154                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28155                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28156                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28157                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28158                                  ;	     }								  *
 28159                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28160                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28161                                  ;	};								  *
 28162                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28163                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28164                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28165                                  ; };									  *
 28166                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28167

 28835                                  sysinit_parse:
 28836                                  
 28837                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28838                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28839                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28840                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28841                                  ;
 28842                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28843                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28844                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax

 29198                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29199                                  ;
 29200                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29201                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29202                                  ;
 29203                                  ;	Output : none
 29204                                  ;

 29206                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29207                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29208                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29209                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 29221                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29222                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29223                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie

 29239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29240                                  ;
 29241                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29242                                  ;
 29243                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29244                                  ;	Output : none
 29245                                  ;
 29246                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29247                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29248                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29249                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29250                                  ;
 29251                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29252                                  
 29253                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29254                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29255 00002711 1E                      	push	ds
 29256 00002712 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29257 00002715 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29258 00002717 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29259 0000271B 2E891E[891E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29260 00002720 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29261 00002722 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29262 00002724 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29263 00002727 2EC606[881E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29264 0000272D 1F                      	pop	ds
 29265                                  ;limx:
 29266 0000272E C3                      	retn
 29267                                  
 29268                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29269                                  ;
 29270                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29271                                  ;
 29272                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29273                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29274                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29275                                  ;
 29276                                  ;	Output : none
 29277                                  ;

 29279                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying

 29289                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29290 00002734 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29291                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29292 00002736 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29293 00002739 8826[881E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29294                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29295                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0

 29297                                  	;mov	ax,40h

 29301 00002747 1F                      	pop	ds

 29355                                  %if 0
 29356                                  
 29357                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29358                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29359                                  
 29360                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29361                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29362                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29363                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29364                                  
 29365                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29366                                  ;
 29367                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29368                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29369                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29370                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29371                                  ;
 29372                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29373                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29374                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29375                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29376                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29377                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29378                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29379                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29380                                  ; available during the load.
 29381                                  ;
 29382                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29383                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29384                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29385                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29386                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29387                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29388                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29389                                  ;
 29390                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29391                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29392                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29393                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29394                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29395                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29396                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29397                                  ;
 29398                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29399                                  
 29400                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29401                                  
 29402                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29403                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29404                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29405                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29406                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29407                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29408                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29409                                  
 29410                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29411                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29412                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29413                                  
 29414                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29415                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29416                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29417                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29418                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29419                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29420                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29421                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29422                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29423                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29424                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29425                                  
 29426                                  InitVar:
 29427                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29428                                  	push	ax
 29429                                  	push	cx
 29430                                  	push	di
 29431                                  	push	es
 29432                                  
 29433                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29434                                  	push	cs
 29435                                  	pop	es
 29436                                  
 29437                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29438                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29439                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29440                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29441                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29442                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29443                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29444                                  
 29445                                  	cld
 29446                                  
 29447                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29448                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29449                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29450                                  
 29451                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29452                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29453                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29454                                  
 29455                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29456                                  
 29457                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29458                                  	pop	es
 29459                                  	pop	di
 29460                                  	pop	cx
 29461                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29462                                  
 29463                                  	retn
 29464                                  
 29465                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29466                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29467                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29468                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29469                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29470                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29471                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29472                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29473                                  
 29474                                  FixMem:
 29475                                  	push	ax
 29476                                  	push	bx
 29477                                  	push	cx
 29478                                  	push	dx
 29479                                  	push	es
 29480                                  
 29481                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29482                                  
 29483                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29484                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29485                                  
 29486                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29487                                  
 29488                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29489                                  
 29490                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29491                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29492                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29493                                  
 29494                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29495                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29496                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29497                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29498                                  
 29499                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29500                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29501                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29502                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29503                                  
 29504                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29505                                  
 29506                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29507                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29508                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29509                                  
 29510                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29511                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29512                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29513                                  	inc	bx
 29514                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29515                                  
 29516                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29517                                  
 29518                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29519                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29520                                  
 29521                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29522                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29523                                  	inc	bx
 29524                                  	mov	es,bx
 29525                                  
 29526                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29527                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29528                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29529                                  fmX:	
 29530                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29531                                  
 29532                                  	pop	es
 29533                                  	pop	dx
 29534                                  	pop	cx
 29535                                  	pop	bx
 29536                                  	pop	ax
 29537                                  
 29538                                  	retn
 29539                                  
 29540                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29541                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29542                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29543                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29544                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29545                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29546                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29547                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29548                                  
 29549                                  fm_link:
 29550                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29551                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29552                                  
 29553                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29554                                  	;
 29555                                  	;push	es
 29556                                  	;push	cs
 29557                                  	;pop	es
 29558                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29559                                  	;pop	es
 29560                                  	
 29561                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29562                                  
 29563                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29564                                  	mov	bx,1
 29565                                  	int	21h
 29566                                  	retn
 29567                                  
 29568                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29569                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29570                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29571                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29572                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29573                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29574                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29575                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29576                                  
 29577                                  fm_unlink:
 29578                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29579                                  	
 29580                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29581                                  	;
 29582                                  	;push	ds
 29583                                  	;push	cs
 29584                                  	;pop	ds
 29585                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29586                                  	;pop	ds
 29587                                  	
 29588                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29589                                  
 29590                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29591                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29592                                  	retn
 29593                                  
 29594                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29595                                  
 29596                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29597                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29598                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29599                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29600                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29601                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29602                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29603                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29604                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29605                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29606                                  ;
 29607                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29608                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29609                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29610                                  ;
 29611                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29612                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29613                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29614                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29615                                  ;
 29616                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29617                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29618                                  ;
 29619                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29620                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29621                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29622                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29623                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29624                                  ;     lh
 29625                                  ;     /l
 29626                                  ;     1
 29627                                  ;     1000
 29628                                  ;     2
 29629                                  ;     print
 29630                                  ;     /d
 29631                                  ;     :lpt2
 29632                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29633                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29634                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29635                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29636                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29637                                  ; for:
 29638                                  ;    Each /L
 29639                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29640                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29641                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29642                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29643                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29644                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29645                                  
 29646                                  ParseVar:
 29647                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29648                                  	push	di
 29649                                  	push	ds
 29650                                  	push	es
 29651                                  
 29652                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29653                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29654                                  	cld
 29655                                  
 29656                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29657                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29658                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29659                                  
 29660                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29661                                  	call	isWhite
 29662                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29663                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29664                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29665                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29666                                  
 29667                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29668                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29669                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29670                                  
 29671                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29672                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29673                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29674                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29675                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29676                                  	jne	short pv30
 29677                                  
 29678                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29679                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29680                                  
 29681                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29682                                  	;
 29683                                  	;push	es
 29684                                  	;push	cs
 29685                                  	;pop	es
 29686                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29687                                  	;pop	es
 29688                                  
 29689                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29690                                  
 29691                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29692                                  
 29693                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29694                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29695                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29696                                  
 29697                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29698                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29699                                  
 29700                                  	call	parseL
 29701                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29702                                  
 29703                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29704                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29705                                  
 29706                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29707                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29708                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29709                                  	dec	si
 29710                                  	stc
 29711                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29712                                  	pop	es
 29713                                  	pop	ds
 29714                                  	pop	di
 29715                                  	retn
 29716                                  
 29717                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29718                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29719                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29720                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29721                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29722                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29723                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29724                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29725                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29726                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29727                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29728                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29729                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29730                                  
 29731                                  parseL:
 29732                                  	lodsb
 29733                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29734                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29735                                  
 29736                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29737                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29738                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29739                                  
 29740                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29741                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29742                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29743                                  
 29744                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29745                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29746                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29747                                  
 29748                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29749                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29750                                  
 29751                                  	lodsb
 29752                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29753                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29754                                  
 29755                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29756                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29757                                  
 29758                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29759                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29760                                  
 29761                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29762                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29763                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29764                                  
 29765                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29766                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29767                                  
 29768                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29769                                  
 29770                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29771                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29772                                  
 29773                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29774                                  
 29775                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29776                                  
 29777                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29778                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29779                                  
 29780                                  	lodsb
 29781                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29782                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29783                                  
 29784                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29785                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29786                                  
 29787                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29788                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29789                                  
 29790                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29791                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29792                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29793                                  plE1:	
 29794                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29795                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29796                                  	dec	si
 29797                                  	stc
 29798                                  	retn
 29799                                  
 29800                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29801                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29802                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29803                                  	; cf=1
 29804                                  	;stc
 29805                                  	retn
 29806                                  plSwX:	
 29807                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29808                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29809                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29810                                  	; cf=0
 29811                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29812                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29813                                  
 29814                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29815                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29816                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29817                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29818                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29819                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29820                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29821                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29822                                  
 29823                                  ;incArgc:
 29824                                  	;push	ax
 29825                                  
 29826                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29827                                  
 29828                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29829                                  
 29830                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29831                                  
 29832                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29833                                  
 29834                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29835                                  
 29836                                  	;pop	ax
 29837                                  	;retn
 29838                                  
 29839                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29840                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29841                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29842                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29843                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29844                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29845                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29846                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29847                                  
 29848                                  isEOL:
 29849                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29850                                  	je	short ieX
 29851                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29852                                  	je	short ieX
 29853                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29854                                  ieX:	
 29855                                  	retn
 29856                                  
 29857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29858                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29859                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29860                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29861                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29862                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29863                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29864                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29865                                  
 29866                                  isWhite:
 29867                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29868                                  	je	short iwX
 29869                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29870                                  	je	short iwX
 29871                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29872                                  iwX:	
 29873                                  	retn
 29874                                  
 29875                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29876                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29877                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29878                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29879                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29880                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29881                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29882                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29883                                  
 29884                                  unMarkUMB:
 29885                                  	push	ax
 29886                                  	push	bx
 29887                                  	push	di
 29888                                  	push	es
 29889                                  
 29890                                  	push	cs
 29891                                  	pop	es
 29892                                  
 29893                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29894                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29895                                  
 29896                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29897                                  	
 29898                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29899                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29900                                  
 29901                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29902                                  	jne	short umu10
 29903                                  
 29904                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29905                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29906                                  umu10:	
 29907                                  	pop	es
 29908                                  	pop	di
 29909                                  	pop	bx
 29910                                  	pop	ax
 29911                                  	retn
 29912                                  
 29913                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29914                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29915                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29916                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29917                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29918                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29919                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29920                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29921                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29922                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29923                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29924                                  
 29925                                  stowUMB:
 29926                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29927                                  	jb	short su10
 29928                                  	stc
 29929                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29930                                  su10:	
 29931                                  	push	bx
 29932                                  	push	di
